loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a married woman who has three children with ages ranging from six to 12. She describes herself as an assertive woman. Dorothy has operated a grocery stall where she sells onions, tomatoes, kale, etc. for the past six years. Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are residents from the immediate surroundings. 

Dorothy describes her biggest business challenge as being high transportation costs when purchasing vegetables from external sources. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy vegetables to sell. Her business goal is to operate an additional grocery stall within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable income.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 28-year-old married woman who has two children aged two and seven. She describes herself as a determined woman. Susan has operated a food market stall where she sells bananas for the past three years. Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are local residents. 

Susan describes her biggest business challenge as being stiff competition within the market. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy bananas to sell. Her business goal is to venture into a new retail shop business within five years. Susan hopes that, in the future, she will be a successful business person.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en: Ruzanna is involved in agriculture. Together with her husband, Manvel, she raises cows, pigs, hens, cultivates wheat, potato, and garlic. Ruzanna plans to purchase two more cows and gather more milk. She also wants to purchase thread to collect the wheat harvest, diesel for the tractor, and to renovate it. In order to cover costs for these plans, Ruzanna has applied for this loan. Ruzanna lives with her husband and two sons: 17-year old Marzpetuni and 14-year-old Manuk. Development of the agriculture business will provide a stable income for Ruzanna and her family and allow her to make savings for her sons' education.

loans.use: to pay for two cows, thread, diesel and the renovation of a tractor.

loans.name: Mary Wangeci

texts.en: Mary is a 44-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be an honest woman. She operates a retail stall where she sells cereal such as maize, black beans, and beans, etc. She has been involved in this business for over 20 years. Her business is located within a competitive area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of cereals. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy cereal for resale. Her business goal is to run a big cereal retail store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved her retail stall.

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Petik

texts.en: Petik lives in Mrgavan village with his wife, Ashkhen. The couple is involved in agriculture: they keep cows, pigs, hens, cultivate corn, tomato, as well as grow apricot trees and keep a grape orchard. Petik plans to purchase more chickens, which will allow him to raise them and keep more hens, as well as get income from their sales. With the requested amount Petik will purchase 1,000 chickens. Petik hopes to earn more income and invest in the further development of the farm.

loans.use: to pay for chickens.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 36-year-old married woman who has three children with ages ranging from six to 13. She describes herself as a visionary and diligent woman. Jane has operated a retail business where she sells banana leaves for the past six years. Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are local residents. 

Jane describes her biggest business challenge as being stiff competition in the market. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy banana leaves, fruits and vegetables so she can start a new grocery store business. Jane's business goal is to run a wholesale grocery store within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be an inspirational businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy banana leaves, vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Zeddy

texts.en: Zeddy is a 35-year-old married woman. She has two children with ages ranging from two to seven years. She describes herself to be a risk-taking woman. She operates a tailoring retail store where she provides clothes repair services and sells dresses she makes. She has been involved in this business for seven years and employs two staff members. Her business is located in a densely populated area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the tailoring shop. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a sewing machine. Her business goal is to open more tailoring retail stores within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will diversify her business by opening a retail shop. Zeddy managed to repay her loan amount of KES 15,000 that she had received from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a 38-year-old trader who sells cosmetics at Teshie. She is a single parent whose daughter is seven years old. She sells cosmetics to take care of her child. She buys her items from Accra and sells in Teshie. Cynthia has been doing this work for 10 years but still operates from a table top.

She hopes to have her own cosmetics shop after taking out loans up to a certain level with ID-Ghana. This is Cynthia's fourth loan cycle with ID-Ghana and she has promptly repaid her previous loans. She previously took out a loan of 300 GHS and finished repaying it on 29/06/2012. Cynthia needs this new loan of 500 GHS to expand her business by buying more cosmetics products to sell to customers.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics products to sell to customers.

loans.name: Olega

texts.en:
Olega is a 37-year-old married woman with six children. She would like to start growing cabbages, green beans and cucumbers to earn a living. 

Olega has requested a loan to buy bush knives, fertilizers, weed killer and vegetable seeds. She has been a member of SPBD for one year. Olega will spend her profits to help support her children's education and on improvements for her family.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, fertilizers, weed killer and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Loleta

texts.en:
Loleta is 37 years old and is married with six children. She owns and operates a sewing business venture. Loleta has 23 years of experience in this line of business. 

Loleta joined SPBD in 2011. She needs a loan to buy a new sewing machine, rolls of material, packets of needles, and cartons of thread. She hopes to use her profits to improve her business, to help support her children's education and also for family matters.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, rolls of material, packets of needles, and cartons of thread.

loans.name: Ologalei

texts.en:
Ologalei is a 42-year-old woman who is single with no children. She runs a business selling goods like sugar, salt, canned foods, snacks, washing soap, chicken quarter legs, mutton flaps, and flour in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Ologalei has requested a loan to buy more products like cartons of chicken quarter legs, cartons of mutton flaps, cartons of canned fish, cartons of corned beef, soap, and packets of snacks. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and to help support her family. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy chicken quarter legs, mutton flaps, canned fish, corned beef, soap, and snacks.

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS ANGELES” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nila es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: elaboración y venta de mantas, tejido de chompas, costura de pantalones, venta de verduras, elaboración de mantas de alpaca, tienda de barrio, hilado y venta de lana de vicuña.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nila es una integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de hilado y venta de lana de vicuña; nos cuenta que este negocio lo adquirió cuando se encontraba sin trabajo, pero sabía la elaboración de hilo de vicuña, desde esa fecha ella trabaja en ese negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana de vicuña) mismo que adquiere de las ferias de las provincias y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Los Angeles" [The Angels] is going to start its second round in Pro Mujer, as part of the regional hub of Villa Adela. It has eight members and it's run by a board where Nila is the treasurer. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied and among them there are: making and selling blankets, weaving sweaters, pants sewing, selling vegetables, making alpaca blankets, grocery stores, sale and yarn of vicuna wool.

The loan that are requesting will benefit small micro businesses where Nila is a member. She says that she entered Pro Mujer six months ago, entering by invitation of a promoter of the institution who went to her home. She currently runs a business that yarns and sells vicuna wool. She states that she purchased this business when she was unemployed, because she knew to elaborate vicuna yarn. From that date, she works in the business.

The loan she will receive is to increase working capital (to buy vicuna wool). She buys it in fairs in the provinces and then she sells it in her stall. This way to work allows her to generate resources to support her family in whatever she can, because she cohabits and has two children. When asked about what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy vicuna wool.

loans.name: Eseneiaso

texts.en:
Eseneiaso is a 44-year-old married woman with six children. She would like to start growing taros and bananas to earn a living. 

Eseneiaso has requested a loan to help her purchase tools, fertilizers, etc. She has been a member of SPBD for two years. Eseneiaso will spend her profits to support her children going to school and also to carry out home improvements.

loans.use: to buy tools, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Laamauga

texts.en:
Laamauga is a 35-year-old married woman with three children. She catches and sells fish in her community to earn a living. She has had two years of experience with this business. 

Laamauga needs a loan to buy new fishing nets for her operation. She plans to use her profits to support her children going to school and to help meet her family's needs. Laamauga has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Tuafale

texts.en:
Tuafale is 40 years old and is single with four children. She has been running a small business selling pork buns in her community for the past two years. 

Tuafale has requested a loan to to buy flour, salt, meat, and oil. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tuafale will make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy flour, salt, meat, and oil.

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en:
Makerita is a 48-year-old married woman with 11 children. She catches and sells fish in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Makerita needs a loan to buy new fishing nets for her operation. She plans to use her profits to support her children going to school and to help pay for her family's needs. Makerita has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets.

loans.name: Soo

texts.en:
Soo is 38 years old and is single with no children. She plans to start a business selling flour, sugar, canned fish, snacks, mutton flaps, chicken legs, bath soaps, detergent powder, etc. 

Soo has been a member of SPBD since 2012. She has requested a loan to buy corned beef, herrings, soaps, salt, noodles, etc. Soo will use her profits to help with her family's needs and to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy corned beef, herrings, soaps, salt, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Lipena

texts.en:
Lipena is a 48-year-old married woman with three children. She has three years of experience making and selling pancakes in her community to earn a living. 

Lipena has been a member of SPBD since 2011. She needs a loan to buy flour, oil, sugar, a big new frying pan, and a cooking oven. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and to help support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, sugar, a big new frying pan, and a cooking oven.

loans.name: Sera

texts.en:
Sera is a 36-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation where she grows cabbages, green beans, and tomatoes to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Sera has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, fertilizers, hoses, and vegetable seeds. With her profits, she hopes to support her children's education and her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, fertilizers, hoses, and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Tiare

texts.en:
Tiare is a 37-year-old married woman with two children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Tiare needs a loan to buy sugar, cordials, a carton of flavors, foam cups and a small freezer. She plans to use her profits to help support her children's education and to improve her business. Tiare has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cordials, flavors, foam cups and a small freezer.

loans.name: Iemaima

texts.en:
Iemaima is a 39-year-old woman who is married with three children. She has four years of experience in her small DJ system business. 

Iemaima needs a loan to buy speakers, a set of CDs, a new amplifier system, and a set of system wiring. She will use her profits to improve her business and to help support her children's education. Iemaima joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy speakers, a set of CDs, a new amplifier system, and a set of system wiring.

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en: Isabella is a 28-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from three to 18 years. She describes herself to be a risk-taker. She operates a poultry business where she sells chickens, both layers and broilers. She has been involved in this business for six years and employs one staff member. Her business is located within a highly populated area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her poultry business. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy layer and broiler chickens to resell. Her goal is to improve her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a large scale farmer. Isabella also does farming from which she increases her income.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Varditer

texts.en: Varditer lives in Kapan town with her husband, two sons and daughter. Varditer keeps pigs, hens, and colonies of bees. In order to expand the farm, Varditer wants to add more livestock. With the requested amount, she will purchase two mother-pigs and seven bee colonies. This will allow Varditer to make and sell more agricultural products and earn more income.

loans.use: to pay for pigs and bee colonies.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josphine is a 34-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from two to 18 years. She describes herself to be a disciplined and faithful woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables such as potatoes and peas, etc. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located along a busy road and her primary customers are local residents and the general public passing by the road. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for restocking the grocery store. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy vegetables for resale. Her business goal is to diversify her business by opening a new retail shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve both businesses.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en: Dominic is a 38-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from four to 14 years. He describes himself to be a loving and caring man. He operates a farm where he sells items such as kale, paw paw, maize, mangoes, and tomatoes, etc. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a very productive land and his primary customers are the local and international market. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for restocking the grocery store. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to pay for the last installment on his land; he has been saving on his profits so as to expand his farming business. His business goal is to diversify his business by running a fruit processing plant for selling final products rather than exporting them within five years. Dominic is a priest. Previously, he was self employed.

loans.use: to pay for the last installment on his land.

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en: Tereza runs a shop where she trades flowers, gifts, wedding dresses, and accessories. Tereza started this business in 2010. Due to good service, Tereza has gained her customers love and support and significantly expanded the business. Now Tereza wants to add more variety of goods to her shop. With the requested amount, she will purchase flowers, gifts, and wedding dresses. This will help Tereza attract more clients and stay competitive in the market.

loans.use: to pay for flowers, gifts, and wedding dresses.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en: Armine lives in Goris town with her husband, six-year-old daughter, and pensioner mother-in-law. Armine and her husband run a farm where they raise cows, keep 50 beehives, and cultivate potatoes and beans. Armine has applied for this loan to purchase two more cows. This will allow her to increase profit from cattle breeding and invest for purchasing more livestock.

loans.use: to pay for two cows.

loans.name: Hilda Margarita

texts.es: Hilda de 55 años de edad es una señora muy trabajadora y esforzada, la cual desea mucho salir adelante y contar con una vida mejor, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos  quienes  le ayudan con el negocio. Hilda  posee una venta de desayunos y almuerzos, negocio en el que le va bien debido a que está rodeada de talleres y colegios, sus hijos le ayudan a repartir la comida cuando no están en la escuela. Hilda posee muy buena clientela, ya que tiene muchos años de ganarse la vida de la misma forma por lo que es muy conocida. Ella solicita un préstamo a ITEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima como: maíz, frijoles, queso, carnes, embutidos, bebidas  y otros más. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de aumentar sus ventas y de esta forma contar con una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Hilda, 55, is a very hard-working, strong woman who wants to get ahead and lead a better life, with her husband and two children who help in her business.  Hilda serves breakfasts and lunches, and business is doing well because she is surrounded by workshops and schools.  Her children help deliver her food when they are not in school.

Hilda has a good customer base because she has been earning her living this way for many years and is well-known.  She is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL to buy ingredients such as corn, beans, cheese, meat, sausage, beverages and other items.  This is so she can increase sales and lead a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy beans, cheese, meat and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario tiene 35 años, su esposa es René, con quien tiene tres hijos. La cas donde viven es alquilada, desde hace 2 años.
A él le gusta mucho sembrar, sobre todo por las cosas nuevas que aprende de un ingeniero agrónomo; “es mi vecino y vende fertilizantes naturales, nos enseña a mejorar nuestros cultivos para tener productos orgánicos, naturales”, comenta. Ya tiene 10 años de experiencia en la agricultura, sus terrenos son propios y sus principales siembras son papa, maíz, habas y zanahoria, pero como le alcanza el espacio, tiene que alquilar otras tierras. Cada cosecha la comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, pero en ocasiones, lo hace desde su misma chacra, “todo depende el precio de compra”, afirma. Ahora desea volver a alquilar el espacio que tenía en el mercado de la ciudad, pues de esa manera obtendrá más ganancias. 

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo económico que le permite mejorar su negocio, además de aprender a ahorrar en su grupo, donde los integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.  
Mario invertirá este dinero en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir en sus siembras de papa y habas.
texts.en:
Mario, 35, and his wife René have three children.  They live in a rented house where they have been for two years.  He enjoys crop farming, especially when learning new things as an agronomy engineer.  "A neighbor of mine sells natural fertilizer and he teaches us how to improve our crops with natural, organic products.", he says.  He has been in agriculture for ten years and owns the land he farms on.  His main crops are potatoes, corn, lima beans and carrots, but since he has run out of space he must rent more land.  At harvest time he sells his produce at the wholesale market in the city, but sometimes he sells back on his land, "It all depends on the purchase price.", he says.  Now he wants to rent the space he had at the market in the city, to earn more money.

This is his second loan through MFP and he is grateful for the economic support that allows him to improve business.  Also, he is learning to save in his communal bank, where the members are responsible and supportive.

Mario will invest the money in several sacks of natural fertilizer to spread on his potato and lima bean crops.

loans.use: To buy several sacks of natural fertilizer for his potato and lima bean crops.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam tiene 34 años, está casada con Isau, con quien tiene tres 3 hijos, a los que cuida en la que heredó de sus padres, hace 13 años.
Tiene 15 años de experiencia en la crianza de ganado vacuno y vende la leche que producen. Su trabajo diario comienza en horas de la madrugada, cuando comienza a alimentar a sus animales, limpiar su establo, ordeñar y todo el día darles cuidados especiales porque de eso dependen sus ganancias. Otro de los trabajos de Miriam, es la agricultura, posee terrenos de cultivo donde siembra  papa y maíz.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “San santiago” y este es su segundo crédito con MFP. Está agradecida por la oportunidad de préstamo, pues podrá invertir en su negocio. Por ese motivo promete cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Miriam invertirá este dinero en la compra de un toro para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en:
Miriam, 34, is married to Isau and they have three children, whom they care for in the house she inherited from her parents 13 years ago.  For 15 years she has been in the cattle raising business and sells the milk she produces.  Her work begins in the early morning hours when she begins feeding the livestock, cleaning the stable, milking the cows and spending the entire day giving them the special care they need in order to earn a profit.  Miriam also is a crop farmer and has land where she grows potatoes and corn.

She belongs to the communal bank "San Santiago" and this is her second loan through MFP.  She is grateful for the loan which she will invest in her business.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time.  She will use it to buy a bull to increase her livestock.

loans.use: To buy a bull to increase her livestock.

loans.name: Baddy

texts.es:
Baddy tiene 26 años, vive con sus padres y sus dos hermanas.
Su principal ingreso económico es por el bordado de chalecos. Gracias a este arte que le enseñaron sus padres tiene muchos pedidos, pues ya tiene 3 años de experiencia en este negocio. “Tengo que aprovechar al máximo todos los pedidos que me hacen, ya que las ganancias son buenas”, comenta. Paralelo a ellos, trabaja como albañil, ahora tiene que techar y remodelar una escuela de la ciudad. Los planes de Baddy son mejorar sus ingresos para ayudar a sus hermanas, a las que quiere pagar sus estudios de la universidad. 

Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Mollecito” y este es su primer crédito con MFP, donde está muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su negocio.
Baddy invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de telas, al por mayor, para los bordados y tablas de madera para la obra en construcción que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
Baddy, 26, lives with his parents and two siblings.  His main source of income is making embroidered vests.  Thanks to this craft, that he learned from his parents, he has many orders.  He has been in business for three years.  "I must take full advantage of the orders that are placed, because profits are good.", he says.  In addition to this job he works as a bricklayer, and now is renovating and putting a roof on the city school.  Baddy's plan is to improve his income to help his sisters and pay for their university education.

He belongs to the communal bank "Mollecito" and this is his first loan through MFP, where he is happy to receive this financial support which makes him feel more secure in being able to advance in his business.

Baddy will use the money to buy fabric wholesale for his embroidery, as well as boards for the construction project that is still pending.

loans.use: To buy fabric wholesale for embroidery, and boards for the construction project that is still pending.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 49 años, su esposo hace 23 años es Armando, con quien tiene cuatro hijos, pero ahora sólo viven con una de ellas, Karina. Su casa es propia, la compraron hace 30 años.
Su principal actividad económica es la confección de mandiles regionales para mujeres, por este negocio viaja a diferentes ciudades para vender las prendas por unidad, ya que de esa manera puede obtener mayores ganancias; pero cuando hay festividades recibe pedidos al por mayor. También se dedica a la venta de menestras en el mercado mayorista. Por su parte, su esposo trabaja en el trasporte público con un ómnibus que adquirió gracias a su esfuerzo, con el cual traslada a los pobladores desde su localidad hasta la ciudad principal. Además de ello, sus hijos mayores le mandan una mensualidad, y ella disfruta de verlos independientes y progresando.

Su grupo se llama “Mollecito” y este es su décimo crédito con MFP, por lo que está muy contenta de saber que cuanta con un apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Por lo que promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Antonia invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de materiales para realizar los mandiles. 	¿Qué es lo que comprará con este dinero?
texts.en:
Antonia, 49, has been married to Armando for 23 years and they have four children, although only Karina still lives with them.  They bought their house 30 years ago.

Her main source of income is making regional aprons for women.  In her business she travels to different cities to sell her products because she can earn a higher profit this way.  Around holidays she receives more wholesale orders.  She also sells vegetables to the wholesale market.  Her husband works in public transportation with a van he bought with his salary.  She likes the fact that they are independent and progressing.

Her communal bank is called "Mollecito" and this is her tenth loan through MFP, so she is very content knowing she can count on financial support to help her get ahead in business.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time.  Antonia will use to money to buy materials for her aprons.

loans.use: To buy material to make aprons.

loans.name: Gataiala

texts.en:
Gataiala is a 34-year-old married woman with 1 child.  She would like to start growing taro and taamu to earn a living. Gataiala has requested a loan to start a new plantation. 

She has been a member of SPBD for 1 year. Gataiala will spend her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy grass cutter, knives and weed killers

loans.name: Vinnie

texts.en:
Vinnie is 36 years old and married with 2 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro plants that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Vinnie needs a loan to buy farming tools to extend her business. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. Vinnie will use the profits from her sales to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy knives, wheelbarrow and grass cutter

loans.name: Male

texts.en:
Male is a 26-year-old married woman with 2 children. She would like to start growing taro plants to earn a living. Male has requested a loan to start a new plantation. 

She has been a member of SPBD for one year. Male will spend her profits to buy more farming needs.

loans.use: to buy grass cutter, knives, weed killers and wheelbarrow

loans.name: Sugema

texts.en:
Sugema is a 50-year-old married woman with 8 children. She would like to start growing taro plants to earn a living. Sugema has requested a loan to start her plantation. 

She has been a member of SPBD for 1 year. Sugema will spend her profits to purchase more farming needs.

loans.use: to buy knives, wheelbarrow and grass cutter

loans.name: Fitu

texts.en: Fitu is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She would like to start a small business sewing items like lavalava (a traditional cloth worn as a skirt by men and women) and selling them in her community. In order to do this, Fitu needs a loan to purchase a new sewing machine, roll of material and packets of needles to start her business. She hopes to use her profits to save in her account for family needs. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, roll of material and packets of needles

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 27-year-old married man and the father of two children. 

He works in the construction business and has specialized in cement work since 2000. He was only 15 years old when he started doing this kind of work, whereas he was even younger when he used to work in car body repair to help his family make their living.

Just like every Palestinian living in Lebanon, they don't have a lot of working choices especially inside the camp, so in order to improve his family's living conditions, Rabih started working in repairing car bodies from home in a small place next to his house. To improve this job, Rabih applied for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy the necessary machines and tools required for this business. 

He is working hard to provide his children and family with the best education and living conditions possible. He hopes to open his own car repair shop to expand his work place and increase his income.

loans.use: To start a new business, in order to buy the necessary machines and tools required for this business.

loans.name: Samet's Group

texts.en:
Samet is 33 years old and married. She has five children, four of whom are dependent on her as they are still in school. She and her husband provide for their family from the one hectare of farmland, planting cassava, and one hectare and a half area growing paddy. She has been in this business for fifteen years. 

Samet is a third loan cycle client with Kiva partner VisionFund. She has managed her past loans with success in obtaining better living conditions, especially daily decent food for her family. Now, she is forming a group of two members to apply for a new loan. She and her member are seeking for 1,400,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR, respectively. As the leader, she is going to use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for a tractor’s leasing fee (plowing fee). She hopes to receive better yields so as to earn more income in order to maintain a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for a tractor’s leasing fee (plowing fee).

loans.name: Mavaega

texts.en: Mavaega is a 54-year-old woman who is married with 7 children. She runs a business selling foods in her community. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Mavaega has requested a loan to purchase more goods to expand her business. She plans to save her profits in her account for her business needs. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, flour, salt, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en: Kalala is 36 years old and married with 4 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Kalala needs a loan to buy more tools and chemicals to expand her plantation. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. Kalala will use the profits from her sales to pay her kids' school fees.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, knives, a bush cutter and chemicals.

loans.name: Yoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Originally from the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province, Yoeurn is a mother of four children: two sons who are helping with the family's business, while the remaining two are working for others for a fee. To strive for a living, she has been planting paddy rice on two hectares of farmland as the main source of income. Her husband helps to earn additional income via producing sugar palm for sale. Having been with this business for 26 years, she is able to earn about 17,000 KHR per day in average.  The main challenges which lower her yields are the drought, insects, and the declining price of rice. 

To tackle these challenges, she is forming a group of two female members to seek a new loan. For this cycle, she is the fifth loan cycle and her member is the third loan cycle with Kiva partner VisionFund. The past loans, which she has completely repaid back, have helped her manage her standard of living and helped her husband’s business (buying a high ladder for climbing palm trees and the containers for storing palm juice). 

Now, both of them are seeking a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR. Yoeurn, as the leader, will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She expects to grow her crop timely so as to earn more income in order to save some money to build a new decent house for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
San is 32 years old and a widow mother of one child living in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. To provide the daily basic needs of her family as the single mother, she makes income from one hectare of cassava planting farmland. Besides this main source of income, she also raises pigs additionally. She has been with these businesses for 10 years. 

San's group consists of two female members. Both of them are first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva partner) and are seeking a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will use her loan's portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her rice crop, while a portion of it will be used to buy pig feed. She hopes that the price of pigs and cassava will soon be increased so she can generate more income so as to attain a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her rice crop, and to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Malia

texts.en: Malia is a 78-year-old woman who is widowed with 12 children. She runs a business selling foods in her community. She has many years of experience with this business. Malia has requested a loan to purchase more goods to expand her shop. She plans to use her profits to pay her kids' fees. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy snacks, corned beef, chicken legs, sugar, salt, flour, etc.

loans.name: Moerng's Group

texts.en:
Moerng is a citizen from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. There are three members in his family, including his one daughter. To sustain his household, he and his wife work on one hectare of cassava field and are able to earn about 13,000 KHR per day. Moerng took his first loan with VisionFund in 2011 and has paid back the entire loan with success. The past loan has helped him to relieve his burden and improve his family's livelihood. 

Now, he leads a group of two to seek a new loan. The other member is female and a first loan cycle borrower. Both of them are seeking 500,000 KHR each. For Moerng, he will use his portion to pay for weeding fees for his cassava field. Moreover, he will use a portion of it to buy piglets for raising as extra income. He hopes to make more income from his current business so as to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To pay for weeding fees for his cassava field and to buy pigs for raising.

loans.name: Leiu

texts.en: Leiu is a 56-year-old married woman with 6 children. She would like to start growing taro and taamu (a common root vegetable) to earn a living. Leiu has requested a loan to start her new plantation. She has been a member of SPBD for 1 year. Leiu will spend her profits to buy more tools for her farming needs.

loans.use: to buy a bush cutter, a wheelbarrow, knives, etc.

loans.name: Miriama

texts.en: Miriama is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She wants to start a small business catching and selling fish in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to purchase fishing gear to start her business. In the future, Miriama hopes to continue her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear, a canoe, spears, etc.

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en: Mareta is 42 years old and married with 2 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes and chips in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to start her new business. In the future, Mareta hopes to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy oil, flour, a frying pan, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Khoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Khoeurn, 57, is a mother of two children who currently are independent. She and her family are residing in a rural area of Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She earns a living through cassava planting, the business which she has beewicking for 30 years and is able to earn about 12,000 KHR per day. 

This is her first loan with VisionFund, the same as her group member.  Her group consists of two and she is the group leader. She and her fellow member are seeking a new loan of 500,000 KHR each. She will use her portion to buy rice seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide for her cassava field. She hopes to double her income via her high yields in order to improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide for her cassava field.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 29 years old and has one child. For a living, he runs a motorcycle transport business. He has been in the business for four years. Through Faulu Kenya, he has improved on his saving skills because he has been trained in financial management. He dreams of expanding his business and buying a piece of land in the future. Charles has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi operates a provisions store in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a sprayer for a local farm. Esi has owned her provisions store for 4 years now. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy foodstuffs in bulk for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs in bulk for sale.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi sells limes and also prepares kenkey (local food made out of maize) for sale in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast. Esi has a junior high school education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter. Esi has been selling kenkey and limes for five years. She is responsible for paying school fees, as her husband pays for other household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy maize and limes in bulk. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy maize and limes in bulk.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba is married and has three children. She sells banku (fermented maize and cassava dough) in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast, which she has done for the past three years. Her husband is a farmer. Araba uses her income for paying school fees. Araba will use the loan to purchase cassava and maize in bulk. With the new profits, Araba plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cassava and maize in bulk.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 27 years old and has two children. For the past seven years he has operated a small general store for a living. The family also benefits from his wife’s income as a casual worker. 

Through Faulu Kenya Daniel learned how to run his shop through business management training. He is now applying for a 20,000 KES loan to buy soft drinks, cooking oil and maize flour to stock his shop.

Daniel’s ambition is to expand his business and hire shop workers.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, cooking oil and maize flour

loans.name: Fuaselela

texts.en:
Fuaselela is a 49-year-old married woman with five children. For the past three years, she had made and sold pork buns and donuts in her community to earn a living. Fuaselela has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

Fuaselela is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients and supplies for her business. She plans to save her profits in her account to provide for her kid's fees.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, sugar, vanilla, and other ingredients

loans.name: Faleseu

texts.en:
Faleseu is 49 years old and married with nine children. For many years, she has owned and operated a tailoring business. Faleseu joined SPBD in 2009.

Faleseu is requesting a loan to purchase more sewing tools. She hopes to use her profits to save in her account to provide for her business needs.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, material, packets of needles and other tools

loans.name: Kalameli

texts.en:
Kalameli is a 41-year-old woman who is married with six children.  For the past two years, she has run a business where she sells sugar, rice, flour and other items in her community. Kalameli has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

Kalameli is requesting a loan to purchase more goods to expand her business. She plans to save her profits to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, snacks, chicken legs, flour, oil and other items

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 36 years old. He is married to Ruth and they are blessed with three children aged eight, five and two years. He owns a cereal and retail shop; he has been in this business for the last two years and earns a monthly income of KES.15,250.


He has applied for his first loan of KES.50,000 from KADET LTD. The loan will be used to buy  more cereals and stock for general shop e.g. cooking oil, flour.

The anticipated profits will be used to boost the business and also support the family. His hopes and dreams are to grow the business and also become a wholesale supplier for cereals.

loans.use: to buy cereals and other merchandise for the shop, e.g., cooking oil, flour, rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a dairy unit and buy poultry birds

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex, aged 23 years old, is a resident in Kitale, western Kenya. He produces maize and beans for the local market. He also runs a retails shop within the local market. He is single.

Alex has made a loan request of 31,200 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo and will use to buy and insure a dairy cow. He also plans to increase his farm by buying more land to accommodate more dairy cows. He adds the income will also help him focus on having the best breed of cows in future.

He says his major challenge remains access to better breeds.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Rangua

texts.en:
Rangua is 29 years. He is married and a father of three children aged eight, six and four years.

He has been in the transport business for two years and earns a monthly income of KES 6,000. The loan acquired will be used to repair his motorbike. The anticipated profits will be used in paying school fees for his children.


This is his third loan with KADET LTD and he has successfully repaid the previous loans. His dreams and hopes are to grow his business and also provide for his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to  repair his motorbike

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been in both motorcycle transport business and a clothing business for about four years now , and the businesses are doing well. He wants to purchase 20 bags of beans from the farmers for sale to venture into a new line of business, so he has requested a second loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) for that purpose.

The profit he makes will aid him in buying maize and opening a cereals shop. His dream is to see his businesses prosper and to venture into many other forms of business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags of beans for sale.

loans.name: Sreytouch's Group

texts.en:
Sreytouch is 41 years old. She is originally from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. Her family consists of five members including her three children. However, Sreytouch only needs to support two out of her three children who are still in school. She and her husband work farming rice and cassava on their six hectares of farmland and are able to earn about 56,000 KHR per day. Sreytouch's main business challenge is the dwindling price of cassava as this affects her daily income.

Sreytouch is the leader of a two-person female loan group. Her group is a new client of the Kiva partner VisionFund. Sreytouch is requesting a 1,000,000 KHR loan and her fellow member is seeking 900,000 KHR. She will use her loan to pay the weeding fee for her cassava and will use a portion to buy rubber tree seedlings to sell for additional income. Sreytouch expects to upgrade to a better lifestyle for her family via increasing her income from her current businesses.

loans.use: to pay the weeding fee for her cassava and to buy rubber tree seedlings

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus lives in Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. He is married and has four children. He owns a tea tree farm from which he extracts oil and sells it. Besides this, Justus also plants maize, potatoes and beans on a small scale and does cattle and poultry farming. He started the business through his own savings.

Justus learnt about Milango through an employee who invited him to the group and he joined the group with an aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. The main challenges he faces are finding customers and seasonal weather.

Justus is applying for a loan of 10,832 Kenya shillings to buy seedlings for the business. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to expand the business and improve his livelihood. His future plan is to become a large-scale farmer in the tea tree business.

loans.use: To buy seedlings for the business.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is widowed with four children and three of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). 
Nuru has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings (UGX)  from Kiva partner MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. In addition to her charcoal business she generates additional income through selling piped water and rental rooms. She works from home and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis, seven days a week. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. 
Nuru aspires to become a wholesaler and to build more rental rooms. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, food for the family and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all her children  go to school. She does not take care of any additional family members. She sells popcorn  from home. She has been in business for the last eight years. She works seven days a week. 

Sarah has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bags of maize for making popcorn. She generates additional income through selling charcoal. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goal and asipiration is to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and her family has no access to piped water or electricity.  Her major expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more maize for making popcorn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for opperating expenses to open a skate shop.

loans.name: Moemoe

texts.en:
Moemoe is 43 years old and married with five children. For the past two years, she has grown taro and banana in her small garden. Moemoe sells her produce in her community or at the local market. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011.

Moemoe is requesting a loan to purchase more tools and chemicals to expand her production. She will the use the profit from her loan to save for her kid's education.

loans.use: to purchase knives, a wheel barrow, a bush cutter, and weed killers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken manure, chemicals, and veggie seeds

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy is a 40-year-old married woman. She has five children whose ages range from four to 21 years. She describes herself as an influential woman. She operates a farm where she sells vegetables such as cabbage, kale and tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for two years and employs one staff member. Her business is located in a less-competitive area and her primary customers are local residents, hotels, and wholesalers. She identifies her biggest business challenge as problems of transporting her vegetables to the customers. In addition, Emmy also runs a retail shop where she sells flour, sugar, salt etc  and a tailoring business. 

Emmy will use the KES 5,800 loan she has requested to buy a solar lantern for use in her house for lightning. Her business goal is to improve her business by exporting her vegetables to other countries within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy a solar lantern.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 61-year-old married man. He has 6 children. He describes himself to be an ambitious man. He operates a retail store where he sells household items such as sugar, flour, rice, etc.  He has been involved in this business for 2 years and employs 1 staff member. His business is located within a populated area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high cost of transportation.

James will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy three bales of flour.  His business goal is to run a retail shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have opened another retail shop .

loans.use: buy flour to resell

loans.name: Leydi Carolina

texts.es: Leydi, de 26 años de edad, es madre soltera, y vive en Olanchito, Yoro junto a su hijo y una hermana. Hace 8 meses que Leydi, inicio su propio negocio de venta de ropa usada, vende blusas, pantalones jeans, shorts, camisetas, ropa interior. También algunos productos de achinería. Anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa privada y por necesidad de obtener más ingresos decidió establecer este negocio. Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar más ropa nueva e incrementar las ventas. Con esta inversión se fortalecerá el negocio y va satisfacer a sus clientes. Su meta es mejorar cada día que pasa y llegar a tener una tienda fuerte.
texts.en:
Leydi, age 26, is a single mother.  She lives in Olanchito, Yoro, with her son and a sister.  Leydi started her own business of selling used clothes eight months ago.  She sells blouses, pants, jeans, shorts, t-shirts, and underwear.  She also sells some knick-knacks.

She previously worked for a private company.  However, she needed more income, so she decided to establish this business.

She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes and increase her sales.  This investment will strengthen her business and satisfy her customers.  Her goal is to improve each day and to have a stable store.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes to stock her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 20 años, es soltera, pero tiene una pequeña hija llamada Verónica. Vive en la casa de sus padres.
Ella se dedica a la confección y bordado de faldas típicas, desde muy pequeña aprendió el oficio familiar. Ya tiene 3 años de experiencia en hacerlo independientemente y en este tiempo logró obtener una máquina industrial. “Tengo mayor ingreso económico con los bordados de faldas a mano, me tardo un promedio de un mes y logro ganar mil soles, promedio, por falda”, comenta. Ahora ya comenzó la temporada festiva donde tiene muchos más pedidos de faldas para que bailen los pobladores en la festividad, por lo que contrató a su tía para que le ayude, espera obtener buenas ganancias.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Mollecito” y este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio.
Elizabeth invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de hilos y telas, al por mayor, para la elaboración de sus bordados.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 20 years old and is single but she has a small daughter named Verónica.  She lives in her parent’s home.  She makes a living in the tailoring and embroidery of traditional skirts; from a very young age she learned the family trade.  She already has three years of experience in doing so independently and at this time she managed to obtain an industrial machine.  “I have a greater income with the hand-embroidered skirts, it takes me an average of a month and I manage to earn a thousand soles (PEN), on average, per skirt,” she comments.  Now she has already begun the holiday season during which she has many more orders for skirts for the inhabitants of her town to dance in the festivities, for which she hired her aunt to help her.  She hopes to obtain a good profit.

She belongs to the communal bank “Mollecito” and this is her first loan with MFP, for which she is very happy to know that she will have financial support in order to move forward with her business.  Elizabeth will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of wholesale threads and fabrics for the production of her embroidery.

loans.use: to buy wholesale threads and fabrics for the production of her embroidery.

loans.name: Mataloa

texts.en:
Matalaoa is 32 years old and married. She has four children.
 
She has a small garden where she grows cabbages, tomatoes, cucumber and pi that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. 

Matalaoa needs a loan to purchase more seeds and tools to expand her business. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. Matalaoa will use the profits from her sales to save in her account for the business's needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds, a wheelbarrow, a bush cutter and knives.

loans.name: Faivavale

texts.en:
Faivavale is a 50-year-old married woman with five children. She would like to start growing cabbages, tomatoes and cucumbers to earn a living. 

Faivavale has requested a loan to buy a bush cutter, seeds, knives and weed killers. She has been a member of SPBD for one year. Faivavale will spend her profits on paying her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bush cutter, seeds, knives and weed killers.

loans.name: Mafa

texts.en:
Mafa is a 58-year-old woman who is married with seven children. She has a small sewing business. She has had this business for two years. 

Mafa needs a loan to buy a new sewing machine, needles, thread and fabric. She will use her profits to expand the business. Mafa joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, needles, thread and fabric.

loans.name: Fiaoo

texts.en:
Fiaoo is 31 years old and married with two children. For the past four years, she has owned and operated a small store where she sells items such as rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, and other products. Fiaoo became a member of SPBD gain access to capital for her business.

Fiaoo is requesting a loan to stock her shop. She hopes to use her profit to buy her children new stationery.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil, soft drinks, snacks, and other items

loans.name: Saele

texts.en:
Saele is a 48-year-old married woman with five children. For the past two years, she has had a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes to earn a living. Saele joined SPBC at the start of this month.

Saele is requesting a loan to buy seeds and new equipment. She hopes to rebuild her Samoan fale (house) with her profits.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, a shovel, and a bush cutter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is a married man. He has 8 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 24 years. He describes himself to be a focused and committed man. 

Johnson operates a retail business where he sells building bricks. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in an agricultural area and his primary customers are local customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of bricks. He will use the KES 8,700 loan to buy a water tank for his family use. His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years.  

Johnson also has a farm where he sells cereals such as maize, coffee, etc. He plans to export his cereals and practice horticultural farming.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: La's Group

texts.en:
La is a 50-year-old mother of four children; one son still depends on her as he is still in school. The rest of her family is living in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province in which both rice and cassava planting are the common business for the villagers. Not much different from her neighbors, she also manages two hectares of farmland for growing rice and another one hectare area for growing cassava. The current business earns her about 28,000 KHR per day. 

Her main challenge is the dropping price of cassava. La has been with VisionFund since 2010 as the first loan cycle. She has used her past loan with success in better supporting her family. Now, La is in a group of two taking out a new loan. She and her co-member are applying for the same amount, 500,000 KHR each. 

As the group leader, La will use her loan portion to pay the weeding fee for her cassava field. She hopes to grow her cash crop healthfully so as to make a larger income to support her family.

loans.use: To pay the weeding fee for her cassava field.

loans.name: Sofai

texts.en:
Sofai is a 60-year-old married woman with three children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Sofai has requested a loan to buy chemicals, sprayers, shovels and fertilizers.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Sofai hopes to buy new school uniforms for her children.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, sprayers, shovels and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lavalenesi

texts.en:
Lavalenesi is 40 years old and married with seven children. She runs a small business selling popcorn in her community. She has been doing this for four years. 

Lavalenesi has requested a loan to buy corn seeds, oil, salt and plastic bags for her popcorn-selling business. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Lavalenesi will help pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, oil, salt and plastic bags for her popcorn-selling business.

loans.name: Petronella

texts.en:
Petronella is a 33-year-old married woman with one child. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years.

Petronella has requested a loan to buy chemicals, crops and shovels. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Petronella hopes to renew her family's home.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, crops and shovels.

loans.name: Tusigaigoa

texts.en:
Tusigaigoa is 39 years old and married with two children. For the past four years, she has owned and operated a small store where she sells items such as snacks, soft drinks, rice, sugar, and other products. Tusigaigoa became a member of SPBD gain access to capital for her business.

Tusigaigoa is requesting a loan to buy some more stock. She hopes to use her profit to re-paint her shop.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, rice, sugar, salt, and snacks

loans.name: Maryann

texts.en:
Maryann is 31 years old and married with a child. For the past three years, she has been making and selling elei (traditional printed cloth) to earn a living. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

Maryann is requesting a loan to buy paint, fabric, and brushes. She plans to use her profit to help with her child's education.

loans.use: to buy paint, brushes and fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 12 years to 23 years. She describes herself to be ambitious and determined. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 15 years and employs 6 staff members. Her business is located in a high-traffic area, and her primary customers are schools, churches, business owners, and local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of cow food. She will use the Kes 74,800 loan to buy a water tank for family use and cow feeding. Her business goal is to own 100 cows for milk within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business and grow it into a dairy company. Helen also does farming. She had taken out five loans from SMEP DTM which she managed to repay.

loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 21 años, vive con su madre, Felicitas, y su hermana Carmen.
Su principal actividad económica la realiza gracias a que tiene dos vacas que le brindan la leche necesaria para la elaboración de queso, mantequilla y yogurt,  los cuales envasa para comercializarlos en el mercado de la ciudad. Recién tiene 6 meses en este negocio, le está yendo muy bien, tanto que no se abastece con su propia producción por lo que tiene que comprar productos lácteos de otras personas. Ahora desea ahorrar todo el dinero necesario, pues tiene planeando estudiar una carrera superior el próximo año y de esa manera ser un ejemplo para su hermana menor.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y está segura que con este apoyo financiero podrá continuar con sus objetivos. Promete, una vez más, cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Sonia invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una máquina para envasar sus productos lácteos, ya que hasta ahora lo hace de forma artesanal.
texts.en:
Sonia, age 21, lives with her mother, Felicitas, and her sister, Carmen.  Her main business activity, which she does thanks to having two cows that provide the needed milk, is making cheese, butter, and yogurt.  She packages them and sells them at a market in the city.  She has had this business for six months, and it is going very well for her.  It is going so well that she cannot stock up with her own production.  Therefore, she has to buy dairy products from other people.

She now wishes to save all of the money she needs.  She plans to study for an advanced career next year.  This way she will be an example for her younger sister.

This is her third loan with MFP.  She is sure that with this financial support she will be able to continue with her objectives.  She pledges, once more, to make her payments.  It pleases her to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people.

Sonia will use the requested money to buy a machine to package her daily products.  Up until now she has been doing it by hand.

loans.use: to buy a machine to package her daily products because up until now she has been doing it by hand.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a 34-year-old married woman. She has 4 children whose ages range from 10 years to 17 years. She describes herself as an aggressive woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables such as sugarcane, onions, and kale. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located within a busy environment and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as weather changes the can lead to quick spoiling of vegetables. She will use the requested KES 8,700 loan to buy a water tank for her family use and business in cleaning the vegetables. Her business goal is to diversify her business into charcoal selling within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will run a big retail store for her charcoal business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a married woman. She has eight children with ages ranging from 15 to 30 years.

Priscilla describes herself to be an aggressive woman. She operates a farm where she sells maize and beans. She has been involved in this business for 20 years and employs two staff members. Her business is located within an agriculturally fertile area and her primary customers are farmers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor infrastructure of roads, leading to poor accessibility of her business premise.

She will use the loan of 8,700 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy a water tank for her family household activities. Her business goal is to be a large-scale farmer within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Seutaatia

texts.en:
Seutaatia is 31 years old and married. She has five children.
 
She has a small garden where she grows taro plants that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years.

Seutaatia needs a loan to buy more tools to expand her plantation.
 
She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. Seutaatia will use the profits from her sales to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy seeds, weed killer, bush cutters and knives.

loans.name: Pha's Group

texts.en:
Pha, 34, is a mother two children, one daughter and one son, who are still in school. To strive for her family, she has been growing rice for 16 years as the main source of income. Her husband also helps to generate additional income through cow raising and working for others for a fee. She can earn about 21,000 KHR per day from the current business. 

This is her second loan with Kiva partner,VisionFund. With success, she has managed to pay back the entire past loan, which has enabled her to better support her family, especially by keeping her children in school. 

Now, she leads a group of two female members to apply for a new loan. Her requesting amount is 1,200,000 KHR, while her co-member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. 

As the group leader, Pha will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for the harvesting fee. She hopes to receive more yields and earn more income in order to keep her children in school until tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for the harvesting fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Pamata

texts.en:
Pamata is 38 years old and married. She has one child. 

She wants to start a small business making and selling BBQ in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to start her new business. 

In the future, Pamata hopes to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy chicken legs, soy sauce, sausages and onions.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa continues her mat and basket selling business which she intends to expand using the requested loan. She is always active and helping her children. Her husband also continues working as a farmer. They are both improving their house.

With this new loan Mejumaa will buy mats and baskets for sale. She is anticipating for high profits that will enable her to expand her business. This will make the family more comfortable and safer.

She lives in her mud and thatched house that lacks electricity; neither does it have piped water. However, Mejumaa has faith that she will one day own a permanent house with all facilities.

loans.use: to buy mats and baskets for sale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 51-year-old married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 16 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be a humble and faithful woman. 

Jane operates a general store where she sells items such charcoal and kerosene. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough space for storage of charcoal and kerosene. 

Jane will use the KES 11,100 loan to buy a water tank for her family household chores such as cooking etc .  This is her second loan, and she has managed to repay her earlier loan of KES 20,000. Her business goal is to run a petrol station within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have expanded her business. Jane also does farming.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married mother of four children. She resides with her husband in Kisauni, Coast Province, Kenya. She has been running a dressmaking shop for more than seven years, earning approximately 200 KES per day. Her husband is a plumber and he contributes to the family's basic needs with his earnings. Her child is still in her care and in school. 

In order to improve her business, Rehema is requesting a loan of 15,000 KES to purchase more cloth to produce more clothes to sell. By doing so, she will earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth to produce more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies like sawdust, sand, and material to ignite the oven in order to make bricks.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Bahati. She is widowed and has eight children, six of whom are in school.

In 2000, Bahati established her butcher business. She began her business because she wants to support her children’s education. This business is her only source of income. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about KES 15,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of KES 30,000. Bahati requires a loan in order to buy more meat for sale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits. 

In the future, Bahati plans to open other butcher shops.

loans.use: to buy more meat for sale.

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is a retailer by trade. She carries out her business alone in her store and sells charcoal and firewood. Since her last loan, she has been able to open a vegetable stall to diversify her businesses. 

In order to strengthen her capacity and become the best in her neighborhood, Esha, who has already had two micro-loans from Yehu, is requesting a third loan so that she can buy more stock of charcoal and firewood, as well as vegetables for resale. With what remains of her income, she would like to save enough to continue diversifying her sources of income and ensure a good future for all her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal and firewood, as well as vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Limalau

texts.en: Limalau is 32 years old and married with four children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pork buns and donuts in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to purchase more ingredients. In the future, Limalau hopes to continue her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make pork buns and donuts, such as oil and flour.

loans.name: Chhorn's Group

texts.en:
Chhorn is 35 years old. She has four sons who are students in the local public school. 

To make a living, she is a paid worker and her husband is a security guard. Having been in the job for 10 years, she is able to earn about 13,000 KHR per day. 

She wants to have a proper shelter for her family, so she is seeking a new loan with VisionFund. Her group consists of two members and both of them are first loan cycle clients. They are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. 

As the leader, Chhorn will use her loan portion to buy necessary construction materials for building her house (cement, roof, bricks, sand, wooden boards etc.). She hopes to own a decent house for her family so she can focus on earning income for her children.

loans.use: To buy material for constructing a decent house.

loans.name: Aimalefoa

texts.en:
Aimalefoa is 40 years old and married. She has four children.
 
She has a small garden where she grows cabbages, tomatoes and cucumbers that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. 

Aimalefoa needs a loan to purchase more seeds and tools to expand her business.

She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. Aimalefoa will use the profits from her sales to save in her account for the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy vegetables seeds, knives and plastic bags.

loans.name: Autasia

texts.en:
Autasia is 28 years old and married. She has three children. 

She wants to start a small business making and selling donuts and pork buns in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to begin her business. 

In the future, Autasia hopes to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, sugar, vanilla flavour and yeast.

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en:
Akenese is a 64-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small plantation and grows cabbages to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Akenese has requested a loan to buy some insect poison, shovels, and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Akenese hopes to buy her children some new uniforms for school.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, shovels, and a wheel barrow for her cabbage farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol tiene 45 años, vive junto a sus padres y su hermana menor, en la casa de su madre.
Tiene 23 años de experiencia en la venta de abarrotes, su tienda es una de las más antiguas de su localidad. Pero su principal actividad económica es la agricultura, ya tiene 15 años de experiencia en la siembra de productos como alverja, maíz, papa y alfalfa (básicamente para la alimentación de sus animales). Sus terrenos agrícolas son herencia de su madre y durante la siembra contrata peones para que le ayuden en el trabajo de la tierra. Ya en la cosecha vende sus productos a los compradores que llegan a su propio terreno, pero hay temporadas en las que baja el precio y ella tiene que llevar a vender sus productos al mercado.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “San santiago” y este es su crédito número 11 con MFP, por lo que agradece el préstamo, pues podrá invertir en su negocio. Promete cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas y además le gusta trabajar con su grupo, pues todas son vecinas de su barrio y se apoyan entres sí.
Marisol invertirá este dinero en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus sembríos de papa y maíz.
texts.en:
Marisol is 45 years old and lives with her parents and younger sister in her mother’s house. She has 23 years of experience selling groceries. Her store is one of the longest-established in her area. Her principal economic activity, however, is farming and she has 15 years of experience cultivating products such as peas, corn, potatoes and alfalfa (basically as feed for her animals). Her agricultural lands are a bequest from her mother and during the planting season she contracts laborers to help her work the land. During the harvest she sells her products to buyers who come to her, however there are seasons when the price falls and she has to take her crops to sell at the market.

She belongs to the San Santiago Communal Bank and this is her eleventh loan from MFP. Thus she is grateful for the loan since she will be able to invest in her business. She promises to make her payments on time and enjoys working with her group since all are her neighbors and they are mutually supportive of one another. Marisol will invest this money in the purchase of natural fertilizers to spread in her potato and maize fields.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizer to spread in her potato and maize fields.

loans.name: Vaaitino

texts.en:
Vaaitino is a 33-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Vaaitino has requested a loan to buy crops, chicken manure, seeds and gloves. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Vaaitino hopes to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy crops, chicken manure, seeds, and gloves.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a 37-year-old married woman with seven children. She has a small vegetable garden and grows long and short beans, tomatoes and cabbages to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Anne has requested a loan to buy some seeds, chemicals and equipment. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Anne hopes to expand her business within her village.

loans.use: to buy seeds, chemical, shovels, and gloves.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Yanett

texts.es:
