Yanett tiene 40 años, vive con sus dos hijos: Milagros y Sharon, en la casa que le heredaron sus padres.
Desde niña aprendió a trabajar con esfuerzo y coraje en la agricultura, aún no posee terrenos propios, pero ya tiene 14 años de experiencia; sus principales sembríos constan de papa, maíz y zanahoria, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero, todos los días, desde las primeras horas hasta el anochecer. “Ya tengo compradores fijos, quienes llegan a mis chacra para comprar la cosecha íntegra”, afirma. 

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “San Santiago” y este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece la oportunidad brindada y por ese motivo promete cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. 
Yanett invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de semilla de maíz y fertilizantes orgánicos para esparcir entre sus sembríos de papa y maíz.
texts.en:
Yanett is 40 years old and lives with her two children, Milagros and Sharon, in the house she inherited from her parents. As a child she learned how to do hard agricultural work, however she still does not own her own agricultural land although she has 14 years of experience as a farmer. Her principal crops are potatoes, maize and carrots, which she very carefully tends every day from the early hours until dusk. “I have established buyers who come to the farm to buy the entire harvest,” she states.

She belongs to the San Santiago Communal Bank and this is her first loan from MFP. She is grateful for the opportunity provided and promises to make her payments on time. Yanett will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of corn seeds and organic fertilizer to spread in her potato and corn fields.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Peka

texts.en:
Peka is a 51-year-old married woman with one child. She has a small plantation and grows bananas and taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Peka has requested a loan to buy some chemicals, gloves, and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Peka hopes to buy her child a new uniform.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, gloves, and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, plastic bags, pot plants and seeds.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara is a 27-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. 

Barbara has requested a loan to buy some chemicals, shovels and sprayers. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Barbara hopes to refurnish her entire house.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, shovels and sprayers.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a 22-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Rosita has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, shovels, etc. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Rosita hopes to buy new roofing iron for her home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, chemicals and shovels.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve his parents' house by putting in floors and painting it

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is 50 years old and married with six children. She runs a small business selling ice cake in her community and has been doing this for three years. 

Sofia has requested a loan to buy sugar, foam cups, cordial and a mixer. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Sofia will help pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salts, form cups and cordial.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is 33 years old and lives in Rambutan, Jakarta. She has two children of school age.

Laila has a game arena at a night carnival. She established her business in 2004, and her husband helps her to run this business. She has good experience in this field and a good reputation in her local community. 

She is requesting a 7,000,000 IDR (Indonesian rupiahs) loan to buy a generator set. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits so she can be able to provide her family with a better life. She dreams of having her own night carnival. 

This photo was taken with her husband as her partner in her business.

loans.use: to buy a generator for her game arena.

loans.name: Olomian

texts.en:
Olomian is in her 30s, is married and lives in Jakarta. She is blessed with two children.

Olomian explains that her grocery store is situated for stability and growth.

She is requesting a loan 3,500,000 IDR (Indonesian rupiahs) to purchase more and varied food items (e.g., rice, eggs, sugar, oil) to sell in the store. She expects that the loan proceeds will allow her to bring in more customers and to thereby generate more sales. 

She dreams of becoming a successful businesswoman so that she will be able to give her children a good future, which is why she works so hard. In the future, she hopes to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy more food items, rice, gas, oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Mahoudjro 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUDJRO 1 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies résidant dans un même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Djima Marthe est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Djima Marthe est âgée de 44 ans et est mariée à un certain Paul. Le couple a cinq enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Djima Marthe vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges du ménage. Pour contribuer aux différentes charges, Djima Marthe vend de la nourriture (haricot préparé) à son domicile. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Djima Marthe s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Djima Marthe sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUDJRO 1, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group MAHOUDJRO 1 consists of three members who are friends and live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is Djima Marthe, seen with her hand raised in the photo. 

Djima Marthe, age 44, is married to a man named Paul, and the couple have five dependent children, some of whom go to school. They support another child in addition to their own children. Djima Marthe and her husband live together with their children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. To that end, Djima Marthe sells a bean dish from her home. This activity allows her to support herself fairly easily. She buys her supplies at a market in Benin. 

To achieve customer satisfaction and to bolster her sales and revenue, Djima Marthe is seeking a third loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the group MAHOUDJRO 1. This credit will help them to strengthen their activities, expand their customer base and increase their revenue. Both past loans were successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy beans, palm oil, and groundnut oil.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
This is Abigail, she has successfully completed her training with Zoona to start running her own mobile money transfer business as a champion agent. This is her story.

My name is Abigail. I am 25 years old and I will be getting married next year. Both my parents are retired and I have five siblings. I need the Kiva loan so that I can start running my own Mobile money transfer shop.

I am very excited to have this opportunity to finally start running my own business because I have always had a passion to run my own business. Before the training, I used to help out my brother in his shop and that is where I acquired my interest in running businesses. I also previously worked as a waitress at a gas station for a year. There I learnt how to interact with people from all walks of life. I think this experience has put me in a good position to deal with customers.

I am asking for the Kiva loan so that I can purchase a trading booth, pay for my ground rates where I will place my trading booth, and make sure that the trading booth is branded and well furnished so that my customers will have a place to sit. With this loan I will also be able to buy phones, receipt books and some T-shirts so that customers can feel confident to transact with me.

Getting the Kiva loan means I get to set up my own shop. This will change my life in so many ways because I will finally be able to make my dream of running my own business come true. It will also put me in a position in which I can help my parents who are both retired.

loans.use: to purchase a trading booth, furniture, and pay for ground rates.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga tiene 45 años, vive en compañía de su esposo e hijos, en la casa que heredó de sus padres.
Ella no cuenta con una fábrica para la elaboración de ladrillos, pero ello no fue un impedimento, pues alquilo una. De esa manera comenzó a realizar ladrillos y tejas por ella misma y con la ayuda de su esposo. Espera aumentar la cantidad conforme avance el tiempo y adquieran más experiencia y sobre todo capital de trabajo. Sabe que lo logrará pues ya tiene éxito en la venta de los millares que hacen ahora. Su deseo es comprar la tierra donde elabora los ladrillos y así no tener más que alquilarla.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Barrio oriental” y este es su crédito número18 con MFP, por tanto agradece el apoyo con el cual logrará cumplir con sus objetivos. Promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, pues lleva muchos años de conocerlos.
Dominga invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de arena y aserrín, en grandes cantidades, para la elaboración de los ladrillos y tejas.
texts.en:
Dominga is 45 years old and lives with her husband and children in the house she inherited from her parents. She doesn't have a workshop of her own for making bricks, but this hasn't been a problem as she rents one. She makes bricks and tiles with help from her husband.

Dominga hopes to increase production as time goes on and they get more experience and have more working capital. She knows that the business will do well as she has already successfully sold the thousands of bricks they've made to date. Her greatest wish is to buy the land where the bricks are made and no longer have to rent the space. 

Dominga belongs to to the 'Barrio Oriental' Community Bank and this is her 18th loan with MFP. She is very grateful for the assistance she has received to reach her goals and promises to make the repayments on time. She is also grateful to be part of her group as she has known the other members for a long time.

Dominga will use the money from this loan to buy large quantities of sand and sawdust to make the bricks and tiles.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of sand and sawdust to make bricks and tiles

loans.name: Tumbuh Kembang 5 Group

texts.en:
Nilawati is in her late 50s with three children. Nilawati has a small business selling cooked food and cookies at a stand in front of her home. She has been operating this business for 12 years. She will use the loan to buy flour, sugar, seasonings and eggs for her bakery and catering business. Her business strategy is to be friendly and helpful to all of her customers. 

Her husband is a retired civil worker and his income is very helpful. She enjoys her business because can help her jobless neighbors work with her. Some of the other group members will use this loan for selling clothes on credit, selling cell phone card refills, and selling daily basic needs in grocery stores.

loans.use: buy wheat flour, eggs, butter and seasonings for catering.

loans.name: Nilam Indah 2 Group

texts.en:
Isa lives in East Jakarta. Her husband is a private employee whose salary is just enough to provide food for the family. Together they have two children, both in school.

She has been running her food business for two years and is part of a group seeking a loan. Isa is wearing an orange dress in this photo.

Income from her business will help support the children's education. She is going to increase her capital and buy a large amount of instant drinks to resell so as to earn more. 

In the next few years, she would like to buy a vehicle from business profits.

loans.use: to buy instant drinks, ice and beverage powders.

loans.name: Seroja Indah 2 Group

texts.en: Nina lives in Ciracas east of Jakarta. She has one child in primary school. With her group, Nina is borrowing 2,000,000 IDR to fund her business of selling kids' toys and to fix her refrigerator, She started her business in 2005. Her business does not always run smoothly. During the month of Ramadan, her business decreases. She wants to expand it through this financing and make her life happy. She is very interested in her business because she loves children so much. She hopes someday she will have a shop and send her child to college. Nina wears a long blue dress in this photo.

loans.use: to purchase toys and fix the refrigerator.

loans.name: Elizabeth Sara

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 69 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de nazca, Ica, Perú. Nazca es una ciudad cuyos pobladores son muy generosos y hospitalarios, tiene un legado en cuanto a cultura, como peruanos estamos muy orgullosos de esta ciudad ya que alberga las líneas de nazca, estas han sido dibujadas en un extenso campo y que eran utilizadas por la cultura Nazca para la agricultura ya que eran una especie de calendario en donde ellos podían saber cuando era la época de lluvia, debido a estas majestuosas líneas esta ciudad alberga cada año infinidad de turistas, asimismo el Perú es muy conocido por su exquisita gastronomía, pero el platillo que le agrada mas a Elizabeth es el riquísimo “Ají de Gallina”, ella nos comenta que comería ese platillo todos los días sin cansarse; Elizabeth estudio hasta el quinto año de secundaria, pero ella hubiera querido estudiar en la universidad administración, debido a que sus padres no tenían los suficientes medios económicos y ella tuvo que trabajar desde pequeña para apoyar en casa. Tiene 3 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 12, 20, 22 el menor cursa el primer año de secundaria y los mayores estudian en la universidad, Elizabeth lucha mucho por sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que es madre soltera y con dedicación los está sacando adelante, ya que ella quiere que sean mejores que ella y que se sientan orgullosos de tener una profesión, así como también que no pasen las penurias que ella vivió desde pequeña.

Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de golosinas, bebidas gaseosas y cervezas, anteriormente ella vendía sus productos solo en su triciclo pero ahorro y ahora tiene unas mesas para que los clientes tomen asiento, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas diarias, puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día y pueden ganar hasta S/. 100, en un día muy bueno puede ganar S/.250, con lo que le ayuda en los gastos adicionales del hogar o los gastos adicionales de estudios de sus hijos. Ella cree que le va bien en su negocio por su dedicación y porque atiende muy bien a los clientes para que siempre vuelvan a comprar sus productos.

Actualmente está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio como golosinas, conservas, sacos de arroz, sacos de azucar, entre otros y con ello obtener mayores ingresos  para mejorar su calidad de vida y tener mayor variedad de productos que ofrecer, así como también seguir ahorrando para cumplir sus mas grandes sueños:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos” y “Terminar la construcción de su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 69 years old and lives in the city of Nazca, Ica, Perü. Nazca is one of the cities whose inhabitants are very generous and hospitable. It has a cultural heritage that we Peruvians are very proud of because it contains the Nazca Lines, which were drawn on an extensive field and used in early  Nazca culture for farming since they were a kind of calendar that foretold the coming of the rainy season. Because of these majestic lines, the city welcomes an infinite number of tourists every year. Perú is also very well known for its gastronomy, however the dish that Elizabeth enjoys most is the delicious “Aji de Gallina,”: she says that she could eat this dish every day without ever getting tired of it. 

Elizabeth studied until the fifth year of secondary school although she would have liked to have studied university administration, however her parents did not have sufficient means and she had to work since very young to help support the household. She has three children, who are 12, 20 and 22 years old. The youngest is in the first year of secondary school and the older ones are studying at the university. Elizabeth struggles greatly to move her children ahead because she is a single mother and through her dedication is helping them succeed. She wants them to be better than she is and feel pride in having a profession and not experience the hardships she has lived through since childhood.

Elizabeth sells sweets, carbonated beverages and beer. Previously she only sold her products from her tricycle but she saved her money and now has tables so her customers can take a seat. She works about 10 hours a day and can wait on up to 30 customers a day and earn up to S/.100. On a very good day she may earn S/. 250, which helps to pay additional household expenses or the additional educational expenses of her children. She believes that her business is doing well because of her dedication and the very good service she provides to her customers so they will always return to buy her products. 

Currently she is very grateful to Kiva lenders since thanks to the support provided her she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business, such as sweets, canned food and sacks of rice and sugar, among other items and thus earn more income to improve her quality of life and have a greater variety of products to sell. As well, she can also continue saving to fulfill her greatest dreams: To help her children become professionals and to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (sweets, canned goods and sacks of rice and sugar, among other items).

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.es:
Rosalinda tiene 33 años, tiene tres hijos: Janela, Merari y Omar.
A pesar de no contar con una fábrica para la elaboración de ladrillos, se esfuerza en trabajar día  a día en el terreno que alquiló para realizar ladrillos por ella misma, con ayuda de su esposo. Recién están comenzando, hacen 10 millares al mes, pero esperan aumentar conforme avance el tiempo y adquieran más experiencia, saben que lo lograrán, pues ya están teniendo éxito en sus ventas. También tienen terrenos agrícolas donde siembran alfalfa y los alquila a los ganaderos para alimentar a sus animales. El deseo de Rosalinda es comprar la tierra donde elabora sus ladrillos para no seguir pagando un alquiler.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Barrio oriental” y este es su crédito número 9  con MFP, por tanto agradece este apoyo con el que podrá cumplir con sus objetivos. Promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, pues lleva muchos años de conocerlos.
Rosalinda invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de ladrillos, chapla y aserrín, además de contratar peones para el quemado de los ladrillos.
texts.en:
Rosalinda is 33 years old and has 3 children: Janela, Merari, and Omar. Despite her lack of facilities for making bricks, she exerts herself day after day, working  on rented land, to make bricks herself, with her husband's help. Recently, they are making 10,000 bricks a month, but they hope to increase this as time passes and they acquire more experience. They know this can be achieved because of their success in sales.

They also have agricultural land where they sow alfalfa and rent their fields to cattle raisers to feed their animals. It is Rosalinda's desire to buy the land where they make bricks so they will no longer have to pay rent.

Rosalinda belongs to the “Eastern Barrio” solidarity group and this is her 9th loan through MFP. She is grateful for this help in meeting her objectives. She promises to comply with her payment schedule and she is glad to be a member of her association, after many years of knowing her fellow members. 

Rosalinda will invest the money in purchasing mud bricks, firewood and sawdust, plus hiring laborers for the brick-baking process.

loans.use: to buy mud bricks, firewood and sawdust, plus hiring laborers for the baking process.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy eggs, meat, and fish to produce cooked food and snacks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy women's clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay her child's school fees and add inventory

loans.name: Ousseynou

texts.fr: Ousseynou est un jeune célibataire qui exerce l'activité d'embouche ovine.Il achète des moutons dans les marchés hebdomadaires  de sa localité, les engraisse puis les revend au bout de quatre mois.Cette activité lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille ainsi qu'à ses propres besoins.Il sollicite un pret de 400000f pour acheter 10 béliers.Son ambition est de toujours renforcer son activité.
texts.en: Ousseynou is a young single man who is in the business of fattening sheep.  He buys his sheep in local weekly markets, then fattens and resells them at the end of four months.  This endeavor allows him to help support his family as well as care for his own needs.  He is seeking a loan of 400,000 XOF in order to purchase ten rams.  It is Ousseynou's ambition to continually strengthen his business.

loans.use: to purchase ten rams

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther tiene 45 años, está casada con Raúl desde hace 19 años, tienen tres hijos, pero ahora sólo viven con dos de ellos: Ángel y Salí.
Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura, siembra maíz y papa. Cuenta con una parcela de terreno agrícola, pero como no es suficiente, por lo que alquila otras para sembrar en gran cantidad. Ya tiene 12 años de experiencia y en todo este tiempo pudo adquirir buenos compradores de sus cosechas. Paralelo a este trabajo se dedica a la crianza de toros y gallinas; mientras su esposo trabaja en una mina donde percibe un salario mensual y llega a casa cada 20 días. Por lo que Esther es la que se encarga de los negocios de la familia.

Pertenece al grupo solidario “Barrio oriental” y este es su décimo crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece este apoyo con el que logrará cumplir con sus objetivos. Promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, pues lleva muchos años de conocerlos.
Esther invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales que le servirán en su próxima siembra de maíz.
texts.en:
Esther is 45 years old, she has been married to Raul for 19 years, they have three children but currently they only live with two of them: Ángel and Salí. Her primary economic activity is agriculture, planting corn and potatoes. She has her own parcel of agricultural land, but it is not sufficient, that is why she rents other lands to plant larger quantities. She already has 12 years of experience and has been able to find good buyers for her harvests. Along with this work, she also raises cows and chickens while her husband works in a mine where he receives a monthly salary and returns home every 20 days. And so, Esther is also in charge of family business. 

She belongs to a group called "Barrio oriental" and this is her tenth loan with MFP and she is thankful for the help she has received with which she has been able to achieve her objectives. She promises to pay all her quotas and she is thankful for being part of this association because she has known them for many years. Esther will invest her money by purchasing natural fertilizers that will help her in the next planting season for corn.

loans.use: purchase natural fertilizers for her next corn crop.

loans.name: Elbrus

texts.en:
Elbrus is a 46-year-old man who is married and has five children. He is an internally-displaced person. He is a farmer and raises seasonal fruits and vegetables in his own garden. He has 10 years of experience in this field. The crops he grows are organic; that's why market vendors respect Elbrus and always come to his place. 

He usually sells crops in the central market or from his yard. He is also a driver, and sometimes takes people from his village to the city. But this is additional work, the main financial income is from farming. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy: many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served at every family's table in Azerbaijan and are also used to make fresh punch. His monthly income is 80 Azerbaijanian Manat (AZN). 

Now he would like to increase his monthly turnover, and for this purpose he applied for a loan of 1500 AZN. He will use the loan to purchase seeds and organic fertilizers. This will be his second loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Fazil

texts.en:
Fazil is a 46-year-old man and IDP (Internally Displaced Person) who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and two children. He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the past 14 years. During these years, Fazil gained enough skills and experience to run the business. He chose this crop business because it is profitable and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. 

People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy; many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every table in Azerbaijan families and also make fresh punch. He usually sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 120 AZN (Azerbaijani new manat).

As these products are in high demand, Fazil wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose, he applied for 1,300 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. This will be his second loan, and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Gulpari

texts.en:
Gulpari is 41 years old, married and has two sons. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) who earns a living by raising seasonal fruits and vegetables. She has been in this field for seven years, which makes her experienced and skilled. Raising crops takes a lot of strength and working in the open air can be difficult, which is why Gulpari relies on help from her family. She is also a teacher in the local school, but her salary is too low to cover her family's needs.

Gulpari usually sells her crop in the central bazaar once every two weeks, and earns 130 AZN a month. In Azerbaijan, people use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy, and many national dishes, like pilau and dolma, are made of vegetables. Fresh fruits are also served on every table in Azerbaijan and are used to make fresh punch. 

She is requesting a loan for 800 AZN to buy seeds and fertilizers. This will allow her to improve the quality of products she raises and increase monthly output. This will be her third loan, and she has repaid the others fully and on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Magbule

texts.en:
Magbule is 22 years old. She is married and has three children ranging from seven months old to 6 years old. She and her family live in unacceptable  conditions in a small village in the Ashkali community. 

The Ashkali community is extremely poor and subject to unhealthy conditions. Magbule cannot even afford to send her children to school, as the cost of school supplies is very high. Traditionally, some residents of this community provide transportation services using a horse. Her husband provides this service and uses his horse to transport goods within the neighborhood. This is currently the only source of income for the family, and he works hard to improve the life of his family.

Recently, they had to sell the horse that they owned in order to generate money they needed. Now, for the third time, they are asking for a loan to buy a new horse. Magbule’s goal is to improve the living conditions of her family and save money for her children’s education. 

She is very happy for this help!

loans.use: To buy a new horse to provide transportation services

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
Sarita is 46 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 22 and 20. In 2000, she established her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. Sarita has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Sarita plans to improve the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Tala

texts.en: Tala is 47 years old, married, and has five children. She has a small garden where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. Tala needs a loan to buy chemicals, taro crops, a plant sprayer, etc. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Tala will use the profits from her sales to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals, taro crops, a plant sprayer and other items

loans.name: Groupe Jubo Ngodjleme

texts.fr: Le groupe "GROUPE JUBO NGODJLEME" se compose de cinq femmes.Elles sont toutes mariées et mères de familles.Elles mènent une activité d'élevage notamment l'embouche bovine.Elles achètent un bœuf qu'elle engraissent et revendent une fois arrivé à maturation.Le chef de groupe (en avant , en blanc)est mère de trois enfants.Elle mène en plus de l'activité du groupe, une activité secondaire d'embouche ovine.Cette activité d'élevage permet aux membres du groupe de subvenir aux besoins de leurs familles ainsi qu'à leurs propres besoins.Elles sollicitent un pret de 750000f pour acheter 2 bœufs.
texts.en: The Jubo Ngodjleme group is composed of five women. They all married, with children. They raise livestock, particularly cattle. They buy cattle to fatten and resell  once the animals are ready for the market. The group’s leader (in the foreground on the photo, wearing white) is the mother of three. In addition to being in the same business as the rest of the group, she also raises sheep as a secondary activity. Raising livestock allows group members to provide for their families’ needs as well as their own. They are requesting a loan of 750,000 West African francs to buy two bulls.

loans.use: to buy two bulls.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 44 años, tiene dos hijos, pero ahora sólo vive con una, la última. Viven en la casa de su hermana.
Cuidar de sus hijas sola, fue difícil, pero con la ayuda de su familia pudo salir adelante. Su principal actividad económica es el bordado de fustanes, que son trajes típicos, cada uno lo vende a 200 nuevos soles y a la semana realiza dos. Pero como buena mujer del campo, por temporadas, siembra papa y olluco en sus propios terrenos agrícolas, cada cosecha la comercializa en la feria de uno de los distritos de la ciudad, también aprovecha esa oportunidad para vender los animales que cría (toros y cerdos). 

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Barrio oriental” y este es su crédito número 15  con MFP, por tanto agradece el apoyo que ha recibido por tantos años (más de 6), y promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente.
María invertirá este dinero en la compra de telas y paños para el bordado, además de fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
María is 44 years old, she has two children but now she only lives with one of them, her youngest. They live in her sister's house. She cares for her daughters alone, it was difficult, but with her family's help she was able to be successful. Her primary economic activity is embroidering slips/skirts, typical dress of the region, each one sells for 200 Peruvian soles and she can make two a week. But like a good country woman, during the right seasons, she also plants potatoes and olluco (a Peruvian tuber plant) on her own land, each season she sells her harvest at a festival in one of the districts of her city, she also takes advantage of this opportunity to sell the animals she raises (cows and pigs). 

She belongs to a group called "Barrio oriental"  and this is her 15th loan with MFP and she is thankful for the help she has received from this group over the years (more than 6 ) and she promises to make her payments punctually. María will invest this money in purchasing cloth and skirts to embroider as well as natural fertilizers for her next harvest.

loans.use: purchase cloth and skirts to embroider and natural fertilizers for her next harvest.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a very hardworking and friendly man of 29. He is married and is an internally displaced person (IDP). Ahmad is cattle breeder and has six years of experience in this field. He gets financial support from government as an IDP but it is too low to cover the family's needs. 

Ahmad usually buys small cattle, raising and fattening them for five to six months, and resells them at the local livestock bazaar. Meat selling brings in 110 Azerbaijanian Manat (AZN) per month. People use beef in everyday national dishes as pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt sauce. 

This is the only income for his family and not enough to cover basic needs of his beloved children. Ahmad applied for 1500 AZN to purchase four calves. This will be his second loan and he has good client history.

loans.use: to buy four calves

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome is 45 years old, married, and has two children. She owns and operates a business making elei (hand printed fabric). She has two years of experience in this line of business. Salome needs a loan to buy materials, paints, etc. She hopes to use her profits to expand the business. She joined SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy materials and paint for making elei (hand printed fabric)

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is 17 years old, single and has no children. For the last two years, she has run a small business making ava, a popular local beverage. She is requesting a loan to buy items she needs for her business, including plastic bags, ava samoa powder and labels. She will use the profit she earns to build up the store where she sells ava powder. She joined SPBD earlier this year to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a beverage-making business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 48 años, su esposo, desde hace 16 años, es Moisés, con quien tienen seis hijos, pero ahora sólo viven con tres de ellos.
Ella se siente dichosa de tener el apoyo de su esposo, quien la ayuda cada vez que puede. Mientras él trabaja como peón en diferentes chacras, ella se dedica al cuidado de sus tres toros y ocho vacas, de las cuales extrae la leche que producen para venderla a los pobladores de su localidad. Su secreto es sembrar ella misma la alfalfa con la que las alimenta, pero también les da comida balanceada y vitaminas para mantenerlas fuertes. Paralelo a esto siembra maíz y papa en terrenos alquilados, sus cosechas las comercializa a los compradores mayoristas. Su deseo es comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas y depender de ella misma.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Barrio oriental” y este es su crédito número 16  con MFP, por lo que agradece este apoyo financiero durante casi 8 años. Por eso promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente, como en sus anteriores créditos.
Esta vez Antonia invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir en sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Antonia is 48 years old, she has been married to her husband, Moisés, for 16 years, with whom she has 6 children but now they only live with three of them. She is happy to have her husband's support, who helps her any time he can. While he works as a laborer in different industries, she is dedicated to raising her three bulls and eight cows, which she uses for milk which she sells to people in her area. Her secret is that she plants the alfalfa that she feeds her animals herself but she also gives them a balanced diet and vitamins to keep them strong. Along with this activity, she also plants corn and potatoes on rented lands and she sells her crops to larger buyers. Her wish is to purchase her own agricultural land and to be self sufficient. 

She belongs to the group "Barrio oriental" and this is her 16th loan with MFP and she is grateful for the financial support she has received for eight years. She promises to pay all her quotas on time, just like her previous loans. This time Antonia will invest her money in natural fertilizers to spread on her crops.

loans.use: purchase natural fertilizers to spread on her crops.

loans.name: Faalataina

texts.en: Faalataina is 45 years old, married and has three children. For the last two years, she has earned a living by running a small canteen in her community. She is requesting a loan to buy bread, buns, snacks, flour and other items. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. Faalataina will use the additional earnings made possible by this loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her canteen.

loans.name: Pola

texts.en: Pola is 36 years old, married and has six children. For the last three years, she has run a small business selling food in her community. She is requesting a loan to buy chicken, fish, bananas, taro, sacks of flour and other items. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Pola will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Tolotea

texts.en: Tolotea is 25 years old, married and has two children. For the last four years, she has run a small plantation where she earns a living by growing taro and bananas. She has requested a loan to buy supplies for her farm, including fertilizer, a plant sprayer and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009 and plans to use her profits to expand business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farm.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: El señor José Antonio  tiene 38 años, es casado con la señora Roxana y tiene 3 hijos dependientes los cuales están en un colegio fiscal de la zona, el cliente termino el colegio pero no logro entrar a la universidad por falta de recursos económicos, vivió con sus padres, los cuales decidieron quitarle la ayuda económica para que su hijo fuese mas independiente. Actualmente alquilo dos piezas junto a su esposa e hijos en la zona de Ticti Norte - Cochabamba, en la casa de su suegra. El solicitante trabaja en el servicio de transporte urbano, tiene 3 años de experiencia, trabaja de lunes a sábado, su principal gasto era el pago diario al dueño del vehículo por alquileres, pero esta situación cambio debido a que se compro su propio vehículo. El crédito que solicita el cliente es para el mantenimiento de su vehículo, esto con el fin de empezar a trabajar en buenas condiciones y no  tener problemas. Esto le permitirá tener mejores ingresos y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
José Antonio is 38 years old. He is married to Roxana and has three dependant children who attend a public school in the area. 

This client finished school but wasn't able to go to college because he lacked the financial resources. He lived with his parents and they decided not to help him financially so that their son would become more independent.

Currently he rents two rooms with his wife and children in the area of Ticti Norte - Cochabamba, in his mother-in-law's house. He works in urban transportation services and has three years of experience. He works Monday through Saturday. His main expense used to be paying daily rent to the owner of the vehicle, but this situation changed when he purchased his own vehicle.

The loan this client is requesting is for maintenance of his vehicle, so that he can start working under good conditions and not have any problems. This will allow him to have better income and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Chimed-Ochir

texts.en:
Mr Chimed-Ochir is 42 years-old. He lives with his wife and four children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Songinohairhan district in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife, Davaanyamtsetseg, is 41 years-old. She is a herder. His older son, Gan-Ochir, is 21 years-old. His younger son, Tumurbaatar, is 18 years-old. His older daughter, Nyamsuvd, is 16 years-old. She is a secondary school. His younger daughter, Otgontsetseg, is 13 years-old. She is  also in secondary school.  

Mr. Chimed-Ochir started an organic dairy production in 2005 with his wife and two sons. He has got 22 cows and his own farm. He sells his organic milk to grocery stores and milk factory at wholesale prices. He is planning to expand his oxhouse. He needs 2 000 000 MNT to purchase building materials to do so.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to expand his oxhouse.

loans.name: Sergelen

texts.en:
Mrs. Sergelen is 38 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a small house in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. Her husband, Batbuyant, is 50 years old. Her older daughter, Norow, is a college student. Her next daughter, Bayanzul, is 19 years old. She is a college student. Her youngest daughter, Saruulbuyan, is 13 years old. She is a secondary school student. 

Sergelen started  her business as a meat seller at a rental counter in local market in 2001 together with her husband. Since 2009 she started to operate an organic dairy products business. In 2012 she graduated from a training course for making organic dairy products. She is planning to repair her house to make a work place to prepare organic dairy products. She has been well-experienced, and a hardworking person. She needs 5,100,000 MNT to buy more organic milk from the countryside.

loans.use: To buy more organic milk from the countryside

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Luz Clemencia

texts.es:
Luz es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y esto le ha permitido salir adelante en la vida a pesar de las grandes adversidades que se le han presentado. Desde muy joven aprendió la actividad de la elaboración de artesanías y vendiendo estas apoyaba a sus padres para que pudieran gozar de una mejor calidad de vida en el hogar. Desde entonces, esta ha sido su fuente de ingresos y gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos tiene muy buenos pedidos por parte de sus clientes. Debido a que se acerca la temporada donde sus ventas aumentan considerablemente, Luz busca un préstamo para comprar insumos y materias primas para la elaboración de las artesanías.

Su mayor sueño es lograr salir adelante y superar las dificultades económicas que se están presentando en su hogar, además de poder ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida en su familia y las mejores condiciones posibles para poder progresar.
texts.en:
Luz has always been a very hard worker and this has allowed her to get ahead in life in spite of having encountered great adversity. Ever since she was very young she learned the art of craft making and helped out her parents by selling her crafts, so that they could enjoy a better quality of life at home. This has been her source of income ever since, and thanks to the good quality of her products she receives many orders from her customers. Since the time of year when her sales increase substantially is approaching, Luz is requesting a loan in order to purchase supplies and raw material to make her crafts.

Her greatest dream is being able to get ahead and overcome the financial problems which have come up at home, as well as being able to offer her family a better standard of living and the best conditions possible so that they can advance in life.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and raw material to make crafts.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: El señor Ricardo, tiene 50 años de edad, es de una familia humilde de escasos recursos económicos por tanto cultiva superficies muy pequeñas, vive en la comunidad de Quebradas del municipio de Mizque del departamento de Cochabamba. Trabaja en la agricultura y la ganadería desde chace 20 años, produce cebolla, frijol y tomate para la alimentación de toda su familia y los excedentes los comercializa en el mismo lugar donde vive a los comerciantes de la misma población de Mizque. El señor Ricardo, es una persona muy conocida en su comunidad, por la dedicación a su trabajo y por ser el responsable de la educación de sus hijos. El señor Ricardo, está solicitando el presente crédito, para comprar más semillas, abonos y agroquímicos, para mejorar la calidad y aumentar su producción y de esta forma tener más ingresos y mejorar las condiciones de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en: Ricardo, 50, comes from a humble family of scarce economic resources which is why he farms on very small surfaces.  He lives in the community of Quebradas in Mizque Municipality, Cochabamba Department.  He’s worked in agriculture and raising cattle for 20 years.  He grows onions, beans and tomatoes to feed his entire family and what’s left over is sold in the same place where he lives to merchants in Mizque.Ricardo is very well-known in his community because of his dedication to work and for being responsible for his children’s education.  Ricardo is requesting the present loan to buy more seeds, manure and farm chemicals to improve and increase his crop yields thus earning more income and to improve his entire family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Orlando De Jesus

texts.es:
Orlando tiene un billar con el que genera los ingresos que requiere en su hogar donde convive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Siempre había soñado con tener un billar y luego de ser empleado durante mucho tiempo, tuvo la oportunidad de montar su propio negocio y ahora puede trabajar en algo que le gusta y su calidad de vida ha mejorado considerablemente. A pesar de esto, las dificultades en su hogar se han venido agravando últimamente, pues su hijo mayor ha empezado a estudiar en la universidad y esto ha traído grandes gastos para su familia, por esto ahora Orlando viene trabajando fuertemente y buscando que su negocio crezca constantemente. Gracias a su esfuerzo, sus clientes han aumentado considerablemente y por esto busca un préstamo para comprar un nuevo billar y realizar mejoras locativas a su negocio.

Su sueño es salir adelante con este negocio y que su familia tenga la oportunidad de progresar económicamente. Además, aspira a que su hijo tenga la oportunidad de cursar su universidad sin ningún inconveniente y logre salir un profesional.
texts.en:
Orlando has a pool hall which generates the income he needs for his home, where he lives with his wife and two children. He has always dreamed of having a pool hall and after being an employee for a long time, he had the chance to open his own business. Now he works doing something he likes and his quality of life has improved considerably. Despite this, the difficulties in his home have gotten worse lately. His oldest son is starting college and this has brought great expenses for his family. That is why Orlando is working very hard and constantly seeking to grow his business. Thanks to his hard work, his customers have increased considerably and that is why he is seeking a loan to buy a new pool table and do improvements on his business' locale. 

His dream is to get ahead with this business and for his family to have the chance to prgress financially. In addition, he aspires to his son having the opportunity to go to college without any trouble and have a good career.

loans.use: to buy a new pool table and do some improvements on the locale of his business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 35 years old and married with two children. 

She has a small garden where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Rosita needs a loan to buy manure, chemicals, a grass-sprayer, gloves, rake, knives, and barbed wire. 

She has been a member of SPBD in 2012. Rosita will use the profits from her sales to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for manure, chemicals, knives, gloves, rake, grass-sprayer, and barbed wire

loans.name: Oscar Felipe

texts.es:
Oscar proviene de una familia con escasos recursos económicos, y para poder apoyar la economía de su hogar desde los 13 años trabaja lavando carros y motos a las afueras de su casa. Gracias a esto ha logrado salir adelante y permitir que en su hogar sus padres y sus hermanos tengan una mejor calidad de vida. En el negocio le iba tan bien, que un hermano suyo le ayudaba a lavar los carros; pero por problemas de salud su hermano ya no puede trabajar con el y ahora todo el trabajo esta a su cargo. A pesar de que no cuenta con unos recursos físicos óptimos para desarrollar su actividad, Oscar con mucho esfuerzo logra sacar todos los pedidos del día a tiempo, y con sus ingresos se está pagando sus estudios universitarios, pero buscando mejorar sus condiciones de trabajo y agilizar la lavada de los carros, Oscar busca un préstamo para comprar una aspiradora, una manguera, e insumos como jabón, cera, trapos, entre otros.

Su mayor sueño es lograr sacar adelante este negocio y que le siga brindando los recursos económicos para pagar su universidad. Además, espera que su familia siga teniendo una buena calidad de vida y gracias a su negocio puedan progresar económicamente.
texts.en:
Oscar comes from a family with scarce financial resources and, in order to help out financially at home, he works washing cars and motorcycles outside his house. He has been doing so since he was thirteen years old, and this has allowed him to get ahead and provide a better quality of life in the home for his parents and siblings.

The business was going so well that one of his brothers was helping him wash the cars but, because of health problems, his brother can no longer work with him and now he is in charge of all the work. In spite of not having all the best material resources he would need for his business, Oscar manages to finish all the orders for the day on time with much effort. He is using his income to pay for his college studies. 

In order to improve his work conditions and speed up the carwashing process, Oscar is requesting a loan in order to purchase a vacuum cleaner, a hose, and supplies such as soap, wax, rags, and other items.

His greatest dream is being able to keep the business going so that it continues to provide him with the financial resources to pay for college. He also hopes his family will continue to have a good quality of life and may advance financially thanks to his business.

loans.use: to purchase a vacuum cleaner, a hose, and supplies such as soap, wax, rags, and other items.

loans.name: Talalupe

texts.en: Talalupe is 31 years old and married with no children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as soap, sugar, flour, snacks, meat, etc. She has been doing this for two years. Talalupe needs a loan to buy a more variety of stock for her shop. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, flour, snacks, meat, etc.

loans.name: Gerson

texts.es: El señor Gerson es una persona trabajadora, vive con sus hermanos, actualmente es se dedica a la agricultura cuenta con cultivos de palmito y yuca en una parcela ubicada en sindicato Chasquis, él se levanta a muy tempranas horas por la mañana para trabajar en su parcela, el cliente solicita un crédito para compra abono orgánico y así poder mejorar un poco su actividad que le ayudara a mejorar un poco sus ingresos económicos y poder tener un poco de comodidad y estabilidad, actualmente el cliente es separado de su pareja hace mas de 7 años, no tiene hijos en la actualidad, cabe señalar que el cliente cuenta con experiencia en esta nueva actividad por que algunos de sus familiares se dedican a este rubro. Esto le ayudara a mejorar su calidad de vida y crecer económicamente.
texts.en: Gerson’s a hardworking person.  He lives with his siblings and currently works in agriculture growing palmetto and manioc on a parcel located in Sindicato Chasquis.  He rises very early in the morning to go work his land.  He’s asking for the loan to buy organic manure to improve his activity somewhat which will help him improve his income a little and be able to have a bit of comfort and stability.  He has been separated from his spouse for seven years and does not have any children at present.  It’s worth pointing out that he has experience in this new activity since some of his relatives are in the same line of work.  This will help him improve his quality of life and to grow economically.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Samuel Humberto

texts.es:
Samuel ha trabajado toda su vida en la actividad de la venta de legumbres y verduras, pues durante mucho tiempo trabajó en la plaza de mercados y de esta manera generaba los ingresos que requerían en su hogar su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Actualmente Samuel tiene su negocio propio el cual atiende desde hace unos 10 años y también está a cargo de sus 2 hijos de 15 y 18 años de edad, pues la madre de sus hijos los abandonó hace un tiempo sin hacer alguna contribución económica para su sostenimiento. Gracias a los grandes esfuerzos que hace en su negocio sus 2 hijos han logrado tener la oportunidad de asistir a una educación de buena calidad, pero ahora que su hijo mayor puede acceder a la universidad está buscando los recursos económicos para brindarle esta posibilidad pero ha sido muy difícil la situación económica. A pesar de esto, Samuel sigue trabajando fuertemente y esto le ha permitido tener muy buenas ventas, por esto ahora busca un préstamo para comprar verduras y legumbres y surtir su negocio para ofrecer a sus clientes una buena variedad de productos.

Samuel espera que sus ventas sigan creciendo para que su hijo tenga los recursos económicos necesarios para asistir a la universidad y poder graduarse de profesional. Su mayor sueño es que su negocio les permita salir adelante y anhela comprarse su casa propia para ofrecer un hogar más estable a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Samuel has worked his whole life in the activity of selling produce and vegetables. For a long time he worked in the market plaza and in that way he generated the income his wife and 2 children needed in his home. Right now, Samuel has his own business which he has run for 10 years. He is raising 2 children, aged 15 and 18, because their mother abandoned them a while ago without making any financial contribution for their support. Thanks to his hard work in his business, his 2 children have been able to have a quality education. Now his oldest son can go to the university. He is seeking the financial resources to offer him that possibility, but his financial situation has been very difficult. Despite this, Samuel keeps working hard and this has allowed him to have very good sales. That is why he is now seeking a loan to buy produce and vegetables to stock his business and offer his customers a good variety of products. 

Samuel hopes that his sales will keep growing so that his son will have the financial resources necessary to go to college and be able to graduate with a career. His biggest dream is for his business to allow him to get ahead and he yearns to have his own home to offer a more stable home to his children.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and produce to stock his business and offer his customers a good variety of products.

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en:
Mareta is a 27-year-old married woman with one child. She has a small plantation and grows taro and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Mareta has requested a loan to buy more crops, a new wheelbarrow, etc. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. 

With her profits, Mareta hopes to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy crops, a new wheelbarrow, knives, and a bush cutter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Clemente Senon

texts.es: Clemente tiene 37 años de edad, tiene 7 hijos de diferentes edad. Clemente es una persona muy trabajadora trabaja brindando mano de obra en la construcción de edificaciones, su trabajo es duro él lo hace para sacar adelante a sus 7 hijos. Él se esfuerza para que todos sus hijos puedan estudiar y logren un futuro mejor. Clemente necesita comprar herramientas para hacer crecer su negocio y de esta manera pueda mejorar su nivel de vida y por sobre todo poder seguir ayudando a sus hijos para que continúen con su estudio. Él está muy agradecido con la gente que por medio de Kiva le pudo dar la oportunidad de seguir adelante con su negocio y de esta manera pueda seguir manteniendo a su familia.
texts.en:
37-year-old Clemente has 7 children of different ages. Clemente is a very hard worker. He works as a laborer constructing buildings, which is hard work that he does in order to raise his 7 children. Clemente strives to ensure that all of his children are able to study and achieve a better future. 

Clemente need to buy tools to grow his business in order to improve his standard of living and above all to continue to help his children continue their studies. He is very grateful to the people who, through Kiva, have given him the opportunity to progress in his business and thus be able to continue to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools for his building business

loans.name: Zamu

texts.en: Zamu is a single mother of six children, and three of her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members.  She has a food stall at the market and sells all types of food items.  She sells to all categories of people on a retail basis and works seven days a week.  She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of tomatoes, baskets of Irish potatoes, onions, and banana clusters.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.   She aspires to see her business grow so that she can open up another stall in the market.  She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include    school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes, baskets of Irish potatoes, and clusters of bananas

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Group

texts.fr: DIEU EST GRAND est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, Edakèmi Romance (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 49 ans et est mariée à un certain Bruno. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Edakèmi Romance a peu fréquenté l’école. Edakèmi Romance vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari, les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de dix ans, Edakèmi Romance vend des chaussures, des bijoux et des produits cosmétiques à son domicile. Edakèmi Romance s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Edakèmi Romance et les autres membres du groupe DIEU EST GRAND sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en: DIEU EST GRAND has three members who are all from the same neighborhood and are a part of the same savings club. The leader of the group, Edakèmi Romance (with her hand raised in the photo), is 49 years old and married to man named Bruno. They have two children with one of their children still in school. Edakèmi Romance hasn't completed much school herself. She lives with her children and husband and together they take care of all the household expenses. For the past 10 years, Edakèmi Romance has been selling shoes, jewelry and cosmetics from her home. She buys her inventory in a Benin city. This is the first time that she and the members of her group have requested a loan from ALIDE. They would like to strengthen the business' working capital in order to better respond to client demand.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, jewelry and cosmetics.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales como chanchos,el socio lo vende en forma ambulatoria en las diferentes ferias,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 8 años en este negocio en sus tiempos libres a la socia le gusta ir a pasear,el sueño del socio es tener un local donde pueda criar los chanchos.El socio solicita el credito para comprar chanchos y alimentos para los chanchos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues with his business of raising pigs and selling them as a merchant in the markets.  He works from 8 am until 6 pm.  He has had this business for 8 years and in his free time he likes to take walks.  His dream is to have a place to raise the pigs and he is requesting a loan to buy pigs and food for them.

He is happy because of the loan and promises to make to payments on time.

loans.use: to buy pigs and food for them.

loans.name: Yulian Esteban

texts.es:
Yulian es un joven emprendedor que a pesar de su corta edad ya ha logrado montar su propio negocio y poder así contribuir en su hogar para que sus padres tengan una buena calidad de vida y mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia. Hace unos 3 años realizó un curso de mantenimiento y reparación de celulares y una persona conocida que tiene un puesto de venta de celulares le permitió ubicarse dentro del local para prestar sus servicios; gracias a esto ha logrado generar los ingresos para su sostenimiento y también brindarles a sus padres la posibilidad de acceder a una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar. A pesar del poco capital con el que montó su negocio, el gran esfuerzo que ha hecho le ha permitido salir adelante, y ahora que requiere la compra de más materias primas busca un préstamo para comprar insumos y repuestos que le permitan atender todas las necesidades de sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es sacar este negocio adelante y algún día lograr abrir su propio local de venta de celulares y seguir prestando el servicio de reparación. Además, sueña con poder contribuir aún más a sus padres para que puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida y superar todas las dificultades económicas que tienen.
texts.en:
Yulian is a young entrepreneur who despite his young age has managed to set up his own business and be able to contribute to his home so that his parents can have a good quality of life and to improve his family’s economic condition.

About three years ago he took a mobile phone repair and maintenance course and a person he knows who has a mobile phone sale stand allowed him to set up in his locate to provide his services there.  Thanks to this he’s generating income for his own support and also to provide his parents with the possibility of accessing a better quality of life and better economic opportunities for making progress.

Despite the small capital used to set up the business the great effort he puts into it has made it possible for him to get ahead and he now needs to buy more raw materials.  He needs a loan to buy supplies and spare parts so that he can meet his customers’ needs.

His greatest dream is to succeed with the business and one day open his own locale to sell mobile phones and continue providing repair services.  He also dreams with being able to contribute still more to his parents so that they can have a better quality of life and overcome all the economic difficulties they have.

loans.use: to buy supplies and spare parts.

loans.name: Uber De Jesus

texts.es:
Uber es una persona que se reconoce por ser muy emprendedora, luchadora y humilde que ha sacado su familia con un gran esfuerzo pese a las dificultades que se le han presentado en la vida. Uber se encuentra casado y tiene 4 hijos a quienes siempre les ha querido brindar una buena calidad de vida, por esto trabaja fuertemente en su negocio el cual es una crianza de gallinas y pollos y la venta de huevos. Este negocio ha sido de trascendencia familiar y gracias a que lo aprendió desde muy temprana edad de su padre, ahora tiene una gran experiencia que le permite ofrecer productos de muy buena calida. Pese a que presenta grandes dificultades económicas, su negocio ha venido creciendo y esto ha permitido que en su hogar puedan gozar de mejores condiciones económicas, pero ahora que requiere aumentar su producción por la demanda de sus clientes, busca un préstamo para comprar más gallinas ponedoras, pollos de engorde y el cuido necesario para alimentarlos.

Su mayor sueño es seguir brindándoles a sus hijos y su esposa una buena calidad de vida y mejorar poco a poco las condiciones económicas de su hogar. Además, aspira a que en un futuro pueda tener una casa propia donde pueda pasar una buena vejez.
texts.en:
Uber is a person who is noted for being very enterprising, hardworking and humble who has raised his family with much effort despite the difficulties life has presented.  Uber is married and has four children he’s always wanted to provide a good quality of life and this is why he works so hard in his business raising hens and chicks and selling eggs.  

This business has been a family tradition and thanks to having learned it from his father while still very young he now has vast experience that makes it possible for him to offer very good quality products.  Despite the great economic difficulties his business has been growing and this has led to his home being able to enjoy improved economic conditions. But now he needs to increase production to meet customer demand and needs a loan to buy more laying hens, chicks to raise and the necessary feed to do so.

His greatest dream is to continue providing his children and his wife with a good quality of life and to gradually improve his home’s economic condition.  He also hopes in future to be able to have a house of his own in which to spend a good old-age.

loans.use: to buy more laying hens, chicks to raise and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an assortment of women's underwear.

loans.name: Londa

texts.en:
Londa is 43 years old and lives in a small village of Tskaltubo district. She lives with her husband and a father-in-law. Londa’s husband works as an ambulance driver and gets a monthly salary. Her father-in-law is a pensioner. The family runs their agricultural business. In particular, they have a plot of land where nuts are grown. Londa is involved in animal husbandry business as well. She owns two milking cows and two calves. She milks the cows every day and produces cheese. The cheese is sold at the local open market. Besides this business, Londa works as a cook and gets a monthly income. 

Londa requested a loan for clothes-trading. She sells clothes locally and with this loan she will be able to increase her stock. Because of the high demand for her products, she plans to purchase more clothes. This will increase her sales and Londa will be able to improve the living conditions of the family. She will be able to reinvest an increased income in her business to expand it and make it more profitable. She hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to expand the clothes trading

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a single mother of six children, and five of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house; the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.  

She has a business selling charcoal. She generates additional income through selling clusters of bananas. She has been in the charcoal business for eight years. She works from her home and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis.  

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to build rental rooms.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Kazia

texts.en:
Kazia is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is single and has one child, who is currently in school. For the past two years, Kazia has been working hard to manage her small business, where she sells food. 

To help expand her business, Kazia has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy fresh food like matoke and beans to sell. It will help Kazia to generate greater profits, pay school fees for her child, and save money and budget. Kazia hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Kazia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy fresh food like matoke and beans to sell

loans.name: Hilder's Group

texts.en:
Hilder's group is comprised of four hardworking women. Hilder is 23 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past three years, she has been working hard to manage her small business where she sells dry foods. 

To help expand her business, Hilder has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more maize, beans, g-nuts (groundnuts, or peanuts), and sorghum and will help Hilder to generate greater profits and help her develop herself. Hilder hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Hilder is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more maize, beans, g-nuts, and sorghum

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past two years, Judith has been working hard to manage her small business, where she sells many goods, ranging from charcoal to fresh food. 

To help expand her business, Judith has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more tomatoes, matoke, clothes and charcoal to sell, and will help Judith to generate greater profits and develop herself. Judith hopes that in the future she will be able to build a permanent house. 

Judith is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, matoke, clothes and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao is a 52-year-old father of five children. He makes a living from one hectare of farmland for growing paddy rice. In addition to this business, which is his main source of income, he also raises ducks as extra income. He has been with his current businesses for 24 years and earns about 19,000 KHR per day. 

Mao's group consists of four members. As the group leader, he has formed this group to seek a new loan with Kiva partner VisionFund; he and two of his fellow group members are first-loan-cycle clients, while the remaining member is a second-loan-cycle client. 

Mao will use his portion of the loan to buy two sacks of fertilizer for his field. He hopes that this loan will enable him to grow his crop in a timely way and double his income, so that he can save some money to buy two more hectares of land for expanding his rice-cropping business.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of fertilizer for his field

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 20 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. For the past three years, Jackline has been working hard to manage her small business where she sells cassava flour. 

To help expand her business, Jackline has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cassava flour and will help Jackline to generate greater profits and allow her to develop her home and business more. She hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Jackline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more cassava flour

loans.name: Sykheng's Group

texts.en:
Sykheng, aged 54 and married, is a rural villager from Mongkul Borey district in Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She has three children, two of whom are dependent on her. She and her husband manage four hectares of paddy rice-growing farmland in order to provide for their family's daily basic needs, earning about KHR 23,000 per day. They have been involved in this business for 26 years. Sykheng's group is composed of two female members. 

Sykheng and her co-member have been with VisionFund for four and three cycles, respectively. After the past loans that she has paid, she feels empowered that she can obtain a better living condition for her household. Now she leads her group to seek for a new loan. She is seeking for KHR 1,000,000 and her co-member is applying for KHR 300,000. Sykheng will use her loan portion to buy three sacks of fertilizer and rice seeds, and to pay for the labor costs of her farmland. She hopes to keep up the good progress of her living condition via the income received from her high crop yield.

loans.use: To buy three sacks of fertilizer and rice seeds, and to pay for labor cost for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Walter Leodan

texts.es:
Walter es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, a pesar de ser tan joven él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar para apoyar a sus padres y solventar sus gastos, no pudo estudiar la carrera de Veterinaria que tanto deseaba, pero sueña con poder hacerlo algún día, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos, y en algunas ocasiones cocina un delicioso Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día Walter trabaja como Obrero en una empresa avícola de su ciudad, todas las mañanas desde tempranas horas inicia su labor, él puede laborar un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Walter se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar los acabados de su vivienda, ya que desea poder tarrajear, pintar y poner piso en su vivienda; de esta manera Walter tendrá su casa en mejores condiciones, la cual brinde mayor seguridad y bienestar para su mejor desarrollo, así el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose por salir adelante.
texts.en:
Walter is 21 years old and single and lives in the city of Chincha, Peru.  Despite being so young he is very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic, with great drive to succeed.  Unfortunately, since he had to work to support his parents and himself, he was unable to pursue his dream career in veterinary medicine; he still dreams of doing this one day.  In his spare time, he enjoys playing soccer with his friends and neighbors.  Occasionally he cooks a delicious lomo saltado, a Peruvian specialty, to share with his family.

With much effort and enthusiasm, Walter works as a laborer in a poultry factory in town.  He begins work early in the morning and works for approximately ten hours daily.  He thinks he does well due to his solid performance and the kindness he shows others.

Walter is grateful to Kiva lenders.  With their help, he will be able to put some finishing touches on his home, including finishing the walls and ceiling, painting, and installing a floor.  In this way, Walter will have a home that is in better shape, which will provide more security and better safeguard his welfare.  This is how he will continue working and striving to get ahead.

loans.use: to put some finishing touches on his home.

loans.name: Turqueza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TURQUEZA” iniciará el ciclo octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Olivia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: promotora AVON, venta de pollos a la brosther, venta de comida, venta de libros, tienda, radio taxi, venta de tenis, venta de hamburguesas y salchipapas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Olivia es una integrante, ella indica que hace ocho ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida rápida mismo que emprendió mediante un capital que tenía hace años, conjuntamente su esposo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la mejora de herramientas (compra de parrilla, unos letreros y productos para aumentar el capital) que comprará de las ferias tradicionales de La Paz y posteriormente lo instalara en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud y crédito porque aprende mas
texts.en:
The “Turqueza” (Turquoise) communal bank will start its 8th cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Focal Center.   It has 8 members led by a governing board headed by Olivia, President.
