Mr. Mouhamadou lives in Senegal in a village. He is married and active in the artisanal sector. His carpentry business gives him the chance to make furniture (beds, armoires, and more), which he displays for sale. He capitalizes on over ten years of experience in this business.

He is a member of a U-IMCEC branch office where he has already repaid two previous loans. He is presently requesting a loan of 500,000 francs enabling him to boost the number of pieces of furniture on display and thus to make his business more profitable, as well as to increase his revenues. His goal is to do better in covering household expenses. 

His greatest dream is to have a large factory for making wood furniture.

loans.use: to finance the construction of additional furniture to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Hugo Ruben

texts.es:
Hugo tiene 38años de edad, vive en la ciudad de chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano y sus pobladores tiene un don en la preparación de platillos ya que lo hacen de manera muy deliciosa. Hugo es padre de un pequeño de 10 años a quien quiere muchísimo y sobre todo trabaja para darle una vida digna y llena de amor; cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho jugar futbol con su hijo y también en algunas ocasiones le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo”Arroz chaufa”.

Día a día Hugo trabaja en un policlínico de su ciudad como odontólogo, trabaja alrededor de  10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 6 clientes  en el día, el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy paciente con los clientes y sobre todo porque es cumplido y responsable.

Hugo está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar la construcción de un pequeño cuarto y también construir su cocina ya que actualmente es de abobe; de esta manera el podrá darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y así poder seguir luchando por conseguir hacer realidad su más grande sueño.” Terminar de construir su vivienda y darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Hugo, 38, lives in the city of Chincha; a city noted for having a hot, welcoming climate and for being the birthplace of great Peruvian sports heroes.  Its residents are very good cooks and prepare very delicious dishes. 

Hugo is the father of a ten-year-old son who he loves very much and above all works very hard to provide with a proper life that’s full of love.  When he has any free time available, Hugo likes to play soccer with his son and also sometimes very much enjoys eating one of his favorite dishes, the very delicious “Arroz Chaufa.”

Hugo works day to day as an orthodontist in a local clinic.  He works about 10 hours daily and can see up to ten patients daily.  He believes he does well at work because he’s very patient with his patients and above all because he’s responsible and follows through.

Hugo is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to build a small room and his kitchen which is currently of adobe.  In this way he will be able to give his family improved quality of life and continue striving towards making his greatest dream a reality: to finish building his house and provide a good education for his son.

loans.use: to build a bedroom and a kitchen.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
Maria es tiene 53 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, esparrago, entre otros. Maria vive al lado de su esposo y junto a el tiene 2 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero por quienes ha luchando mucho para darles una vida digna. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho lee y también en algunas ocasiones le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Seco de Pollo”.  Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Secretariado.

Día a día Maria trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de chocotejas, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día, ya que con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene muy buena sazón y atiende a sus clientes con amabilidad.

Maria esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le  han brindado que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una cocina a gas, ya que actualmente su cocina es de Kerosene y podra elaborar sus productos de mejor manera; de esta manera podrá tener los utensilios necesarios y podra seguir luchando para hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener su empresa de Chocotejas”.
texts.en:
María, 53, lives in the city of Ica, a city noted for its hot, welcoming climate.  Agriculture, especially the growing of cotton, grapes and asparagus, among others, is also common here.  

María lives with her husband and she has two children who are adults now and for whom she strives to provide with a proper life.  When she has free time available she likes to read very much and also sometimes enjoys eating one of her favorite dishes, the very delicious “Seco de Pollo.”  Due to her family’s limited economic resources she was only able to go to 11th grade but would have liked to have studied to become a secretary.

María works day to day in her small business selling ‘chocotejas’ [traditional chocolate candies from Ica].  She works around 8 hours daily and is able to help her husband cover household expenses with what she earns from her work.  She believes she does well in her business because she makes tasty items and tends to her customers with kindness

María is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy a gas stove.  The one she uses at present burns kerosene so she will be able to make her products in a better way and she will have the necessary tools to continue working towards making her greatest dream a reality: to have a chocoteja company.

loans.use: to buy a gas stove.

loans.name: Jesus Benit Group

texts.fr: Le groupement JESUS BENIT est composé de dix huit personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Françoise est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. Françoise a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Françoise est âgée de 42 ans et est marié à un chauffeur du nom de Albert. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés dont un reste à leur charge. Françoise vit avec son enfant et assure ensemble avec son mari, les diverses charges de la famille. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille, Françoise vend depuis quinze ans, des bijoux et des vêtements à son domicile et par le système de distribution. Françoise s'approvisionne au Nigeria. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Françoise et les autres membres du groupement JESUS BENIT sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en: The group JESUS BENIT has 18 members who are all from the same neighborhood. The group's leader, Françoise has her hand raised in the photo. With a goal to improve business and better respond to client demand, the group is requesting a loan from ALIDé. Francoise only studied through primary school. Françoise is 42 years old and married to a driver named Albert. The couple has three children who are all in school. Françoise lives with her children and together with her husband takes care of all the household expenses. In order to help with all the family expenses, Françoise has been selling jewelry and clothing from her home and through a distribution system for the past 15 years. She buys her inventory in Nigeria. In order to strengthen the business and respond to client demand, Françoise together with the group JESUS BENIT are requesting a loan from ALIDé. Their goal is to increase their business activity.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry and clothing.

loans.name: Eladia Efemia

texts.es:
Eladia es una joven de 24 años de edad, la cual vive en la ciudad de Nazca, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de tuna, maíz, algodón, entre otros, así mismo se encuentra uno de los atractivos turísticos muy visitado por los turistas en todo el año como lo son “Las Líneas de Nazca”. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho ver televisión, pero lo que las le gusta es disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Lomo Saltado”. 

Con mucho entusiasmo Eladia trabaja en como técnica farmacéutica en una farmacia de su ciudad, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y sobre todo atenta con los clientes.

Eladia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda, ya que va realizar refacción de paredes agrietadas, mejoramiento de las ventanas, lo cual mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, así ella seguirá trabajando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su propia Farmacia”.
texts.en:
Eladia, 24, is a young woman living in the city of Nazca that’s noted for having a hot, welcoming climate.  Agriculture, especially growing prickly pears, corn and cotton, among others is also notable here.  One of the most popular year-round tourist sites is also found here: the Nazca Lines.  When she has free time available she likes to watch television very much but what she likes most is enjoying one of her favorite dishes, the very delicious “Lomo Saltado.” [Steak sautéed in Olive Oil with Onions and Tomatoes served over French Fries and Rice.]

With much enthusiasm, Eladia works as a pharmacy technician in a pharmacy in her city.  She works around 8 hours daily and can tend to up to 15 customers daily.  She believes she does well in her business because she’s very responsible and above all attentive to her customers.

Eladia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to make some home improvements since she will repair cracked walls and improve the windows which will improve her and her family’s quality of life and she will continue working every day towards making her greatest dream a reality: to have her own pharmacy.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Roddy Alfredo

texts.es:
Roddy vive en el distrito de Tinguiña, Ica, Perú. El distrito de Tinguiña se caracteriza por su clima cálido, así como también porque es un distrito que ha ido mejorando cada día y sobre todo creciendo gracias al esfuerzo de sus pobladores.  Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre a Roddy le gusta mucho jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio, asimismo le encanta disfrutar de pasar un tiempo de familia con su pequeño hijo, al cual quiere mucho y por el cual cada día se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante para darle una vida digna a pesar de todas las dificultades del día a dia. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos el solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho tener una carrera universitaria.

Con mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo dedicación Roddy trabaja como taxista, ya que con los frutos de este trabajo puedo solventar los gastos de su hogar, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas y puede atender hasta 30 clientes diariamente, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy trabajador y sobre todo es muy amable con los clientes.

Roddy está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su vehículo, especialmente retirar el motor para realizar una revisión, asimismo reparar el tanque de combustible a gas de su vehículo, ya que ha presentado mucho inconvenientes, de esta manera el podrá tener un vehículo más seguro y también darle seguridad a sus clientes y evitar accidentes graves; así el podrá seguir trabajando y luchando muy duro para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Roddy lives in Tinguiña District in Ica, Perú.  Tinguiña District is noted for its hot climate as well as for being a district that’s been improving every day and above all growing thanks to the efforts of its residents.  When Roddy has free time available he very much enjoys playing soccer with his friends and neighbors in his neighborhood.  He also likes spending family time with his little boy who he loves very much and strives daily to get ahead to provide him with a dignified life despite daily difficulties that arise.  Due to his family’s limited economic resources he was only able to go to 11th grade but would have liked to attend university.

With much effort and dedication above all, Roddy works as a taxi driver because with earnings from this job he’s able to cover household expenses.  
He works about 10 hours daily and can tend to up to 30 customers per day.  He believes he does well in his business because he’s a hardworking and above all very kind to his customers.

Roddy is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to service his vehicle, especially remove the motor to check it out.  He will also be able to repair the vehicle’s gas tank because he’s been having many breakdowns and now he will be able to have a safer vehicle and provide safety for his customers and avoid serious accidents so that he can continue striving towards making his greatest dream a reality: to provide his son with a profession.

loans.use: to service his taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a freezer.

loans.name: Idalides

texts.es: Idalides con su credikiva anterior, compró ranchos, vivieres y abarrotes con los que surtió su tienda y logró rotar rápidamente su mercancía. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el  comprará tubérculos, cereales, refrescos y víveres, con esta inversión su tienda se verá surtida y atraerá a sus clientes con la mercancía que estos usualmente buscan para su consumo diario. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Ustedes son unos ángeles  de Dios dedicados a proporcionar  el bien a los demás, no decaigan en tan magna labor, continúen adelante y Dios los bendiga. “
texts.en: Idalides used her previous Kiva loan to buy snacks, foodstuffs and groceries she used to stock her store; she sold her merchandise quickly.  She’s currently applying for a new Kiva loan to buy tubers, cereals, soft-drinks and foodstuffs.  With this investment she’ll have her store stocked and will attract customers with the merchandise they’ve been looking for lately for their daily consumption.  Her message to Kiva lenders is the following: “You are angels from God dedicated to doing good for others.   Don’t ever falter in such great work.  Continue forward and may God bless you.”

loans.use: to buy tubers, cereals, softo-drinks and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Farhad

texts.ru: Farhadu 60 let, on jivet s jenoy I trema detmi. On prodaet ovoshi kotorie rastit u seba v ferme. Farhad zanimaetsa etim uje 20 let, ego jena vmeste s sinom pomogayut emu.  Krome etogo oni s jenoy poluchayut pensiyu chto ochen pomogaet im soderjat semyu. Farhad xochet sdelat remont doma, emu neobxodimi dengi v summe 1000 AZN. Farhad zabotliviy otec I xoroshiy chelovek I on nadeyetsa na pomosh.
texts.en: Farhad is 60 years old, and he lives with his wife and three children.  He sells vegetables that he grows on his farm.  Farhad has been involved in this business for 20 years.  His wife and son help him with this business.  Besides this, he and his wife earn a pension, which helps them very much to support the family.  Farhad wants to make repairs at home and needs a loan in the amount of 1000 AZN.  Farhad is a caring father and a good person, and relies on your help.

loans.use: to make repairs at home

loans.name: Reyhan

texts.ru: Reyhan rabotaet portnixoy u seba doma. Ona delaet raznie shveynie dela I ochen lubit svoyu rabotu. Ona zamujem, u nee 3 detey, 2 iz nix xodat v shkolu. Reyhan planiruet kupit novie shveynie mashini, nanyat pomoshnikov I rasshirit svoye delo.  Segodna ona obratilas za summoy 600 AZN dla remonta doma. U nix doma siro I steni nujdayutsa v novoy pokraske.
texts.en: Reyhan works as a seamstress at home.  She sews various things and loves her work very much.  She is married and has three children, two of whom attend a school.  Reyhan plans to purchase a new sewing machine, hire helpers and expand her business.  Today, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 600 AZN to repair her home.  There is a lot of moisture in their house, and the walls need new paint.

loans.use: to make repairs to her house

loans.name: Arley

texts.es:
Arley se encuentra casado y tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 12 años de edad, y para generar los ingresos que se requieren en su hogar tiene una tienda general donde ofrece productos de la canasta familiar y snack. Arley tiene experiencia de varios años en la actividad y gracias a esta experiencia ha decido montar desde hace unos 4 años su propio negocio para poder mejorar las condiciones económicas de su hogar. Su principal fortaleza es la experiencia que tiene en la actividad, pero su debilidad principal son las condiciones locativas de su negocio, es por esto que busca un préstamo para realizar mejoras locativas a su negocio y mejorar las condiciones para aumentar sus ventas.

Su sueño es sacar este negocio adelante y que le permita para poder ofrecerles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y el acceso a una educación de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Arley’s married and has two children who are 3 and 12 years of age and to generate income needed in his home he has a general store where he sells basic staples and snacks.  Arley has several years’ experience in this activity and thanks to this experience decided four years ago to open his own business in order to improve his family’s economic condition.  

His main strength is the experienced he has in this activity but his main weakness is the physical condition of his shop which is why he’s looking for financing to make improvements to his shop and improve its conditions to increase his sales.  His dream is to move the business forward so that it will make it possible for him to provide his children with better quality of life and access to a better quality education.

loans.use: to improve the physical conditions of his sales spot.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La socia Maria De Los Angeles tiene 20 años de edad, es conviviente y fruto de esta relación tiene una hija (Alexandra de dos años de edad), ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mi Perú” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella es natural de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella se dedica a su hogar pues es una excelente ama de casa pero también en sus horas libres se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Ya son dos años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ademas, Maria De Los Angeles por las mañanas estudia la carrera profesional de administración en una instituto  privado de la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad la socia Maria De Los Angeles requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo perfumes, aretes, collares, pulseras, y otras cosas más. 

La socia Maria De Los Angeles se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The member Maria De Los Angeles is 20 years old and lives with her partner.  Together they have a little girl, Alexandra, who is two years old.  Maria De Los Angeles belongs to the communal bank “Mi Perú” (My Perú), a part of Asociación Arariwa.  She is a native of Cusco and lives in the same city where she was born.  She dedicates her time to her home and is an excellent housewife.  She dedicates her free time to selling cosmetics.  She has earned her living in this business for two years, and it has been going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  In addition, Maria De Los Angeles spends her mornings studying Administration in a private school in Cusco.  At this time, the member Maria De Los Angeles needs the loan to purchase merchandise such as perfumes, earrings, necklaces, bracelets and other items.

The member Maria De Los Angeles feels grateful for the opportunity offered through this program.  She promises to comply with the scheduled re-payment plan.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as perfumes, earrings, necklaces, bracelets and other items.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en una casa alquilada ocupando solo una habitación con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la zona villa exaltación en la ciudad de El Alto.
Actualmente trabaja como compaginadora en una empresa privada por más de ocho horas al día y con los ingresos que tiene debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de alquileres.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora ya que le será de mucha ayuda en sus estudios.
El sueño de Sara es terminar sus estudios, pues estudia Psicología y está en 4to año de la carrera, y mejorar sus ingresos para posteriormente adquirir una casa en anticrético para ahorrar en el pago de alquileres de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Sara is single and has no children.  She lives in a rented house occupying a single room with brick walls and a dirt floor located in the city of El Alto’s Villa Exaltación zone.  She currently works as a file clerk in a private firm for more than 8 hours daily and with the income she earns is able to pay for food, schooling and rent.  She needs the loan to buy a computer because it would be of much help to her in her classes.

Sara’s dream is to complete her studies because she's studying psychology and is in the fourth year of her career and to improve her income so that later on she can acquire a house using the ‘anticrético’ modality to save on rent costs and thus improve her quality of life. [Transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you].  This is the second time she’s asked for an IMPRO and KIVA loan.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her phychology classes.

loans.name: Arturo Wilfredo

texts.es: El socio Arturo tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y aun no tiene hijos, él pertenece al banco comunal “Mi Perú” de la Asociación Arariwa, él es natural de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él es un joven responsable que se dedica a la atender su pequeña librería pero hay mismo también brinda servicio de internet o sea tiene varias computadoras conectadas a internet. Ya son 3 años que se dedica a estos negocios y le va muy bien. Además, él está estudiando en un instituto privado la carrera profesional de barman. Su sueño del socio Arturo es abrir una cadena de librerías. En esta oportunidad el socio Arturo requiere el préstamo para comprar una computadora. El socio Arturo se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Arturo, 20, is single and has no children yet.  He belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Mi Perú” (My Peru) communal bank.  He is originally from the city of Cusco and still lives in the city of his birth.  He is a responsible young man who tends to his small bookstore where he also provides Internet access services, that is, he has computers always connected to the Internet.  He’s been in these businesses for three years now and does very well.  He’s also 
studying in a private institute to become a barman.

Arturo’s dream is to open a chain of bookstores.  On this occasion, Arturo needs the loan to buy a computer.  He is grateful for the opportunity provided him by this means and commits to make his payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Flor Naciente Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR NACIENTE” iniciará el ciclo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por doce integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Verónica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: costura de pantalones, venta de dulces, venta de coca, venta de verduras, macramé, venta de carne, venta de artículos plásticos, chofer, venta de plantillas, fabricación de tenis.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Verónica es integrante, ella indica que hace un ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora que vino a su casa a invitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de productos artesanales (mantas con tejido a macramé) mismo que emprendió desde los 16 años de edad y que en la actualidad le ayuda a sustentar su economía.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento del capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas y posterior a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la las reuniones de su Banca Comunal.

En la fotografía podemos percibir que la Señora Juana se agacho y la señora Roxana alza la mano para que la ubiquen.
texts.en:
The "Flor Naciente" Communal Bank is starting its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Regional Office. The group is made up of twelve members and is governed by a board of directors, the president of which is Señora Verónica. The members' businesses are varied and include: pant-making, selling candy, selling coca leaves, selling vegetables, macrame, selling meat, selling plastic items, selling stencils, making sneakers, and driving.
This loan will benefit these little microbusinesses. Veronica joined Pro Mujer one cycle ago at the invitation of a promoter who came to her home to invite her. She currently has a business making artisanal products (blankets with macrame weaving). She started this business at the age of sixteen, and the business is currently helping her by bringing in an income.
This loan is to be used to increase capital (buying wool). She will buy the wool from the wholesale stores and, after making her products, will sell based on orders. This work allows her to generate an income in order to support her family where possible. She is single and has two children.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the Communal Bank meetings.
In the photo we can see Señora Juana crouching down and Señora Roxana raising her hand to identify herself.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Karla Angelica

texts.es: La Sra. Karla Angélica de 21 años de edad es casada y tiene 2 hijos, es una mujer emprendedora a la que le gustan los retos y no se detiene por nada ante la vida. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica de la  localidad y Karla está dedicada a las ventas. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa, calzado, artículos usados y nuevos es la manera en la que ella ayuda al ingreso familiar. Es por eso que en esta ocasión ella pide de nuestra ayuda para la compra de mercancía para hacer crecer su negocio y así poder aportar más a su casa. Karla agradecerá la ayuda que se pueda brindar.
texts.en: Karla Angélica, 21, is married and has two children.  She’s an enterprising woman who enjoys challenges and does not let anything get in her way.  Her husband works in a local factory and Karla works in sales.  She buys and sells clothes, footwear, used and new goods; this is how she contributes to family income and why on this occasion she’s asking for help to buy merchandise so that her business will grow and she can contribute even more to her home.  Karla will be grateful for any help that can be given her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Kulmairam

texts.ru:
Кулмайрам 49 лет, вдова, мать 3 детей, ее младший сын учится в 5 классе.  Кулмайрам, оставшись одна после смерти мужа, в качестве источника дохода для семьи, решила заняться торговлей продуктами питания, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 50,000 сом (KGS).  Благодаря упорному труду Кулмайрам, на сегодняшний день ее ежемесячная выручка составляет около 10,000 сом. Кроме того, Кулмайрам занимается изготовлением пирожков и выпечки, что также приносит небольшой доход.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кулмайрам обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS)  на увеличение товарооборота за счет закупа чая, растительного и сливочного масел, сахара для изготовления джемов .  Доходы от кредита Кулмайрам планирует вложить в расширение своей бизнес – деятельности за счет услуг кафетерия.
texts.en: Kulmairam is 49 years old, a widow and a mother of three children.   Her youngest son attends a fifth grade.  Kulmairam, left alone after her husband's death, decided to get involved in sales of food products to provide a source of income for her family.  She started this business with a sum of 50,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Kulmairam's hard work, today her monthly income amounts to about 10,000 som.  Besides this, she is involved in making pies and baked goods, which also bring in a small income.  In order to further develop her business, Kulmairam requested a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to increase her product turnover by purchasing tea, vegetable oil, butter and sugar for making jams.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into expanding her business by adding a cafe.

loans.use: to increase product turnover

loans.name: Eriosi

texts.en:
Eriosi is widowed with four children and all her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members.  

She has a business selling second-hand clothes and has applied for a loan of 100,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She also gets additional income through roasting maize from home. 

Eriosi has been in this business for six years and works seven days a week from her home. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to see her business grow big so that she becomes a wholesaler and also will be able to build rental rooms. 

She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Augustine S.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Micronfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from one of the primary schools in Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of 16,400,000 SLL in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, their school’s bursar repays SMT/Kiva on their behalf.

Augustine is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Bunumbu village, the 39-year-old has been in the teaching profession for ten years now. He is married and has three children, one in primary school and two in secondary school. Augustine has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна использовала предыдущий кредит для увеличения ассортимента своего товара - детской одежды, что позволило ей получить дополнительную прибыль. Наиболее продаваемые товары клиента — детские майки, сарафаны, бриджи, юбки, брюки и пр. 

В этот раз Татьяна просит предоставить ей кредит для закупки одежды к школе. Начало учебного года в бизнесе Татьяны - всегда время хороших продаж и Татьяна хочет воспользоваться возможностью, чтобы получить дополнительную прибыль.
texts.en: Tatyana used her previous loan to expand her merchandise selection of children's clothing, which allowed her to make an additional profit.  The most popular goods are children's tank tops, summer dresses, capri pants, skirts, pants and the like.  This time, Tatyana is requesting a loan to purchase clothing for school.  The start of a school year is always a time of good sales in Tatyana's business, and she wants to use this opportunity to make an additional profit.

loans.use: to purchase an inventory of school uniforms

loans.name: Zulaika

texts.en:
Zulaika is a single mother of two children and only one child goes to school. She takes care of additional family members (old parents).  

She has a business of selling green bananas from home and has applied for a loan of 100,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. 

Zulaika has been in this business for six years and works seven days a week from her home. She generates additional income through rearing goats. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. 

She is aspiring of seeing her business grow big so that she becomes a wholesaler, and also she aspires to build rental rooms. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas for resale.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.ru:
Валентина – разведена. Она - предприниматель из Новой Каховки. Она торгует женской трикотажной одеждой на одном из местных рынков. Для торговли Валентина арендует землю у администрации рынка, причем бутик состоит в ее собственности. Этим бизнесом Валентина занимается уже 17 лет. 

Валентине необходим кредит суммой в 8 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить оптом осеннюю одежду (кофты, свитера, юбки, костюмы) для последующей реализации в сезон. Валентина имеет достаточный опыт торговли в этой сфере. Она наработала свою базу постоянных клиентов и товар у нее достаточно ходовой, к тому же по доступным ценам. Валентина планирует и дальше заниматься этим бизнесом и постепенно развиваться.
texts.en: Valentina is divorced.  She is an entrepreneur from Novaya Kahovka.  She sells women's knitted clothing at one of the local markets.  She leases her retail space land from the market administration, but owns her kiosk.  Valentina has been in this business for 17 years.  She needs a loan in the amount of 8,000 hryvnia to purchase fall clothing (cardigans, sweaters, skirts, suits) wholesale for a subsequent resale during the season.  Valentina has sufficient retail experience in this area.  She acquired a base of regular customers, and her merchandise is fairly popular and also offered at affordable prices.  Valentina plans to continue running this business and gradually expand it.

loans.use: to purchase fall clothing wholesale

loans.name: Santo Domingo Group

texts.es:
La señora Manuela esta casada, tiene 45 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica  a la venta de pan y la venta de tamales, inicio este negocio con un poco de capital que tenis, y hasta el momento lleva 9 años de experiencia, cuanta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de pan para la venta y maíz para elaborar mas tamales, Espera seguir incrementando su ventas y sus ganancias. Las demás integrantes se dedican al comercio, venta de cosméticos, venta de tamales y panes, venta de maíz y atención a tienda en general.
texts.en:
Manuela is married, is 45 years old, and has completed three years of primary education. She has two children who are in school. She sells bread and tamales, a business that she started with a little capital that she had. She has nine years of experience with this business, and she has benefitted from the support of her husband, who works in agriculture.

She organized a group to request a loan that she will use to buy bread to sell and corn with which to make tamales. She hopes to continue increasing her sales and her earnings. The rest of the members of the group work in businesses, selling cosmetics, tamales and bread, and corn, as well as work at a store more generally.

loans.use: to buy supplies for resale.

loans.name: Edward Karimu's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from a primary school in Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 2,500,000 SLL in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, their school’s bursar repays SMT/Kiva lenders on their behalf from their monthly salaries. 

Edward is the leader of this group. The 60-year-old is married to a trader. He has seven children, three of whom are in secondary school and in college. Born in Largo village near Kenema, Edward has been in the teaching profession for 38 years. 

Edward has requested a loan of 1,000,000 SLL in order to hire a labor force to brush and plough his farmland and buy seeds to plant on his farm.

loans.use: to hire a labor force to brush and plough his farmland and to buy seeds to plant on his farm.

loans.name: Samuel N.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva based in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from a primary school in Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of 14,800,000 SLL in order to solve their immediate financial problems. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. 

Samuel is the leader of this group. A native of Moyamba, the 52-year-old is married and has six children attending primary, secondary, and tertiary institutions. Samuel has served in the teaching profession for 33 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials such as iron corrugated zincs, sand, cement, iron rods, nails, etc. for the construction of a family dwelling on the plot of land he bought with his just-repaid Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy house building materials such as iron corrugated zincs, sand, cement, iron rods, nails, etc. for the construction of a family house on the plot of land he bought with his just-repaid Kiva loan.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is single mother of one child who does not attend school.  She takes care of additional family members (a sister and a brother).  

Sylvia sells secondhand clothes and has applied for a loan of 100,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy a bale of secondhand clothes. She has   been in this business for two years and works seven days a week from her home. She generates additional income through raising chickens. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to see her business grow big so that she can becomes a wholesaler and also to build rental rooms. She resides in her own house and her family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is still running a clothing and shoe trading business. She sells not only adult’s clothes and shoes but also clothes and shoes for children. Karine says that now her husband and her son-in-law live in Russia, so she manages her business by herself. 
Thanks to her business’s income she provides for herself and her youngest daughter’s family, also she was able to pay for her three daughters' education and organized their weddings. 
Karine used her second Kiva loan to buy clothes and shoes to resell. 
Now she needs a 500,000 AMD (Armenian Dram) loan to buy autumn clothes and shoes for her business ahead of the school year beginning.

loans.use: to buy autumn clothes and shoes for her business ahead of the school year beginning

loans.name: Daisy M.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers from one of the primary schools in Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of 13,000,000 SLL in order to solve their immediate financial challenges and at the end of each month they will then repay the loan using their monthly salaries. 

Daisy is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Segbwema village, the 48-year-old has been in the teaching profession for 26 years now. She is married to a teacher and has three children – one in secondary school and two in college. Daisy has requested this loan in order to buy rice seeds and groundnut seeds to plant on her farm.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and groundnut seeds to plant on her farm

loans.name: Naile

texts.en:
Naile is 42 years old and lives in a small village in the Tetritskaro district. She lives with her children (18 and 15 years old) and a grandfather.  Naile’s grandfather is a pensioner. Her son attends the village school and her daughter helps Naile to run their dairy business. The family has three milking cows. They produce cheese and sell it locally. Besides this business, Naile works as a worker to earn additional income. She is a very hard-working woman with a great desire to get ahead.

Naile requested a loan to purchase food for her livestock. With this loan, she will purchase hay, which will be used for feeding the cows during the fall and winter seasons. Since the cows will be fed properly in winter, they will give a planned amount of milk to the family. Naile will sell her dairy products and increase the income of her family. She will be able to realize her dream of giving her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase food for her livestock

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана каждый раз, воспользовавшись кредитом от КИВА, остается очень довольной своевременно предоставленной финансовой помощью, которая оказывается такой нужной ей в бизнесе. Это уже не первый кредит, который Светлана получила от КИВА. Предыдущий кредит она вложила в приобретение дополнительной партии товара, за счет чего увеличилось количество товара и выручка. 
В этот раз Светлана хочет использовать кредит в размере 21 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить чай, кофе, продукты питания и колбасные изделия для последующей розничной реализации. На данный момент все три дочери Светланы учатся в разных учебных заведениях, и она старается помогать им финансово, как может, поэтому старается вкладывать в бизнес, чтобы было на что содержать семью. Для того, чтобы помогать семье муж Светланы решил дополнительно заняться сельским хозяйством и поставил больную теплицу, в скором будущем планирует ставить еще одну.
texts.en: Every time Svetlana uses a loan from Kiva, she is satisfied with the timely financial help, which is always necessary for her business.  This is not the first loan that she is obtaining from Kiva.  She invested her previous loan into a purchase of an additional inventory of merchandise, which resulted in an increase in merchandise quantity and profit.  This time, Svetlana wants to use a loan in the amount of 21,000 hryvnia to purchase tea, coffee, food products and sausage for a subsequent retail sale.  At the present time, all three of Svetlana's daughters attend different education facilities, and she tries to help them financially as she can.  This is why she tries to invest in her business in order to support her family.  Also to support the family, Svetlana's husband decided to get involved in an agricultural business and installed a large greenhouse and plans to install another one in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase tea, coffee, food products and sausage for a subsequent retail sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary  is married with seven children and only two of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (two orphans).
She has a business of chicken feed and has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more maize bran, fish and cotton cake for making chicken feed.  
She has been in this business for ten years and sells to all categories of people on retail and works seven days a week in a rented shop. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation of bags of maize bran to her shop. 
She is aspiring to own a delivery van to ease in transportation and also to become a wholesaler.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent for her business premise.

loans.use: to buy maize bran, fish and cotton cake for making chicken feed

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
Ольга использовала предыдущий кредит для закупки зимней одежды. Сезон был хороший, продажи шли хорошо и Ольга смогла получить дополнительную прибыль. Часть прибыли она потратила на нужды семьи, а часть - для расширения бизнеса.

В этот раз Ольга просит предоставить ей кредит для закупки осеннего товара  - свитеров, теплых рубашек, курток - по выгодной цене. Сейчас Ольга может купить товар со скидкой, что позволит получить дополнительную прибыль не поднимая цену.

Этой осенью в семе Ольги будет событие - свадьба сына. Ольга хочет помочь сыну со свадебными расходами, а также с жильем после свадьбы.
texts.en: Olga used her previous loan to purchase winter clothing.  The season was good, sales went well, and Olga was able to make an additional profit.  She spent some of the profit on the family's needs and the rest on business expansion.  This time, Olga is requesting a loan to purchase fall merchandise, such as sweaters, warm shirts and jackets, at a good price.  Currently, she is able to buy merchandise at a discount, which will allow her to make an additional profit without raising her prices.  There is an event happening in Olga's family this autumn - her son's wedding.  She wants to help her son with the wedding expenses and also with the living arrangements after the wedding.

loans.use: to purchase fall merchandise at a good price

loans.name: Yuriy

texts.ru:
Юрий живет в Виноградово, Западная Украина. Он зарабатывает на жизнь тем, что работает ремонтником на железнодорожной станции в городе Чоп, Ужгородская область. 

Юрий давно планировал приобрести новый спальный гарнитур и кухню, но все никак не хватало средств для этого. Кредит от КИВА наконец поможет ему реализовать свою давнюю мечту и обустроить быт своей семьи, ведь совсем скоро у Юрия будет свадьба и своя семья.
texts.en: Yuriy lives in Vinogradovo, Western Ukraine.  He earns a living by working as a repairman at a train station in the city of Chop, Uzhgorod region.  Yuriy have long been planning to purchase a new bedroom furniture set and a kitchen, but never had enough money to do so.  The loan from Kiva will finally help him to achieve his dream and provide comfort for his family because Yuriy is getting married soon and will have his own family.

loans.use: to purchase a new bedroom furniture set and kitchen

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La Sra. patricia es casada y de 35 años, desde hace mas de 12 años vive en casa de interés social, la Sra. Panty  se dedica a la venta de ropa usada por más de 4 años, en donde se ha dado a conocer por su buen carácter y forma de atender a los clientes, ya que trata de brindarles variedad y precios bajos. Su esposo cuenta con empleo fijo por más de 7 años, ellos  quieren en un futuro tener un negocio grande de venta de ropa, ella solicita un crédito para compra de mercancía para poder empezar con su sueño.
texts.en: Mrs. Patricia is married and 35 years old. For the past twelve years she has lived in a comfortable home. For the past four years she has sold used clothes. As a businesswoman she is known for her good character and for giving good service to her customers. She also brings her customers a variety of items at a low cost. Her husband has had a stable job for the past seven years. In the future, they would like to have a bigger store where they can sell the clothes. They are asking for this loan in order to buy more merchandise, which will allow them to begin to reach their dreams.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

Rose sells sweet bananas and milk at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this  business for the last ten years and works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of sweet bananas and a jerrycan (20 liter container) of milk. Rose's major business challenges are  transportation, seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land to build her own house. Rose lives in a rented house and  the family has no access to electricity and piped water.  Her major expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of sweet bananas and a jerrycan of milk

loans.name: Saniya

texts.en:
Saniya lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with five children and three of her children go to school. She doesn’t  take care of any additional family members. 

Saniya operates a beauty salon at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 20 years and works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy braids, weaves, treatments and oils.

Her major business challenges are off and on electricity, transportation and seasonality. Saniya's goals and aspirations are  to own a bridal salon and also to educate her children up to university. 

She lives in her own house and  the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water.  Her major expenses include rent, power and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more braids, weaves, treatments and oils

loans.name: Juliet L.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers of a primary school in Kenema, who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 5,500,000 SLL in order to solve their immediate financial needs. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries.

The group's leader is Juliet. A native of Siama, the 50-year-old is married to a teacher and has 2 children who are in college. Juliet has been in the teaching profession for the past 29 years. She is requesting this loan in order to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his home.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all her children go to school. She does not take care of additional family members. 

Harriet sells fruits and vegetables at the market. She has been in  this business for the last seven years. She also gets additional income through selling piped water. Harriet works seven days a week.

She has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more watermelons, pineapples, passion fruits, onions, a bunch of sweet potatoes and tomatoes. 

Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Harriet's goals and aspirations are to educate her children to university level and also to become a wholesaler. She lives in a rented house and the  family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more watermelons, pineapples, passion fruits, onions and other produce

loans.name: Kentygal I.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you this group of teachers from a primary school in Kenema, Eastern Sierra Leone. Their school was founded in 2002 and currently has an enrollment of 300 pupils and 6 employees.

This is the second  loan from Kiva lenders to benefit the teachers of this noble institution. The previous Kiva loan created a lot of improvements in these borrowers' lives. Having repaid that loan successfully, they are requesting a new loan in order to further assist them to meet certain financial challenges that cannot be met by their salaries. 

This time, Kentygal is the featured borrower for this group of teachers. Born in Va’aha, Eastern Sierra Leone, 40-year-old Kentygal has been in the teaching profession for 13 years. He is married and has 4 children – 2 in secondary school and 2 in college. Kentygal  is going to use his share of this loan to buy house building materials such as corrugated iron, sand, cement, rods, etc. to construct a family home.

loans.use: to buy house building materials such as corrugated iron, sand, cement, rods, etc

loans.name: Ndiame

texts.fr: Monsieur Ndiame  habite au Sénégal. Il évolue depuis plus de 20 ans dans l’immobilier. Il est marié et père de 4 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 16 et 27 ans. Il est sociétaire dans l’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC ou il a déjà remboursé 2 crédits antérieurs. Actuellement il  sollicite un prêt de 500 000 frs prévu pour la réfection de son appartement a usage de location. Ce financement l’aidera à rénover sa maison et accroitre ses revenus pour une meilleure gestion de ses charges familiales.
texts.en: Mr. Ndiame lives in Senegal. He has been in real estate for over 20 years. He is married and has four children ranging from 16 to 27 years of age. He is a member of a branch of UIMCEC and has already repaid two prior loans. At present, he is seeking a loan of 500,000 intended for the renovation of his apartment to be rented. This financing will allow him to renovate his house and increase his revenues in order to better manage family expenses.

loans.use: to renovate his apartment for rent.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SAN JOSE” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamata, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Epifania es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: compra y venta de ganado ovino, compra y venta de ganado vacuno, tienda de barrio, compra y venta de papa y chuño, producción de leche

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Epifanea es una integrante, ella indica que hace un ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de leche; cuenta que hace años ella realiza esta actividad, ya que es un negocio familiar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el cuidado de su ganado (compra de forraje) mismo que comprará de su misma comunidad, posteriormente alimentará a su ganado. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San José" will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer.  As part of the focal center of Patacamata, it is made up of 9 members and is directed by a board with Mrs. Epifania as President.  The businesses of the group members are varied and among them they have the following: purchase and sale of sheep, purchase and sale of cattle, running a corner store, purchase and sale of potatoes and potato flour, and milk production.  

The credit that will be taken will benefit the small micro-businesses of the group members, one of whom is Epifanea.  She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer one cycle ago, entering by invitation from a promoter of the institution who went to her house to visit her.  Currently she has a business producing milk.  She says that she has been working in this area for many years, since it is a family business.

The credit that she will receive is for the care of her cows (to purchase feed), and she will purchase feed  from her own community and then feed it to her cows.  This form of work allows her to generate income in order to support her family as much as possible, since she is married and has 3 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the area focused on Health.

loans.use: To purchase feed for cattle

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children; three of her children go to school. 

She operates a restaurant at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the past eight years. She works seven days a week.

She has requested a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy serving utensils for her restaurant and foodstuffs like bunches of bananas, beef, and rice.  Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. 

Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked restaurant and to buy a plot of land and build a house. She lives in a rented house; the family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy serving utensils and stocks of bananas, beef, and rice.

loans.name: Mohamed's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you teachers of this primary school in  Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. Teachers and workers of various institutions usually apply for loans from SMT/Kiva lenders. At the end of each month, the bursar or person in charge of paying salaries in the institution will deduct the borrowers’ monthly repayments and remit them to SMT on their behalf. 

The workers of this school have applied for their second loan from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of their first Kiva loan (SLL 5,000,000), some bought furniture, others paid school fees for their children, etc. Having successfully repaid that loan, they are requesting a new loan of SLL 6,000,000 in order to again buy or invest in items that they cannot afford with their salaries.

Mohamed, 28 years old, is the leader of the group. He was born in the village of Gbatoma, about 58 miles from Kenema. Mohamed is married to a housewife and has one child, not yet school aged. Mohamed has requested a loan of SLL 1,500,000 to buy house building materials such as corrugated iron, nails, boards, etc. to continue building the house begun with the help of the first loan.

loans.use: to buy house building materials such as corrugated iron, nails, boards, etc. to continue building the house begun with the help of the first loan

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children; three go to school. 

She operates a restaurant from home.  She has been in business for the last five years. She works seven days a week.  

She has requested a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy serving utensils for her restaurant and also bananas and beef. Her major business challenge is transportation and seasonality. 

Her goals and aspirations are to buy a plot of land and build a house. She lives in rented house the family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major expenses include power and school fees.

loans.use: To buy serving utensils, bananas, and beef

loans.name: Nelly Antonieta

texts.es: Nelly es estudiante de la carrera de Contabilidad, está en el último año de estudios y el crédito lo solicita para pagar el curso de finalización de estudios y poder obtener su título, ya que por el elevado costo no puede asumir el pago de una sola vez. Actualmente labora en el area de finanzas y eso le está ayudando a reforzar los conocimientos aprendidos. Desea seguir estudiando para poder desarrollarse mejor en el ámbito profesional.
texts.en: Nelly is studying accounting. She is in her last year of studies, and she is applying for a loan to pay for her last course to complete her studies and to obtain her degree, since because of the high cost she cannot make the payment all at once. She is now working in the area of finance, and this is helping her to reinforce what she has learned. She wants to continue studying to develop further in her professional area.

loans.use: to pay for the graduation course for her program

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.es:
La socia Norma tiene 18 años de edad y es soltera, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mi Perú” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella es natural de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella es una joven responsable que estudia la carrera profesional de Obstetricia y va en la mitad de su carrera pero también en sus horas libres se dedica administrar el negocio familiar. Ella y sus padres tienen una pequeña librería donde vende diferentes útiles de escritorio. Ya son dos años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad la socia Norma requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo cuadernos, lapiceros, borradores, papel y otras cosas más. El sueño de la socia Norma es abrir una distribuidora o sea vende al por mayor útiles de escritorio y también es terminar su carrera profesional.   

La socia Norma se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Norma is 18 years old and single. She belongs to “My Perú” Community Bank, which is part of the Arariwa Association. She is a native of Cusco and she lives in the same city where she was born. She is a responsible young person and is studying Obstetrics. She is halfway finished with her studies. In her free time she works in the family business. She and her parents have a small bookshop where they sell different items for desks. They have had this business for two years and it has been going well, thanks to their hardwork. Norma is asking for this loan in order to buy merchandise such as notebooks, pencil cases, erasers, paper and other things. Norma’s dream is to open a distribution business where she sells desk items at wholesale prices. She also wants to pursue her professional career in obstetrics. 
Norma is grateful for the opportunity to have this loan and promises to pay her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as notebooks, pencil cases, erasers, paper and other items.

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Faridah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with five children; only one child goes to school. She also takes care of three additional family members (elderly parents). 

Faridah is a tailor. She operates her business from home. She has been in this business for the past eight years. She also gets additional income through operating a pay phone. She works six days a week.  

She has requested a loan of 100,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy material for making clothes. Her major business challenges are transportation, defaulters, and seasonality. 

Her goals and aspirations are to own a tailoring school and also to educate her children up to the university level. She lives in her own house; the family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major expenses include paying for electricity and school fees.

loans.use: To buy materials for making clothes

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children; two of her children go to school. 

She sells local gin at the market.  She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this  business for the past two years. She works seven days a week.  She has requested a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy jerrycans of local gin. Her major business challenges  are  transportation and seasonality. 

Her goals and aspirations are to invest in used clothes, to buy a plot of land and build her own house, and also to  educate her children up to the university level. She lives in a rented house; the family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local gin to sell at the market.

loans.name: Bitijuma

texts.en:
Bitijuma lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom go to school. She does not take care of additional family members. For the past 4 years, Bitijuma has worked seven days a week selling foodstuffs such as sweet potatoes and bananas at the market. She also earns additional income by selling piped water.

Bitijuma has requested a loan of 100,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT – SACCO to buy more sweet potatoes and onions. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Bitijuma's goals and hopes are to educate her children to university level and to own a fully stocked restuarant. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to piped water and electricity. Bitijuma's major expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more sweet potatoes and bananas

loans.name: Sarmila

texts.en:
Sarmila is 32 years and married, with two children, aged 13 and 6.  

In 2005, she established her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid seven loans from Patan BPW.  She used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, small grocery stores like hers are called pasals.  They are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  

By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. 

In the future, Sarmila plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries for her store.

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.es: La Sra. Enriqueta de 46 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos que aun dependen de ella económicamente. Ella tiene un negocio familiar el cual el giro es una frutería. Su esposo se dedica a la entrega de mercancía en los ranchos de la localidad. Enriqueta sabe que pronto uno de sus hijos ingresara a la universidad es por eso que tiene que aumentar sus ingresos para apoyarlo. En esta ocasión ella está solicitando de nuestra ayuda para la compra de mercancía.
texts.en: Señora Enriqueta is 46 years old. She is married and has 3 children who still depend on her economically. She has a family business based on a fruit stand. Her husband's work is delivering merchandise to the ranches in the area. Enriqueta knows that soon one of their sons will enter the university, and this is why she needs to increase her income to help him. She is now applying for our help to buy merchandise.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her fruit stand

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is 29 years old and married. She has one child, and her husband is a journalist. She runs a tailoring business from her house. She will purchase additional supplies with the loan, including a sewing machine and clothes. She started this business in 2009 with her own money, and now she is requesting a $600 loan to improve her business. She lives in a house made of bricks and zinc for a roof. She wants to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies, including a sewing machine and clothes

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 25 years old and married. She has two children and her husband is a security guard.  She has a kiosk in front of her home; and she plans to  purchase additional supplies, including biscuits, sugar, coffee and rice, for her store with this loan. 

She opened her kiosk In 2009 with her own investment of $500.00.  She wants to buy a car and she wants to make her business better in the future.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, sugar, coffee and rice to sell.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en: Ermelinda is 43 years old and married. She has four children, and all of them are in the school. Her husband is a farmer. She has a kiosk in front of her home to supply the people in her village with basic goods. She will purchase additional supplies for her store with the loan, including noodles, candles, soft drinks, and alcoholic drinks. She opened her kiosk in 1999 with her own money. She lives in a simple house with four rooms, and the house is made of bricks and zinc. She wants to expand her business and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase noodles, candles, soft drinks, and alcoholic drinks

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 27 years old, and she is married. She has three children; the eldest is in school. Her husband is a security guard. 

She has a kiosk in front of her home to supply people in her village with basic goods. She will purchase additional supplies for her kiosk with the loan, including rice. 

She started this business in 2004 with her own capital of $150.  She wants to become rich in the future and send her children to get a good education.

loans.use: to buy rice and other supplies for her kiosk

loans.name: Rosa Marleny

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida y dos hijos. Ella administra una pequeña tienda, además, desde hace cinco años se dedica a realizar cultivos, actividad que le enseño su esposo. Los insumos agrícolas los adquiere en una ciudad que esta a cincuenta kilómetros de su hogar, las compras las realiza en grandes cantidades para ahorrar un poco. Ella aprovecha el viaje que realiza para comprar la mercadería de la tienda, para comprar los insumos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando Rosa, es para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, plaguicidas y mano de obra; para cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Con la inversión obtendrá una buena producción, debido a que aplicara los insumos a tiempo y en las cantidades correctas, obteniéndolos a un mejor precio. De la producción que obtenga una parte será destinada a la alimentación de su familia y la otra para la venta en su tienda, con el objetivo de obtener más ingresos para bienestar de su familia. Su propósito es ahorrar para continuar cultivando y adquiriendo mercadería para la tienda.
texts.en:
Rose is 35 years old. She lives with her life partner and two children. She runs a small store. In addition, for five years she has grown crops, a business that her husband taught her. She acquires her agricultural supplies in a city that is 50 kilometers from her home. She buys in large quantities to save a little. She takes advantage of the trips she makes to buy merchandise for her store to also buy her supplies.

The loan that Rosa is applying for is to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides and pay for labor to grow 14,000 square meters of corn. With the investment she will obtain a good production, because she will apply the ingredients on time and in the correct quantities, as well as obtaining them at a better price. From the production that she obtains, part will be destined to feed her family and the rest will be sold in her store, with the goal of obtaining more income for the well-being of her family. Her plan is to save to continue farming and acquiring merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides and pay for labor

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es: La socia Emiliana tiene 34 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mi Perú” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella es natural de la ciudad de Puno pero vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, ella se dedica a su hogar pues es una excelente ama de casa pero también se dedica a la administración de su pequeña ferretería donde vende diferentes tipos de productos como por ejemplo clavos, pinturas, esmaltes, tornillos  y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad la socia Emiliana requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo pinturas, clavos, pernos y otras cosas más. La socia Emiliana se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: The borrower Emiliana is 34 years old and married. From this relationship she has two children. She belongs to the “Mi Perú” ["My Peru"] communal bank of the Arariwa Association. She is originally from the city of Puno, but she lives in the beautiful city of Cusco. She dedicates herself to her household, since she is an excellent homemaker, but she also works managing her small hardware store, where she sells various types of products, such as nails, paints, enamels, screws and other items. On this occasion, Emiliana needs the loan to buy supplies such as paints, nails, bolts and other items. Emiliana is grateful for the opportunity provided through this medium, and accordingly she is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as paints, nails, bolts and other items.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.en: Carlota is 31 years old and married. She has five children, two of whom are in school.  Her husband is a farmer. Carlota wants to buy pigs, goats and chickens with this loan. She started her business in 2011 with her own capital of $300.00. She lives in a house made of bricks and zinc for the roof. She wants to buy a bus in the future and support her children's education.

loans.use: To buy pigs, goats and chickens to sell.

loans.name: Belina

texts.en:
Belina is 28 years old and single.  She is requesting a $600.00 loan so she can buy additional items for her store including soft drinks and hard drinks. 

Belina opened her kiosk in 2011 with a working capital of $500.00. She is staying with her parents and wants to build a good house in the future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and hard drinks to sell.

loans.name: Elizaria

texts.en: A $600 loan is requested by Elizaria to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store. She is 33 years old and married to a man who is a government worker. She has six children, and five of them are in school. She has been working even harder to find money in order to support her family. She opened her kiosk in 2005 with $250. She wants to open a big store in the future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, coffee, and rice

loans.name: Alda

texts.en:
Alda is 44 years old, and she is married. She has three children, all of them in school.  Her husband is a business man. 

She is taking a $1,000 loan to buy pigs, chickens, and goats. She has been doing this kind of activity since 1991, with a working capital of $50.  She has also a garden to grow vegetables. 

She wants to buy a car and build a good house in the future.

loans.use: to buy pigs, chickens, and goats.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 42 years old, and she is getting married to a man who is working for the government. She has two children, both in school. 

She has a kiosk in front of her home to supply people in her village with basic goods.  She will purchase additional supplies for her kiosk with the loan, including flour, oil, soap, and vegetables. She opened her kiosk in 2008. 

She wants to open a big store in the future.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, soap, and vegetables for her kiosk.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs, chickens, and goats.

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en: Joselito is married and has six children. He is 44 years old and resides in Locsoon, Tudela. Joselito operates a gardening business to earn a living. He has been in this business for seven years. Each month, he earns 4,000 PHP from doing this type of work. He requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. In 2011, Joselito joined GDMPC. In the future, Joselito wants to save money as a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase another plot of farmland.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio, age 61, operates a transportation services business. Rogelio has been in this business for nine years and earns 5000 PHP a month. He lives in Mialen Clarin, Misamis Occidental, and has seven children.

In 2006, Rogelio joined GDMPC. He is requesting a loan of 9000 PHP which he will use to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en: Carolina is 36 years old and married. She has seven children, and three of them are in school. Her husband is a cleaner. She will use the loan to buy animals, like chickens, pigs, and goats. She started this business in 1999. She has been earning a good income. She lives in a simple house made of bricks and zinc, and she wants to build a good house for her family.

loans.use: To buy chickens, pigs, and goats

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en: Jenelyn is 33 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She resides in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She runs a tricycle transport business to earn a living. She has had this business for 4 years and earns 5,000 PHP per month. In 2009, she joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 10,100 PHP from GDMPC to purchase spare parts and accessories. Jenelyn hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family by sustaining and expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is a 52-year-old resident of Lapasan, Clarin. She provides for her 3 children from the little amount of 7,000 PHP she receives monthly from her computer-services business. She has been doing this for seven years as an aid to her husband's income. In 2007, she became a member of GDMPC. She has applied for a loan from GDMPC in the amount of 7,500 PHP to buy supplies such as bond paper, inks, etc. She wants to make an expansion to her business one day.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as bond paper, inks, etc.

loans.name: Mañaneras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MAÑANERAS iniciará el ciclo decimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Angélica es la Presidenta.
