Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de vajillas, servicios técnico de administración, tienda de abarrotes, venta de celulares, tejido de mantas, venta de polleras, ladrilleras, venta de calzados, comerciante de productos varios.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Angélica es integrante, ella indica que hace un ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su suegra ya que ella pertenecía a un banco comunal. En la actualidad ella tiene dos negocios uno es la venta de calzados y el otro es la costura de ropa de niños; nos cuanta que estos negocios lo aprendió de su suegra cuando ella le ayudaba   a trabajar, posteriormente ella decidió realizar estas mismas actividades pero con entrega a domicilio.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento del capital (compra de tela y compra de calzados) que adquirirá de su suegra y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el compartir con las demás compañeras.
texts.en:
The communal asocation "Mañaneras" will begin its tenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the regional office of Villa Exaltación. It is composed of 10 members and is governed by a board of directors, of which Señora Angélica is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal association run are varied. Among them we have selling food, selling dishes, technical administrative services, grocery store, selling cell phones, weaving blankets, selling skirts, making bricks, selling footwear, and selling various products.

Part of the loan that they will take out will benefit the little microbusinesses of Señora Angelica. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer one cycle ago, joining at the invitation of her mother-in-law, since she belonged to a communal bank. Now she has two businesses. One is selling footwear, and the other is sewing clothes for children. She tells us that she learned these businesses from her mother-in-law when she helped her work. Later she decided to carry out these same businesses but with home delivery.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital (buy fabric and footwear), which she will acquire from her mother-in-law and later sell on order. This form of work allows her to generate resources to help her family as much as possible, since she is married and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes sharing with the other members.

loans.use: to buy fabric and footwear

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is taking a $1,000 loan to improve her family business.  She is 42 years old, and her husband is a carpenter. She is using the loan to buy wood, nails, and some other needed items for her husband to do his work. 

They started this business in 2000 with a working capital of $500. She wants make their business bigger and get more money to support their children to go to school.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, and some other materials.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 40 years old and lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamis City. She is married and has four children. 

She owns and operates a small stall where she sells assorted food and snack items.  Arlene has been in this business for six years. She earns PHP 8,000 each month from her business. 

Arlene has requested a loan of PHP 10,500 from GDMPC to purchase additional food items, such as assorted foods and hot dogs, to sell. 

She has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, Arlene hopes to expand her business and earn more income for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional food items, such as assorted foods and hot dogs, to sell.

loans.name: Julio Euloterio

texts.es: El socio Julio tiene 44 años de edad, es casado y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, él pertenece al banco comunal “Mi Perú” de la Asociación Arariwa, él es natural de la ciudad de Puno y desde hace varios años que vive en la ciudad del Cusco, él es un padre responsable que se dedica a la fabricación de estructuras metálicas como puertas, sillas, ventanas, etc. Ya son 3 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad el socio Julio requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo pinturas, soldadura, fierro y otras cosas más. El sueño del socio es fabricar herramientas de calidad y poder exportar a diferentes países. El socio Julio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Communal bank member Julio is 44 years old. He is married, and from this union he has two children. He belongs to the communal bank "My Peru" of the Arariwa Association. He is a native of the city of Puno and has lived in the city of Cusco for a number of years. He is a responsible father who works in the fabrication of metal structures such as doors, chairs, windows, etc. He has already worked in this business for three years, and it is going very well for him. At this time he needs a loan to buy working materials such as paints, solder, iron, and other items. His dream is to make quality products and be able to export to different countries. Julio is grateful for the opportunity offered through the loans and also promises to make his payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy working materials such as paints, solder, iron, and other items

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
Dante is married, with two children.  He is 39 years old and lives at Capucao, Ozamis City. 

Dante operates a coconut plantation to earn a living. He has been eight years in this business. Each month, he earns PHP 6,000 doing this work. 

He requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to pay for farm maintenance. 

In 2008, Dante joined GDMPC. In the future, he wants to save as a reserve for emergencies and to purchase more farm land.

loans.use: to pay for farm maintenance.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is from Dalapang, Ozamis City. She is 55 years old and married, with four children. 

To make a living, Adela been in the gardening business for six years. She earns PHP 5,000 a month. In 2008, Adela joined GDMPC. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her gardens.

loans.name: Huanar

texts.en:
Huanar is 42 years old. He lives with his wife and four children in the western province of Mongolia. His wife is unemployed. His four children go to secondary school, and sometimes they help their father with his business. 

From 2010, when his family moved to the center of the province, Huanar has started to sell organic kumiss -- the national beverage, fermented organic milk of mares -- to local residents.  Now he has three mares. The product he offers is marketable year-round. 

He decided to buy a car to deliver his products. The car costs 3,000,000 MNT.  He would like pay 1,000,000 MNT from the income generated from his business, and he is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to pay for the rest.

loans.use: To buy a car to carry his organic kumiss to sell.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.ru:
Магдалина – из Виноградово. Она занимается очень интересным видом деятельности: она ездит по школам и детским садикам, устраивая разнообразные представления, сценки и концерты для детей. С самого начала Магдалина работала одна, не нанимая никого другого в помощники. Вначале было трудно, но благодаря своей настойчивости Магдалине удалось разрекламировать себя. Сейчас Магдалине иногда ей немного помогает сестра. Магдалина – очень талантливая, она сама пишет стихи и песни, а также свои книги.  

Магдалине необходимы дополнительные средства в размере 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить музыкальное оборудование (сопилки, гусли, маракасы и т.д.) и игрушки для детей, которые понадобятся ей в последующих представлениях. У Магдалины есть мечта – со временем записать диски со своими песнями. В будущем она планирует выступать не только в Украине, а также ездить на концерты и за рубеж.
texts.en:
Magdalina is from Vinogradovo. She has a very interesting profession: she travels to schools and childcare centers and puts on various kinds of shows, short plays and concerts for children. At the beginning Magdalina used to work by herself without recruiting any assistants. It was hard at first, but thanks to Magdalina’s resilience she eventually managed to promote her services. At present Magdalina’s sister sometimes helps her out. Magdalina is very talented. She writes poems and songs and is a book author.

Magalina needs additional funds in the amount of 5,000 UAH in order to buy musical instruments (traditional Ukrainian flutes, psalteries, maracas etc) and children’s toys, which are going to be needed in future performances. Magdalina’s dream is to be able to record  CDs with her songs some day. 
In the future she plans not only perform in the Ukraine but also travel to give performances abroad.

loans.use: to buy musical instruments (traditional Ukrainian flutes, psalteries, maracas etc) and children’s toys.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is married and has five children. Dolores is 42 years old and resides at Kinuman Sur, Ozamis City. Dolores owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting corn for sale to earn a living. She's been seven years in this business. 

Each month, she earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In 2011, Dolores joined GDMPC. 

In the future, Dolores wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela is married with five children. She is 43 years old and lives in Tabid, Ozamis City. 

Shiela owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for eight years and earns PHP 5,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 5,500 to purchase farm chemicals. 

Shiela has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Shiela's plan is to save her returns in order to buy a new house.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Afepeb Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AFEPEB est composé de cinq personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Rita Élisabeth Sessi est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Rita Élisabeth Sessi a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Rita Élisabeth Sessi est âgée de 55 ans et est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Maxime. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Rita Élisabeth Sessi vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Rita Élisabeth Sessi vend depuis quinze ans, des tissus et des sachets d’eau (Pur water) à son domicile et par le système de distribution. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Rita Élisabeth Sessi s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Rita Élisabeth Sessi sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AFEPEB, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Les premiers crédits reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group AFEPEB is composed of five persons who reside in the same district. This is the fourth time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost business. The group's representative, Rita Élisabeth Sessi, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She dropped out of elementary school,  and she is 55 years old and married to a retailer named Maxime. The couple have three children, all in school and in their care.  Rita Élisabeth Sessi lives together with her children and husband. The couple share in covering the different household expenses. 

To help with different family needs, Rita Élisabeth Sessi has been selling cloth and packs of water (PUR water) out of her house and via the distribution system for fifteen year.  This business enables her to meet her needs without much problem. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin.

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Rita Élisabeth Sessi is requesting, along with the other members of the group AFEPEB, a fourth loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to boost their level of business and grow their customer base and revenues. The previous  loans received were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and packs of PUR water to sell

loans.name: Iderbaatar

texts.en:
Iderbaatar is 48 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger, in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. His wife, Oyunhuu, is 48 years old, and is unable to work. His son, Mungun shagai, is 26 years old, and works at Bridge group. 

Iderbaatar started to make furniture for ger (Mongolian yurt) in 1990. A ger is Mongolian nomadic tent, consisting of a wooden frame, felt walls and felt insulation.  Gers are designed to be easy to take apart, transport and reconstruct, and are environmently friendly compared to construction of a house or an apartment. 

Custumors appreciate his products as quality and fashionable. Iderbaatar wants to expand his business in order to increase his business income. He is a well-experienced and hardworking man. He would like MNT 3,000,000 to purchase wood and other materials for his business.

loans.use: to purchase wood and other materials for his business.

loans.name: Neema Group

texts.fr: Muyengo est une cliente  ambitieuse, présidente du groupe de crédit  Neema ;  est  âgée de 46 ans. Mère de 6 enfants  tous scolarisés,  est mariée à un fonctionnaire de l'Etat. Elle est vendeuse des médicaments  depuis  1993. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir à l’approvisionnement d’un carton de médicament. Son vouloir est de  devenir grossiste et prie Dieu de bénir Hekima d’avantage.
texts.en: Muyengo is an ambitious client and the president of the loan group Neema. She is 46 years old, the mother of six children, all in school, and married to a national civil servant. Muyengo has been a seller of medicines since 1993. This new loan will serve to supply her with a box of medicine. Her wish is to become a wholesaler. She prays that God will bless Hekima further.

loans.use: to purchase a box of medicine

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Jajo Group

texts.fr: JAJO est un groupe de cinq personnes, dont les membres sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Yèhomin Christine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 47 ans et est mariée à un certain Henri. Le couple a sept enfants, tous scolarisés dont cinq restent à leur charge. Yèhomin Christine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Yèhomin Christine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari, les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis plus de trente ans, Yèhomin Christine vend des condiments et des poissons fumés à son domicile. Yèhomin Christine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la quatrième fois que Yèhomin Christine et les autres membres du groupe JAJO sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
JAJO is a group of five persons whose members are friends residing in the same district. The group's representative, Yèhomin Christine (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 47 years old and married to a man named Henri. The couple has seven children, all in school. Five of the children remain in their care. Yèhomin Christine did not attend school. She lives together with her children and husband, and along with him, she ensures that the different household expenses are covered. 

For over thirty years, Yèhomin Christine has been selling condiments and smoked fish out of her home. She gets her supplies from a market of Benin. 

This is the fourth time that Yèhomin Christine and the other members of the group JAJO have requested financial support from ALIDé with the aim of bolstering their working capital and their business and responding better to the requirements of their customers. The loans previously received were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase condiments to sell

loans.name: Evelin Cecilia

texts.es:
Evelyn, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de continuar invirtiendo en el negocio, para mantener productos en variedad como el arroz, frijoles, sal, aceite, golosinas, entre otros materiales que son necesarios para poder mantener a los clientes.

Con el préstamo anterior ha logrado tener más surtido el negocio y de esta manera ha mejorado su servicio los clientes, sus circunstancias familiares están mejorando, así también han mejorado sus ingresos hasta el momento ha mantenido una condición estable con su familia.
texts.en:
Evelyn has decided to request a new loan because she needs to continue investing in her business and stocking a variety of products, such as rice, beans, salt, oil and sweets, among others, which are necessary in order for her to retain her customers.

With the previous loan, she succeeded in expanding her business inventory and therefore she has improved service to her customers. Her family circumstances are improving and her earnings have also improved. So far, she has maintained her family in a stable condition.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, salt, oil and sweets.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 48 years old. She is married with three children and resides at Bagakay, Ozamis City. 

Gemma owns a motorcycle-transport business for a living. Every month, Gemma earns 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP), and she's been in this business for four years. 

Gemma requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. She's been a member of GDMPC since 2010. Gemma's future plan is to have her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Mahfurat

texts.en:
Mahfurat is married and has three children. She is a person who always tries to earn money and provide her children with good quality living conditions. Her husband went to Russia to find a job. He can’t support Mahfurat and that’s why she must work hard. 

With the aim of improving her living conditions, Mahfurat began her own business six years ago, dealing in animal husbandry. Now, she is one of the best and most successful business women in the local market. She buys cattle, cares for them for two or three months and on-sells to local people. Thanks to her work, her cows are fat and attract a lot of customers. Mahfurat has six sheep and two cows at the present time. 

Mahfurat is asking for a loan of TJS 6000 to buy cattle. In this way, she hopes to provide her family with a high quality of living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Maendeleo Group

texts.fr: La cliente Ntakobajira est une femme dynamique,  âgée de 53 ans. Trésorière du groupe de crédit Maendeleo est mariée à un homme d’affaire et  mère de 8 enfants tous scolarisés.  Elle vendeuse des rideaux usagers au marché central de la ville. Le crédit sollicité va lui servir à l’achat de 5 ballons des rideaux usagers. Son vœu est de construire une maison d’habitation familiale ; ainsi, elle remercie Hekima  pour ses actions.
texts.en: This client, Ntakobajira, is an energetic woman, who is 53 years old. The treasurer of the loan group Maendeleo, she is married to a businessman and is the mother of eight children, all with education. She sells used curtains at the city's central market. The loan requested is going to be used to purchase 5 bales of used curtains. Her wish is to build a family house; thus, she thanks Hekima for its actions.

loans.use: to purchase 5 bales of used curtains to sell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Corina

texts.es:
La socia Corina tiene 38 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mi Perú” de la Asociación Arariwa y es natural de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la mima ciudad donde nació, ella es una madre responsable que saca adelante a su familia por lo tanto ella se dedica a la venta de tara y cochinilla y sus producto lo exporta a país de Alemania. Ya son catorce años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad la socia Corina requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería tara y cochinilla. 

La socia Corina se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: This member, Corina, is 38 years old and married and has two children, who are the fruit of this union. She belongs to the "Mi Perú" Communal Bank of Asociación Arariwa. She is a native of the city of Cusco and lives in the same city where she was born. She is a responsible mother who is moving her family ahead. Thus, she dedicates herself to the sale of tara and cochineal and exports her products to Germany. She has spent 14 years in the business and it is going very well thanks to her hard work. At this time Corina needs a loan to buy tara and cochineal merchandise. She is grateful for the opportunity provided her through this loan and is committed to making her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase the merchandise, tara and cochineal.

loans.name: Muazzam

texts.en:
Muazzam is married and has three children. She is a hardworking woman with a great desire to progress in life. Her partner went to Russia to find a job. They live in the house she has succeeded in building thanks to her husband's great dedication.

She is one of the successful business women of her town. For more than ten years, she has been busy with selling vegetables. She knows all aspects of her business very well. Her experience and skills help her to develop her business, and in this way improve living condition.

She wants to develop her business further, but her income is small and she needs your help and mercy. She is asking for a loan of TJS 4,000 to buy vegetables to sell. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Matar

texts.fr: Monsieur Matar est un enseignant  qui exerce ses fonctions dans une des localités sénégalaises. Depuis plus de 10 ans  il s’adonne a l’activité de commerce pendant les trois mois de vacance scolaire en vue de vaincre l’oisiveté et de se procurer des revenus supplémentaires  pour mieux gérer ses charges familiales. IL est marié et responsable d’une famille composée de 5 membres .Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC de la localité ou il vit  et y a déjà remboursé 7 prêts antérieurs. Il sollicite un crédit  de 250 000 frs prévu pour l’achat  d’articles en provenance d’un pays limitrophe du Sénégal tels que chaussures, sucre, blousons. Il souhaite renforcer son fond de roulement,  accroitre ses bénéfices  et améliorer les conditions de vie sociale de sa famille. Son vœu futur consiste à disposer d’un grand établissement privé dans le domaine de l’éducation.
texts.en:
Mr. Matar is a teacher who carries out his duties in a Senegalese town. He has devoted himself for over ten years to commerce during the three months of school vacation with the aim of overcoming idleness and bringing in extra income, so as to manage family expenses better. He is married and the head of a family composed of five members.

Mr. Matar is a member of one of the U-IMCEC branches in his town where he lives and has already paid back seven previous loans. He is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs for buying goods, such as shoes, sugar, and coats, from a country bordering Senegal. 

He would like to bolster his working capital, grow his profits, and improve his family's living situation. His future wish includes having a large private establishment in the domain of education.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, shoes, and coats to resell

loans.name: Marie Jeanne

texts.fr: Marie Jeanne est une femme âgée de 36 ans mariée et mère de 02 enfants dont un scolarisé. Elle est commerçante dans un quartier de la capitale où elle exerce cette activité depuis 05 ans .Sa gentillesse  envers son entourage lui a  fait accroître une clientèle au fil du temps. La petitesse de son capital ne lui permet plus les exigences de sa clientèle. Elle sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra d'accroître son stiock de marchandises afin d'équilibrer l'offre et la demande. Les bénéfices générés l'aideront à étendre son activité et améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Marie Jeanne is a 36-year-old woman who is married and the mother of two children, of whom one is in school. She is a merchant in her district in the capital where she has been operating her business for five years. Her kindness to those around her has meant a growth in her customer base over the course of time. 

Her low capital fund no longer allows her to meet the demands of her customers. She is requesting a loan enabling her to increase her stock of merchandise to stabilize the supply and demand situation. The profits generated will help her to expand her business and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Hundik

texts.en:
Mr. Hundik is 46 years old. He lives with his wife and five children in a small house in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife, Meiremgul, is 46 years old. His older daughter, Ainur, is 21 years old. She is a college student. His older son, Umirbek, is 19 years old. He is a college student. His next older daughter, Gulnur, is 14 years old. She is a secondary school student. His younger two sons Adilbek and Jaalinbek are aged 12 and 11. They are secondary school students.  

He started his business in 2000 by making home utilities out of steel at his home and selling them at the local market. With steel waste, he makes iron cookers, stoves, smoke holes and iron supplies for construction. 

He needs 1,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase electric welding equipment for his business.

loans.use: To purchase electric welding equipment for his business.

loans.name: Librada

texts.en:
Librada is a 72-year old entrepeneur from Cabungaan, Clarin. She is a widow, and has two children. 

She earns a living from a coconut and banana production business which she started almost 25 years ago, and now earns PHP 6,000 a month.

She joined GDMPC Micro Credit in 2007, and has borrowed PHP 7,000 to buy fertilizer to improve her business. Before long, Librada hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to obtain fertilizes

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married with three children. She is 48 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Tangub City. 

Teresita owns and operates a plot of farm land, cultivating coconuts to earn a living. She has been in this business for 15 years and earns PHP 7,000 each month. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase farm chemicals. Teresita has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC since 2009. In the future, Teresita's plan is to save her returns in order to buy another plot of farm land.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Mwaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is 43 years old and lives in Tiribe, Kenya. She is married with seven children. 

For four years, Mwanaisha has operated a general store where she sells different kinds of basic products, such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, flour, food for snacks, and other items. She earns approximately 12,000 KES a month. 

Mwanaisha is requesting a 10,000 KES loan to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. With this loan, she will be able to buy maize and wheat flour; and will use half of the loan to pay school fees for her form three daughter. 

She has a great plan for her future and for the family, and she wants to expand her business, increase her profit, and open some other businesses.

loans.use: to buy maize and wheat flour; and to use half of it to pay school fees.

loans.name: Wend La Malgda Group

texts.fr:
Mme MAMOUNA représente le groupe WEND LA  MALGDA. Mariée, elle est mère de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 27ans et le moins âgé a 10ans. 05 vont à l’école et elle a 07 personnes en charge.

Mme vend des céréales  depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de KILWIN. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter 02 sacs de maïs.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut renforcer son activité. Mme ambitionne agrandir son commerce et s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. MAMOUNA represents the group WEND LA  MALGDA. She is married and the mother of seven children. The oldest is 27, and youngest is 10. Five of them go to school, and she has seven persons to support. 

Ms. MAMOUNA has been selling grains for ten years. She gets her supplies from the KILWIN market. Her customers are men and women. 

She wants to buy 2 sacks of corn. 

With the profits, she wants to bolster her business. Her ambition is to expand her business and take care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of corn to sell

loans.name: Amissamba

texts.fr: Revendeuse de bazins et de draps il y a 12ans, madame Amissamba est mère de 02 enfants dont 01 à l’école. Ils sont âgés de 08 et 02ans. Son conjoint est secrétaire dans une société de la place. Elle sollicite dans notre institution un second prêt pour acheter des bazins et des draps. Avec les profits réalisés, elle veut vendre en gros afin d’avoir des bénéfices et assurer la formation scolaire des enfants.
texts.en: A retailer of damask cloth and bed sheets for twelve years, Ms. Amissamba is the mother of two children, aged 8 and 2, of whom one is in school. Her spouse is a secretary in a local company. Ms. Amissamba is requesting a second loan from our institution to buy some damask and bed sheets. With the profits made, she wants to sell in bulk in order to have profits and to ensure her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase bed sheets and damask cloth

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is from Dalapang, Ozamiz City. She is 39 years old, married and has one child. Aida owns and operates a business raising crops, planting and harvesting corn for sale. She has been in her business for 10 years and earns 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. 

In 2007, Aida joined GDMPC. Aida is requesting a loan of 8,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Verna

texts.en: Verna is married with 2 children. She is 38 years old and resides at Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Verna owns and operates a retail business, selling gasoline to motorists to earn a living and she's been in this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns 4,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 to purchase additional fuel to sell. This year, Verna joined GDMPC. Verna hopes to be able to build a house and to have her children finish their schooling.

loans.use: to purchase additional fuel to sell

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is married and has six children. She is 37 years old and resides at Dalapang, Ozamis City. 

Mila operates a farming venture. She plants, harvests and sells coconuts and bananas to earn a living. She's been in this business for ten years. She earns PHP 6,000 each month for doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Mila joined GDMPC in 2008. In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 40 years old, married to Purity, and is blessed with three children aged 16,12 and 7 years old. He has been in the business of crop farming for three years, from which he earns KES 20,000.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy farm inputs for using in his farm to help produce better yields. He will use the profits that he earns to educate his children and to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Mekhrubon

texts.en: Mekhrubon is 27 years old and married. She has 2 little children. She sells women’s clothes to earn a living. She has been in the business for 3 years. Through the financial support from her husband, she has managed to grow her business. She dreams of expending her business and becoming prosperous in the future. She needs a loan to of 2,400 USD to buy women’s clothes to widen her assortment. She is looking for your help.

loans.use: To buy women’s clothes to widen assortment

loans.name: Medarda

texts.en:
Medarda is a 54-year-old widow. She lives in Silanga, Tangub City. Medarda cultivates coconuts for a living. She's been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In 2009, Medarda joined GDMPC. Positively, she simply hopes for her business to improve.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a widow and has eight adult children, two of whom still attend school. She operates a business selling chickens. In this way, she pitches in to meet the family expenses.

Dzame started her home-based chicken business nine years ago and now has established customers. She also sells green vegetables to generate more income.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy chicks, which she can buy at better prices in quantity, and to buy feed for other animals. This will also allow her to do better business by offering a greater variety of animals. She also wants to buy sacks of tomatoes, potatoes and onions and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed.

loans.name: Mame Yandé

texts.fr: Madame Mame Yandé vit au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 4 et 17 ans. Elle s’active depuis plus de dix ans dans le secteur du commerce plus précisément dans la vente de tissus et babouches. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC ou elle a déjà remboursé 5 crédits antérieurs. Elle sollicite un prêt de 250 000 frs prévu pour le renforcement de son fonds de roulement. Le financement sera utilisé pour l’achat de tissus et de babouches qu’elle va revendre a ses clients. Son objectif est de développer son activité de commerce, accroitre ses bénéfices pour mieux soutenir sa famille dans leurs besoins quotidiens.
texts.en:
Ms. Mame Yandé lives in Senegal. She is married and the mother of five children, from 4 to 17 years old. She has been active in commerce for over ten years, that is, in selling fabrics and slippers. 

She is a member of a U-IMCEC branch where she has already paid back five previous loans. She is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs for bolstering her working capital. This financing will be used to purchase fabrics and slippers that she will resell to her customers.

Her goal is to develop her business and grow her profits, so as to do better in meeting her family's day-to-day needs.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and slippers for resale

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 35 years old. She is married to Michael and blessed with a 13-year-old son. She sells clothing, a business she started six years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES. 30,000 (Kenyan shillings). 

She has requested a first loan of KES. 30,000 to purchase trouser suits, ladies' shoes, handbags and pants for sale. 

The profit from her business will help her open a business shop in town. She dreams of building her own house, opening up a supermarket, and thus, becoming a great businesswoman.

loans.use: To purchase trouser suits, ladies' shoes, handbags and pants for sale.

loans.name: Kighan

texts.en:
Kighan is a 31-year-old man from Kisumu County, situated along the shores of Lake Victoria. He is married to Alice and they have a five-year-old child.

He operates a barbershop and salon business which he has been doing for the last 11 years and makes a monthly income of Kes 30,000. He is now taking his seventh loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy furniture for the salon and also to expand the barbershop. 

He will use the expected profits to improve the family’s living standards. He dreams of being on top in his area of business.

loans.use: To buy furniture for the salon and expand his barbershop

loans.name: Enagnon 10 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ENAGNON 10 est composé de quatre personnes qui exercent les mêmes activités et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Moligui Roger est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Moligui Roger est âgé de 50 ans et est marié à un certain Pauline. Moligui Roger n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a six enfants à leur charge, dont certains scolarisés. Parmi les six enfants, un n’est pas leur propre enfant. Moligui Roger vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme. Moligui Roger partage avec sa femme, les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Moligui Roger exerce la mécanique, activité qu’il a apprise et qu’il exerce depuis vingt neuf ans dans sa région. Parallèlement à cette activité, Moligui Roger vend de l’huile à moteur. Ces activités lui permettent de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Moligui Roger s’approvisionne au Bénin et au Nigeria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Moligui Roger sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ENAGNON 10, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Les premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group ENAGNON 10 is composed of four persons who have the same work and who belong to the same tontine. This is the third time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost business. The group's representative, Moligui Roger, is the one in the photo with his hand raised. He is 50 years old and married to a woman named Pauline. Moligui Roger did not attend school. The couple support six children, not all in school. Among the six children, one is not their own. Moligui Roger lives together with his children and wife. He and his wife share in covering the different family expenses. 

To help with different family needs, Moligui Roger has been a mechanic since having learned the trade 29 years ago in his region. Parallel to this work, he sells motor oil. These businesses enable him to meet his needs without much problem. He gets his supplies from Benin and from Nigeria.

Seeking to satisfy his customers and to increase his sales and revenues, Moligui Roger is requesting, along with the other members of the group ENAGNON 10, a third loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to boost their level of business and grow their customer base and revenues. The previous  loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and motor oil

loans.name: Jomy

texts.en:
Jomy is 40 years old. He is married and has five children for whom he has always wanted to provide a good quality of life. It’s for this reason that eight years ago, he began own business with driving. Thanks to the good service he provides, he has managed to gain many customers. Since he’s had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improving; now, his children are able to get a good education, and the financial challenges are being solved little by little. 

He is asking for a loan to buy a new car. In this way, his business will have the opportunity to provide better service and increase his income, which will allow him to offer his children and wife a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 43 years old, and is a hardworking and resolute woman with a strong desire to advance in life. Her partner works as a farmer. They have eight children, five of whom attend school.

She sells consumer products in a retail shop. She buys the products from a nearby town, and from a supplier who supplies her with merchandise on Mondays and Fridays. Her main customers are her relatives and friends. Amina has been doing this for the last ten years, and is grateful for the good results she has achieved. What she likes about her business is that she can manage her spare time and invest it in socializing with her family. Amina also likes to have an income to support her partner with the household expenses.

This is her second loan with Yehu. She is thankful for the opportunity to have a credit line to help her expand her business.
With the requested amount of KES 10,000, Amina will buy stocks of wheat flour, cooking oil and dates for the preparation of Ramadan festivals.

loans.use: buy stocks of wheat flour, cooking oil and dates.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is from Ozamiz City. She is 60 years old and is married. To make a living, she buys and sells flowers. She has been in her business for six years and earns 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. 

In 2007, Alicia joined GDMPC. Alicia is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to buy more flowers to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more flowers to sell.

loans.name: Jahongir

texts.en:
Jahongir is 61 years old and married. He has six children, and all of them are adults. He sells Tajik national shoes, skullcaps, suits, etc., to earn a living. He has been in the business for 20 years. Through the financial support from the Imon International organization, he has managed to grow his business. He dreams of expending his business and becoming prosperous in the future. 

He needs a loan of $3,000 USD to buy goods such as shoes and skullcaps for widening his assortment of good to attract more customers. He will look forward to your help.

loans.use: To buy goods such as shoes and skullcaps.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock of shoes for sale.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
La socia Claudia tiene 24 años de edad y es separada de su pareja pero tiene un hijo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mi Perú” de la Asociación Arariwa y es natural de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la mima ciudad donde nació, ella es una madre responsable que saca adelante a su familia por lo tanto ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad. Ya es un año que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad la socia Claudia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo gaseosas, sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, tarros de leches, bidones de aceites y otras cosas más.

La socia Claudia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Claudia, 24, is separated from her partner and has a child.  She belongs to the communal bank "Mi Peru" in the Asociación Arariwa.  She is a native of the city of Cusco, and she lives in the same city where she was born.  She is a responsible mother who provides for her family.  She has a business selling consumer staples.  She has had this business for a year already, and it is going very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.  At this time, Claudia needs a loan to buy merchandise, for example: soft drinks, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, jugs of milk, drums of cooking oil, and other products. 

Claudia is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means, and she promises to comply with the established payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, jugs of milk, drums of cooking oil, and other products

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 46 years old and lives in Molicay, Ozamis City. She is married with 1 child. 

For a living, Emma owns a snack vending business and sells snacks like pancakes and banana cue. She has engaged in this business for 11 years. She earns PHP8,300 each month from this work. 

Emma has requested a loan of PHP10,000 at GDMPC to purchase raw ingredients for snack preparation. In the future, Emma hopes to have more products to sell and have her own snack store.

Emma has been a member of GDMPC since 2007.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for snack preparation.

loans.name: Nariet Duka

texts.en:
Duka is a 45-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has 5 children between the ages of 6 and 17. All of them go to school.

Duka has run a fish selling business for 8 years. She has no employees. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income. She is taking a loan of 1200sdg to purchase fish and other items to sell. In 5 years Duka would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. Duka says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a 42-year-old lady from Kakamega County, Western Kenya and is married to Aaron. They have seven children between 2 and 19 years old.

Millicent sells second hand clothing and window curtains, a business she has been doing for the last six years and makes a monthly income of KES 10,050. She is taking her third loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase new clothing and window curtains to sell. 

She will use her profits to start a new business. Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing and window curtains to sell

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula, 40, is married to Chai and lives in Samburu, Kenya. They have five children who still depend on them.

Nyamvula has had her grocery store and milk shop for the last 10 years. She has a very good clientele and gets help from her husband. Together, they run the business. 

She’s asking for this loan to buy sugar, oil, meat, tea, rice and other items to be able to offer a variety to her customers, thus improving her income.

loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, meat, tea, rice and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tobacco to sell

loans.name: Hakim Idri

texts.en:
Hakim is a 41-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has six children between the ages of 4 and 18 years old. All of the children go to school.

Hakim runs a general store and has been in business for four years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. He is taking a loan of 2,500 SDG to purchase Irish potatoes, onions, oil and many other items. In addition to this business, he has no other source of income.

In five years, Hakim would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high prices in the market. Hakim says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy items like irish potatoes, onions, oil etc

loans.name: Dolgor

texts.en: Mrs. Dolgor is 41 years old and lives with her husband and five children in the ger district in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband makes archery targets and archery-related leather products. She started her own organic dairy product trade business in the local trade center in 2000. She is requesting a 5,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more organic dairy products from the countryside for her business. She said, "My business efficiency and profit in incurred by expanding organic dairy product trade business and improving my life". She is a friendly and good-hearted woman. In the future, she is planning to sell fruit.

loans.use: To purchase more organic dairy products to sell

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is 46 years old and a hardworking and entrepreneurial man. His partner is a farmer and the mother of his five boys and three girls. He operates a motorcycle taxi, which he has run for the last 15 years. He is struggling hard to provide for his family. He likes the work because it distracts him, he feels very productive, and he is able to pay the household expenses. Since he needs to have a greater income, Rashid helps his wife in farming during his free time. He is taking out this loan to pay school fees for his form two child. 

This will be his third loan with Yehu and he feels content that he is able to count on the support of working capital. Since he wants to be able to continue having this help, he promises to make timely payments on his loan.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 37 years old, married to James and blessed with three children ages 16, 10 and 2. She sells grocery goods, a business she started five years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 40,000. 

She has requested a first loan of KES 15,000 to purchase more vegetables, potatoes and tomatoes for sale. The profit from her business will help her purchase sacks of charcoal to sell. 


She hopes to do well in this business and open up a supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, potatoes and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is always looking to provide a better future for his family, and he has always achieved this. Francis is very well-known in his area and is very responsible. He is very attentive towards other people. 

Francis is taking out a loan to invest in his poultry business. He has been operating this business for 2 years, rearing broilers and layers. In addition, he rears cows on his farm. Francis has decided to request a loan from Yehu to buy chicks, chicken feed, and medicines. 

He is very happy to have made this decision because it will guarantee that his income will increase, and he will be able to fulfill his dream of opening a retail shop. He pledges to make his loan repayments on time and even ask for more loans to continue investing in business.

loans.use: to buy chicks, chicken feed, and medicines.

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.en:
Dilshod is 32 years old. He is married with 4 children to whom he has always wanted to provide a good quality of life. His wife is a housewife. Dilshod is the only income earner in the family. For this reason, three years ago he began his own driving business. Thanks to the good service he provides, he has managed to gain many customers. 

Since he has had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improving. Now that the children are able to get a good education and the financial challenges are being solved little by little, Dilshod is asking for a loan to buy new car. He awaits your support. Please, help him if it is possible.

loans.use: to buy a new car.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda, 35, is married with three children and lives in the Philippines. Merlinda is a farmer and she cultivates her garden to earn a living. She has been doing this for eight years and every month she earns 4,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 9,500 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. Merlinda been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Merlinda hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Oyundari

texts.en: Oyundari is 43 years old and lives with her husband and three children in an apartment in Orhon Province, Mongolia. Her husband, Erdenebat, is 43 years old. He runs a taxi service and agriculture business. He plants organic potatoes and other organic vegetables on 1.5 hectares of farmland. Her older son, Dorjburam, is 21 years old and  is a collage student. Her younger sons, Tsogtbayar and Ganbayar, ages 19 and 11, are secondary school students. Oyundari started her business in 2001. She operates a business selling paperback books, toys and households goods in the trading center. Her working capital is about 10 million MNT.  Because she decided to help her husband`s business, she requests a 5000000 MNT loan to spend on salaries and transportation of her husband`s harvest and to carry organic vegetables. She is an ethical and amiable woman.

loans.use: to cover salaries and transportation costs of her husband`s harvest and to sell organic vegetables

loans.name: Chenga

texts.en:
Chenga is 34 years old and lives in Samburu. Chenga raises goats on her property. She mentions that she has been doing this job for over four years.

She says that all of her work requires a great deal of sacrifice, which means that it entails a lot of work and care, as the animals require constant care. She dreams of being able to double the number of animals she has in order to earn more for her household.

She is requesting the loan to purchase more animals to raise and later sell. She says that the loan will be of great use to her and she is grateful to Yehu Microfinance for the opportunity it has provided her.

loans.use: to purchase more animals

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 38 years old and married to Wellington. She is blessed with three children who are 14, 12 and 8 years old. She sells grocery goods, a business she started five years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 35,000. 

She has requested a first loan of KES 20,000 to purchase more tomatoes, vegetables and charcoal for sale. The profit from her business will help her buy additional stock. 

She hopes to do well in this business and build a house of her own.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, vegetables and sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is now 29 years old and has two children aged 4 and 10 years. She is married to Sylvester.

She is now taking her second loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy textile materials for dressmaking. 

She is happy her monthly income is now KES12,000.

loans.use: to buy textile materials for dressmaking.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson continues to work in his Agrovet business. Thanks to his hard work, he has achieved good results from his business. He is grateful for the support given and hopes that he will continue to move forward. Samson is requesting another loan to purchase more fertilizers and chemicals to restock his store. He plans to open another Agrovet in the neighboring town. This will increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizers and chemicals to sell

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira is a 21-year-old retail shop proprietor in Mombasa. She is also a student at a local university pursuing a degree in business management. She is single. She has been running her shop business for the past year with great success. At the same time, she attends part-time classes at the university. 

This is Munira’s first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to pay for her university fees. She hopes to do well in her studies and have a bright future.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena is from Dalapang, Ozamis City. She is 45 years old. Nena is married and has four children. To make a living, Nena owns and operates a business raising crops. She been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns 7,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Nena joined GDMPC. Nena is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 39-year-old banana seller in Mombasa. He is a married father of three. He has been selling bananas at wholesale for the past eight years with great success. 

This is Joseph’s third business loan from KADET LTD.  He plans to purchase more bananas from upcountry to supply to his customers in Mombasa. 

He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to repay his loan. He hopes to have a booming, well-established business.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Rusianah

texts.en:
Rusianah is a 38-year-old green grocer in Kongowea, Mombasa. She is a married mother of three. She has been selling groceries for the past three years with great success. 

This is her second loan with KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more kale, bananas, tomatoes, cabbage and carrots. 

She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and to expand her business further. She hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more kale, bananas, tomatoes, cabbage and carrots

loans.name: Adiyajav

texts.en: Mr. Adiyajav is 31 years old and lives with his wife and his daughter in the ger district in the Dornod province in Mongolia. His wife's name is Duurenbileg. She helps with his freight transportation business and his daughter goes to kindergarten. Mr. Adiyajav has been involved in the freight transportation business for four years. Currently, he needs a 1,500,000 MNT loan to buy a new vehicle in order to continue his freight transportation business. He has a good sense of humor and is a friendly man.

loans.use: To buy a new vehicle

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 39 years old and lives in the Gardabani district. He lives with his wife and mother. David’s wife works as a doctor and gets a monthly salary. His mother is provided with a retirement pension. David has a poultry farm and has been in this business for five years. He has 750 hens and takes good care of them. David is a hardworking man who is responsible and very well known in the area for his big heart and friendliness with others.

David requested a loan to purchase 600 chicks and expand his poultry farming. The other part of the loan will be used for chicken feed. David will raise chickens and then sell the hens at a good price. He considers his business to be profitable, since it generates a good income that enables him to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy some charcoal.

loans.name: Xiomara Elena

texts.es: Xiomara con su anterior credikiva compró materias primas, como telas, hilos correderas, botones y en general todo cuanto necesitó para dar respuesta a sus clientes. Así generó un poco mas de utilidades e incirtió y aumentó el numero de ellos. En la actualidad planea seguir creciendo y por eso está accediendo a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará nuevamente en un mayor volume los rollos de tela, para obtener descuentos por compras de contado y al pormayor; ella aprovechará que cuenta con una clientela fija y muy puntual para pagarle, por eso se siente muy satisfecha. Su mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva es el siguiente: "Gracias, sigan apoyando los sueños y metas de los microempresarios"
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Xiomara purchased primary materials like cloth, sliding thread, buttons, and, in general, everything she needed to fill her customers' orders. In that way she generated a little more profit, so she invested that and increased her profits. 

Now she plans to continue growing. To do that she is getting another Kiva loan with which she will again purchase a greater volume of bolts of cloth in order to get a discount for buying wholesale and in cash. She will take advantage of the fact that she has a stable customer base which is very punctual in paying her, and she is very satisfied with this. 

Her message to the Kiva lenders is the following: "Thank you. Keep supporting the dreams and goals of micro entrepreneurs."

loans.use: to buy bolts of cloth.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vitamins and medicines.

loans.name: Tomas Antonio

texts.es:
Tomás, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir en sus actividades, ya que está iniciando la siembra de granos básicos de los cuales espera tener una buena cosecha y poder vender parte de la producción, compra será en abono, insecticida, pesticidas, que son necesarios para prevenir las plagas y poder fortalecer la producción.

En efecto que tuvo un préstamo anterior fue mejorar las cosechas y sus ingresos, ya que logró comercializar parte de dicha producción, sus circunstancias familiares han cambiado viviendo en mejores condiciones, a traves de estos prestamos el continua realizando su trabajo.
texts.en:
Tomás has decided to get a new loan to be able to invest in his work. He is beginning to plant basic grains and he hopes to have a good harvest and be able to sell a portion of the produce. He will buy fertilizer, insecticide, and pesticides which are necessary to deter pests and strengthen production. 

The effect of the previous loan was an improvement in his harvest and income. He was able to sell a portion of his produce. His family circumstance have changed and the live in better conditions. By way of these loans he continues to carry out his work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and pesticide.

loans.name: Mayra Magaly

texts.es:
Mayra, se decidio por un nuevo préstamo ya que necesita invertir en materiales para la producción en su negocio, esta compra y le dará materiales como el aceite, maíz, leña, condimentos, quesillo, gas, entre otros materiales que son necesarios para poder continuar realizando las ventas.

Con el préstamo anterior logró crecer en elaboración de los productos, ha logrado tener todo lo necesario para que sus condiciones económicas en la familia continúe mejorando,  está muy agradecida con estos préstamos pues le han dado una mejor solvencia.
texts.en:
Mayra decided to get a loan because she needs to invest in production supplies for her business. Through this she will purchase supplies like oil, corn, fire wood, spices, cheese, and cooking gas, among other things that are necessary to continue making her sales. 

With the previous loan she was able to increase her production output. She has been able to do everything necessary so that her family's financial situation will continue to improve. She is very grateful for these loans as they have made her more solvent.

loans.use: to buy oil, corn, fire wood, spices, cheese, and cooking gas.

loans.name: Dolores Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Dolores, tiene 54 años de edad, tiene un hijo mayor de edad, vive en Olanchito, Yoro junto a su esposo.
Ella es muy trabajadora, se gana la vida vendiendo comida desde hace 8 años. El negocio lo tiene en su casa y vende a sus vecinos. Ofrece la venta de pastelitos rellenos de carne, baleadas (tortilla de harina con frijoles, queso, huevo etc.)Tajadas con pollo frito y refrescos. Ha sido cliente de ODEF de dos préstamos anteriores y actualmente solicita el tercer préstamo que es por 8,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar todos los insumos necesarios para la elaboración de comidas y refrescos para la venta. Así tendrá más producción y venta y va atender mejor a su clientela.Su meta es servir siempre a su clientela y obtener buenas ganancias para darle lo  mejor a su familia.
texts.en: Señora Dolores is 54 years old and has an adult child. She lives in Olanchito, Yoro, with her husband. She is a hardworking woman who has made a living for eight years selling food. She runs the business out of her house and she sells to her neighbors. She offers beef stuffed pastelitos [corn turnovers], baleadas (a flour tortilla with beans, cheese, egg, etc.), and tajadas [fried plantain]. As a client of ODEF, she has taken two previous loans and she is currently requesting a third loan for 8,000 Lempiras. With it she will purchase all of the necessary supplies to make food and drinks to sell. This way she will have more production and sales as well as be able to better serve her customers. Her goal is to always serve her customers and make a good income to provide the best for her family.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies such as flour, meat, cheese, butter, spices, rice, bananas, oil, etc.

loans.name: Placidie

texts.en:
Placidie is 40 years old and is married with five children aged between four and twenty years old. 

She purchases and sells various goods, such as tomatoes, onions and aubergine. Placidie has been in this business for five years. She works from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day of the week with two people to help her. 

Placidie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods, such as tomatoes, onions and aubergine, for resale. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy various vegetables, such as tomatoes, aubergine and onions, for resale.

loans.name: Sorofina

texts.en:
Sorofina is a 52-year-old landlady in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. She is a married mother of three children. 

She has been managing rental houses for the past fourteen years and she is doing great. She also sells charcoal to supplement her income.

This is Sorofina's third loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to renovate her rental houses. She will use the anticipated profits to build more houses for rent. She hopes to own several rental houses in Mombasa.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Kanga

texts.en:
Kanga, 41, is married to Mwalimu. They have two children and they live in downtown Samburu. 

Kanga has had a boutique for more than ten years in a strategically located spot in the village of Samburu. She sells assorted articles of clothing, such as shirts, t-shirts, sandals and belts, for cash and on credit. Thanks to her sacrifice she’s getting ahead and also helping her husband with everyday expenses.

She’s asking for the loan to increase her stock of clothing, because sales always increase starting mid-year, and she wants to be prepared in the best way possible to provide her customers with quality and variety of clothes.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.

Mercy is a farmer and she operates a banana plantation to earn a living. She has been doing this for ten years and every month she earns PHP 3,000 from this work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Mercy been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Mercy hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Kalbubu

texts.ru:
Калбубу 58 лет, вдова, проживает с семьей сына и помогает воспитывать внуков. 40 лет назад, в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Калбубу начала заниматься животноводством. Начав этот бизнес с суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний  день в хозяйстве Калбубу имеется 2 дойные коровы с приплодом, 3,6 га орошаемой земли, где она выращивает картофель и зерновые культуры. Ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет  8,000 сом. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Калбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойных коров для увеличения надоев.  Доходы от кредита Калбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Kalbubu is 58 years old and a widow. She lives with her son's family and helps bring up her grandchildren. Forty years ago Kalbubu made animal farming the main source of income for her family. Having started this business with 5,000 KGS, Kalbubu currently has two dairy cows and their calves and 3.6 hectares of irrigated land, where she grows potatoes and grains. The monthly income from the farm is 8,000 KGS. 

To expand her business further, Kalbubu has contacted Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 70,000 KGS to buy dairy cows to increase her milk yield. Kalbubu plans to invest the earnings from this loan to expand her farm further.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is married and has two children. The eldest child is married and the youngest is already working.

Leonora sells different varieties of cosmetic products within the village where she lives. She has been operating this type of business for three years. Aside from direct selling, she is also involved in an agricultural business where she runs 4000 square meters of rice fields and one hectare of corn farm as the primary source of income for family.

Leonora would like to take out for a loan in the amount of PHP 3,000 to be able to buy all the cosmetic products needed by her customers. She hopes to obtain more cosmetics in order for her to encourage more customers to buy her products. She needs to provide all the orders of her customers, in order for her to be able to earn a greater income and to have continuous growth of her direct selling business. In this way, she could obtain all the farm supplies needed for her farming business without borrowing it from traders who have higher interest rates. She knows that this amount would have a big impact in the pursuit of her dreams in life.

loans.use: to buy additional cosmetic products for her direct selling business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is 61 years old and is married with four children. She lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamis City. 

For the past seven years, Ethel has run a retail store for a living. She earns PHP 4,000 each month. 

Ethel joined GDMPC in 2007. Ethel is requesting a loan of PHP 5,400 to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc. She will use the additional revenue generated from her loan to save as a reserve for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Batmakhan

texts.ru:
Батмахан 53 года, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Батмахан в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 20 лет занимается полеводством  - выращиванием хлопка, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 500 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Батмахан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 1 га орошаемой пашни с кукурузой и 1,22 га орошаемой земельной доли с хлопком.   
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Батмахан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку ядохимикатов и удобрений для обработки земли.  Доходы от кредита Батмахан планирует откладывать на оплату контракта на обучение для сыновей.
texts.en:
Batmakhan is 53 years old and married with 2 children. She grows cotton as the main source of income for her family, having started her business with 500 KGS. Thanks to her dedicated labor, there is currently a 1-hectare irrigated corn field and 1.22-hectare irrigated cotton field on her farm. 

In order to develop her business further, Batmakhan has applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 KGS to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her land. She plans to save up the income from the loan to pay for her sons' education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more shirts, skirts, dresses and trousers.

loans.name: Nyota

texts.en:
Nyota is 29 years old and is a mother of two children. She is divorced.

Nyota started her food stall more than three years ago. Thanks to her perseverance and commitment, Nyota has been able to nurture her two children. 

As a result of Nyota's good service and friendliness, along with help from her family, her business is improving with each day. Her goals are to continue working, feel useful, and move forward. Nyota needs a loan to buy rice, noodles, and baked goods to restock her business since these are the products that sell the most. She is grateful for the help she has received and views it as a good opportunity to make progress.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, and baked goods to restock her business.

loans.name: Chori

texts.ru: Чори проживает в районе Кубодиен. Ему 56 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Его дети находятся на заработках за границей. Чори зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Животноводство является единственным источником дохода в его семье. Чори более шести лет занимается животноводством у себя дома. Он просит кредит для закупа двух телят и корма для скота.
texts.en: Chori lives in the Qubadiyon region. He is 56 years old, married, and has five children. His children work abroad. Chori earns his living by raising cattle, and animal husbandry is the only source of income for his family. Chori has worked in animal husbandry from his home for more than six years. He is requesting this loan in order to buy two calves and feed for his cattle.

loans.use: To buy two calves and feed for his cattle

loans.name: Nazi

texts.en:
Nazi is 54 years old and lives in Tskaltubo district. She has a husband, a son and a daughter-in-law. 

Her son owns a store selling fruit and vegetables. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they own a plot of land where nuts are grown.  Nazi is involved in an animal husbandry business as well. She has four milking cows and three pigs. Nazi milks her cows every day and produces cheese. She sells cheese, dried fruits and piglets at the local open market. All of the family members work hard, but they still don’t have enough income to improve their living conditions.

Nazi requested a loan to repair their living room, which is damaged and uncomfortable. With this loan she will be able to purchase building materials. Nazi and her family members will be able to spend their evenings after a hard working day in a more comfortable environment and improve their living conditions. She hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair the living room.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.en:
Rufino is married and has 5 children. He is 46 years old and resides at Sinusa, Ozamis City. Rufino owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting bananas for sale to earn a living and has been 10 years in this business.

Each month he earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. He requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Rufino has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Rufino wants to make improvements to his house and see his children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Natalina

texts.en:
Natalina is 38 years old and she is married. She has 3 children: two of them are studying in primary school, another one is in secondary school and her husband is a farmer.

She is selling secondhand clothes, so she is taking a loan of $600 to buy more clothes to sell. In 2009 she started to do this business and she is earning a good income. When she started this business, she used her own working capital of $500.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Sreang

texts.en:
Sreang is a 32-year-old single man. He is a villager from a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, where cashew is the most popular cash-crop for growing to earn a living. 

For Sreang, his income generating business is not different from the other villagers. He manages one hectare of farmland for growing cashew, in order to earn a daily income to support himself and his family, especially his sibling. He has been engaged in this business for fifteen years, earning about 26,000 KHR per day. 

Sreang has taken loans with VisionFund for two cycles. He has completely paid back the entire loans, which have helped him to better support his business and to earn a decent income to tackle the daily family's needs, plus sending his sibling to school. Now, he is taking out a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and insecticide for his plantation. He hopes that his efforts will be return him with higher yields, in order to make more income to upgrade his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for his plantation.

loans.name: Keremetkan

texts.ru:
Кереметкан 52 года, вдова, воспитала 3 детей. Кереметкан в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении  14 лет занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 6,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Кереметкан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 5 дойных коров с приплодом, 40 голов мелкого рогатого скота,2 лошади, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 4,000 сом (KGS). Также Кереметкан обрабатывает 3 га земли, где выращивает картофель, подсолнух, кукурузу в качестве корма для скота. Сезонные доходы от бизнеса позволяют Кереметкан платить за обучение дочери и сына столице.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кереметкан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота – молодняка.  Доходы от кредита Кереметкан планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Keremetkan is a 52-year-old widow, who raised three children. As the main breadwinner for her family, she has worked in field crop farming and animal husbandry for 14 years. She began her business with a sum of 6,000 somoni. Thanks to her persistent work, Keremetkan currently has 5 dairy cows and their calves, 40 sheep and goats, and 2 horses on her farm. Her farming provides a monthly income of about 4,000 somoni. 

Keremetkan also works 3 hectares of land where she grows potatoes, sunflowers, and corn for livestock feed. The seasonal income from her business allows Keremetkan to pay for her daughter's and son's educations in the capital. 

With the goal of long-term business development, Keremetkan turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 130,000 somoni in order to purchase young livestock. Kerematkan plans to use the income from her loan to invest in the development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a shopkeeper whose business is located in her home. She has a well-stocked grocery store and makes a lot of sales because she lives in a very busy area. She has an established customer base made up of passengers, wage earners, etc. Her husband works in the tourism sector and has a small establishment in a neighboring area.

Florence tells us that her goal is to maintain and strengthen her work place.
