This is why she has come to Yehu Microfinance and she is grateful to them for having given her the opportunity to obtain this loan for stocking her business with foodstuffs, drinks, rice, sugar and other products that she sells every day. She is grateful to Yehu Microfinance and Kiva for the opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, drinks, rice, sugar and other products

loans.name: Afrim

texts.en:
Afrim is a married man with four children who lives in the Roma community. In this community, most of the people play musical instruments at weddings. Afrim has been in this business for more than 20 years. The summer is a popular time for people to get married, which generates much business for him and he is well paid. 

This results in Afrim having to budget his income to cover those months when he is not working as he has no other source of income. Afrim is requesting a loan so that he can repair and buy new musical instruments. The loan will allow him to make even more money. 

In this way, he is hoping to offer a better life to his family. He is very grateful for this opportunity and he appreciates all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to repair and buy new musical instruments

loans.name: Mercilita

texts.en:
Mercilita, a widow, is 57 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Mercilita owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 5 years and earns 3,000 PHP each month.

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Mercilita has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, since 2011. Mercilita hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Luka

texts.en:
Luka is characterized as being honest, honorable, and hard-working in his relations with his community and work companions.

He is requesting another loan with the objective of investing in the establishment of a kiosk. With this loan, he will be able to purchase sugar, tea leaves, wheat and maize flour, etc. His principal objective is to provide his family with a quality life.

It is worth mentioning that he has already benefited from Kiva financing and he wishes to thank Kiva investors. With these loans he has been improving his home. The previous loan helped him to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, tea leaves, wheat and maize flour, etc.

loans.name: Ellchin

texts.ru: Elchinu 28 let. On sirota, jivet s bratom I sestroy. Ix roditeli pogibli vo vrema Karabaxskoy voyni.  Elchin molodoy biznesmen I glavniy kormilec v semye. Sfera ego biznesa eto selskoe xozaystvo. On prodayet sir, moloko, maslo I masyo na bazare I doma. U nego staj  v biznese 13 let, on vedet svoe delo s uverennostyu I eto xoroshiy pokazatel dla molodogo cheloveka. Elchin jenit svoe brata I emu nujni dengi. On obratilsa za 1000 AZN kreditom dla svadebnix trat.
texts.en: Ellchin is 28 years old and is an orphan who lives with his brother and sister. Their parents died during the Karabakh war. Ellchin is a young businessman and the main breadwinner for his family. His sector of business is agriculture, and he sells cheese, milk, and butter at the bazaar and at home. He has been in business for 13 years and conducts his business with self-confidence, which is a good characteristic in a young man. Ellchin's brother is getting married and needs money. He is requesting a 1,000 AZN loan for wedding expenses.

loans.use: To support his brother's wedding expenses.

loans.name: Maxym

texts.ru:
Максим женат. У него есть дочка от жены, которой 10 лет. 

Максим со своей семьей живет в селе, но на работу ездит в соседний город.Он работает водителем на Нежинском  Хлебозаводе. Дочка его тоже учится в этом городе. Поэтому всегда стояла проблема транспорта. Максим трудолюбивый и открытый. Он любит свою семью и заботится о ней.

Максим просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 8000 гривен на покупку машины. У него есть уже часть денег, но этой суммы ему не хватает. Новая машина значительно облегчит ежедневные поездки.
texts.en:
Maxym is married and has a 10-year-old daughter with his wife. Maxym and his family live in a village, but he travels to a neighboring city for work. He works as a driver for a bakery in Nezhin.  His daughter also goes to school in that city. For this reason, there has always been a problem with transportation. Maxym is a hardworking and upstanding man. He loves his family and looks out for them.

Maxym is requesting a loan in the amount of 8,000 hryvnia for the purchase of a car. He already has a portion of the money, but he does not have enough for the cost. A new car will significantly make daily travel easier.

loans.use: to purchase a family car.

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es: Mario Antonio de 56 años de edad, casado, desde hace 22 años que se dedica a la carpintería, iniciativa de trabajo que la adquirió con aprendiz de una carpintería, ya que con el tiempo decidió poner su propia carpintería con un poco de ahorro que tenia, en la actualidad ha podido obtener buenos ingresos, gracias a su buen trabajo, responsabilidad, con sus clientes. El negocio consisten en la elaboración de todo tipo de muebles como: sillas abuelitas, roperos, centro de entretenimientos, cómodas, escritorios, camas, cunas, el financiamiento lo quiere para equipo de trabajo como: sierra cortadora de madera, madera, clavos, pega, martillos, piches, make, barniz entre otros.
texts.en: Mario Antonio is 56 years old and married. For 22 years he has worked in carpentry. He acquired the intiative to work with a carpentry apprenticeship. After time, he decided to open his own carpentry shop with some small savings that he had. Now he has been able to obtain good income, thanks to his good work and responsibility with his customers. The business is making all types of furniture such as rocking chairs, dressers, entertainment centers, hutches, desks, beds, and cradles. He wants the loan for work equipment such as: a woodcutting saw, wood, nails, glue, hammers, clips, varnish and more.

loans.use: to buy a woodcutting saw, wood, nails, glue, hammers, clips, varnish and more.

loans.name: Gulsaira

texts.ru:
Гулсайре 49 лет, вдова, воспитала 4 детей. Гулсайра работает социальным работником в сельской управе  и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении  12 лет занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гулсайры в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 1 дойная корова с приплодом, 15 голов мелкого рогатого скота, 1 лошадь, 1 нетель,  ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 5,000 сом (KGS). Также Гулсайра обрабатывает 1,2 га земли, где выращивает фасоль, кукурузу и картофель. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулсайра обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойных коров в целях увеличения надоев.  Доходы от кредита Гулсайра планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса посредством реконструкции сарая и улучшения условий содержания скота.
texts.en:
Gulsaira is a 49-year-old widow who has raised 4 children. She works in an agricultural administrative office. 

To supplement her family's income, for the last 12 years Gulsaira has grown crops and raised cattle. Despite beginning with a sum of only 15,000 Kyrgyzstan Som (KGS), thanks to her persistent hard work Gulsaira now has 1 dairy cow and calf, 15 head of sheep and goats, 1 horse, and 1 heifer. Gulsaira also has 1.2 hectares of land where she grows beans, corn and potatoes. The monthly income from her farm is 5,000 KGS. 

Gulsaira has contacted the company Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS, in order to further develop her business by purchasing more dairy cows to increase milk production. She plans to use the income generated by this expansion to renovate her barn and improve conditions for raising her animals.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Lesya

texts.ru:
Леся просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 10000 гривен на закупку демисезонной одежды. Кредит поможет ей увеличить прибыль, а тем самым благосостояние семьи.

Леся продает женскую одежду на рынке родного города на протяжении пяти лет. Несмотря на то, что опыт работы  небольшой, она уже смогла позволить себе купить машину. Леся знает, какой товар интересен покупателям. Весной Леся дополнительно продает овощи и семена. (Предыдущий кредит был потрачен именно на этот бизнес). 

Леся замужем. Ее супруга зовут Евгений. У них есть два сына.
texts.en:
Lesya is married and she and her husband Yevgenij have 2 sons. 

Lesya has been selling women's clothing at her hometown marketplace for the last 5 years. Lesya understands the tastes of her customers and, despite her relatively short period of business experience, she has managed to earn enough to purchase a vehicle. In addition to selling clothes, Lesya sells vegetables and seeds, a business for which she previously received a Kiva loan. 

Lesya is now seeking a loan in the amount of 10,000 Ukrainian Hrvina to purchase seasonal clothing for resale. This loan will help her to increase her profit, thereby improving the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is from Samburu, Kenya.  She is 30 years old and is the companion of Joseph.  She sells fruits and vegetables in a little shed at the market.

With sacrifice and dedication and with the help of her husband, she managed to get her four children ahead.  She is a very hardworking woman. She says she  has always worked and is not afraid of challenges. Her goal is to be able to continue growing, and have a bigger shed, and to continue helping her family and her husband.

Edna is requesting a loan from Yehu Microfinance and Kiva to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, green peppers, carrots, and onions, as well as seasonal fruit.  She hopes to be able to supply her business with top-quality products to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, green peppers, carrots, and onions

loans.name: Ichalaou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ICHALAOU est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Samata est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Samata est âgée de 27 ans et est mariée à un conducteur du nom de Séïdou. Samata n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Samata est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à la charge du couple. Samata vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins du ménage. Pour y parvenir, Samata vend depuis sept ans, du maïs et du mil dans son quartier. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Samata s’approvisionne dans le nord du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Samata  sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ICHALAOU, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Ichalaou group has three members who all live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is called Samata, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. She is 27 years of age, and is married to a driver called Séïdou. She did not go to school, and is a mother to four children, all of whom are at school and under the care of the couple. 

Samata lives together with her children and husband. Together the couple covers the various household needs. To do so Samata has worked for seven years selling corn and millet in her neighborhood, and this business has allowed her to provide for herself without much difficulty. 

Samata gets her supplies in northern Benin. In order to satisfy her customers and increase her turnover and income, along with the rest of the members of the Ichalaou group Samata has requested a second loan from Alidé. This loan will allow them to increase their business levels, as well as obtaining more customers and higher income. Their first loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: To buy corn and millet.

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en:
Residing in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Thorn is 59 years old and a mother of three children. She works as a chef at a local restaurant run by Korean owner while her husband is a construction worker. Having been with this business for 30 years, she is able to earn about 13,000 KHR per day.

Thorn has formed a group of three female members to seek for the first loan from Kiva partner VisionFund. She and one of her fellow group member are applying for 300,000 KHR, while the third member is requesting 200,000 KHR. Her loan will be used to buy the below-the-ground materials, like tanks and pine, and to pay for the labor cost of building a decent toilet for her family. She hopes that this new toilet will help maintain standard hygienic for her family.

loans.use: To buy materials to build a decent toilet

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana tiene 45 años, es una mujer jovial y emprendedora, amante del trabajo y de las buenas costumbres, convive con Lenar desde hace muchos años, con quien tiene seis hijos. Actualmente, vive en su casa propia, al lado de su pareja y dos de sus hijos, ya que los demás son mayores de edad. 

Su trabajo es la venta de abarrotes y cosméticos, actividades que ha sabido complementar muy bien con el paso del tiempo. De manera periódica traslada los comestibles (arroz, azúcar, aceites, productos enlatados, embutidos y cereales) hacia los centros poblados y comunidades ribereñas asentadas, en viajes que duran como máximo una semana. Afirma que los habitantes de tales pueblos esperan siempre su llegada con el objetivo de adquirir todo lo necesario para abastecer a sus familias de alimentos. Lleva en este negocio cerca de 5 años y trabaja sola. Cuando no se encuentra de viaje por las riberas, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y productos de perfumería entre sus amigos y conocidos bajo el sistema de venta crediticia, cumple esta función desde hace 4 años. Le gusta su trabajo, pues le permite poder estar en constante actividad durante el día, generar ingresos para su hogar tranquilamente, además que le da tiempo por las noches de descansar y recargar energías para el día siguiente. Espera continuar trabajando, progresar y más adelante establecer una tienda de venta de abarrotes en su propia casa. 

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y está muy emocionada y agradecida por el respaldo económico que le ofrecen para continuar con sus planes, no quiere dejar de pagarlo por falta de dinero y es por eso que se compromete a ser muy puntual y sobre todo muy responsable. También está muy contenta de continuar con este grupo, ya que son muy cumplidos y amables.

Con el monto solicitado, 800 soles, comprará abarrotes y golosinas como galletas, caramelos, chicles, entre otros, que llevará a vender en los centros poblados ribereños.
texts.en:
Ana is 45 years old.  She is a cheerful and entrepreneurial woman that enjoys working and has a good work ethic.  She has lived with Lenar for many years and they have six children.  She now lives in her own home with Lenar and two of their children, since the other two are grown adults.

She sells groceries and cosmetics, activities that she done for some time. She sells groceries (rice, sugar, oils, bottled products, canned items and cereals) in the town centers and coastal communities, where she stays for up to one week.  She says that the people in these communities always hope that she comes so that they can buy everything they need to feed and support their families.  She has had this business for 5 years and she works alone.  When she is not traveling to the coast for work, she sells cosmetics and perfumes to her friends and acquaintances on a system of credit.  She has done this work for 4 years.  She likes her work because it enables her to be active and busy during the day and she can earn income to help support her household.  It also gives her time in the evenings to rest and recharge her batteries for the following day.  She hopes to continue working to get ahead and to one day establish a grocery store in her home.

This is her third loan with MFP and she is very excited and grateful for the economic support that they offer her so that she can continue with her plans.  She doesn't want the loans to dry up, so she promises to be very punctual and responsible with this loan.  She is very happy to continue working with this group as they are supportive and kind.

With the money from this loan, 800 soles, she will buy groceries and snacks such as cookies, candies, gum, and other items that she will take to sell in the coastal towns.

loans.use: to buy groceries and snacks such as cookies, candies, gum, and other items so that she can sell them in the coastal towns.

loans.name: Sinforoza

texts.en:
Sinforoza, 53 years old, is a married lady residing at Nailon, Tudela. Sinforoza owns and operates a retail store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She has been in this business for 13 years and every month, she earns 3,000.

Sinforoza requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase new items such as candy, milo, shampoo, soaps etc. She joined GDMPC in 2008. Sinforoza aims to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase candy, milo, shampoo, soaps etc. for her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sivorn's Group

texts.en:
Sivorn is a 30-year-old mother of two dependent children, one daughter and one son, who are the students at the local public school. Her entire family is living in a rural area of the Sa Ang district of Kandal Province, Cambodia. She works at the garment factory and her husband works as a construction worker in order to overcome the family's hardship. She manages to earn about 22,000 KHR per day from the job that she has been with for seven years.

Sivorn is the fourth-time borrower and her co-member is the first-time borrower with Kiva partner VisionFund. The past loans have enabled her to keep her children in school and better support her family. Now, she forms a group of two to request a latrine loan. Both of them are asking for the same loan amount, 200,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will use this loan portion to buy necessary materials for building a proper toilet for her home. She expects that this toilet will help her family prevent the diseases associated with the poor sanitation practices. She hopes, as a result, to pay more attention to increasing her income, and support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for building a proper toilet

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 66 years old, married to Emmanuel. She has been in the cereals business for 20 years, earning approximately KES.12,000 monthly. Tamar is requesting her second loan of KES.34,500 from KADET LTD., after successfully servicing her first loan.

She will use the loan to purchase dry maize and beans for resale. With the anticipated profits, she plans to save some and use the remaining amount to repay her loan. Her hope and dream is to open a cereals store in town so as to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase dry beans and maize for resale.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is from Samburu.  She is 51 years old and is married to Jira.  They have two children, both are independently working adults.

Nyamvula has a store in the municipal market of Samburu, where she sells clothing of all types, footwear, and more. She tells us that she has a regular clientele, thanks to the years that she has been working in this business, and this has given her a good income.

She is applying for the loan to purchase clothing such as T shirts, pants, and other items for her store.  This will help her to continue growing as a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase clothing such as T shirts, pants, and other items for her store.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana tiene 53 años, es una mujer amable, buena y muy trabajadora. Lamentablemente quedó viuda y desde entonces tuvo que hacerle frente a la vida y criar sola a sus hijos, ya que cuando sucedió eso tres de sus seis hijos aun eran menores de edad, por ellos tuvo que luchar mucho para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. De ellos solo queda Cristian, que es el menor y es el único que aún vive a su lado y depende de ella.

El trabajo de Ana consiste en hacer tortas y queques, a diario prepara estos deliciosos postres para que pueda venderlos en su barrio y zonas cercanas a su casa y para cumplir con algunos pedidos que tiene. Realiza esta actividad en su casa, donde tiene acondicionado un modesto taller de repostería, a pesar de esto es muy buena en su trabajo, ya que tiene muchos pedidos y siempre tiene clientes que le solicitan una determinada cantidad de postres. Se ha convertido en una buena pastelera lo cual es resultado de los 31 años que tiene trabajando de esta forma y que le da la suficiente experiencia para conocer el gusto de sus clientes. Trabaja con la ayuda de sus dos hijas, quienes la apoyan en la producción diaria. Le esta yendo muy bien debido a que su clientela ha incrementado en comparación con los que tenía cuando se inició en esta actividad, sabe que para mantener a sus clientes contentos tiene que cumplir con todos puntualmente y brindarles un producto de calidad que siempre satisfaga sus exigencias. Tiene muchos planes a futuro, pero lo que más desea es poder tener un taller más grande e implementado, donde pueda aumentar su producción. 

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y agradece a aquellas personas que lo hacen posible. Se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y está contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que son muy solidarios y responsables. 

Con el monto solicitado, 800 soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos como harina, leche, huevos, mantequillas y otros productos que necesita para preparar sus postres. Asimismo, renovará algunos materiales comprando nuevos moldes y depósitos de horneado.
texts.en:
Ana is 53 years old and she is a friendly, honest, and hard-working woman.  Regrettably, a few years ago she became a widow and she has since had to face life head-on and raise her children alone.  When it happened, three of her six children were still minors and she had to struggle to provide them with a good quality of life.  Now only her youngest son, Christian, lives with her and depends on her.

Ana makes and sells desserts (pastries and cakes) and she prepares these delicious treats daily so that she can sell them in her neighborhood and nearby regions.  She fulfills orders that she receives.  She began this business at home where she created a modest bakery.  She is very good at her work, she receives many orders, and she always has customer that order large quantities of her goods.  She has become a great baker, which is a result of her 31 years of doing this type of work and from her experience in knowing what her customers like.  She works with the help of her two daughters who support her in the daily production.  It is going very well and her customer base has grown compared to the number of customers she had when she began.  She knows that to keep her customers happy she must fulfill their orders punctually and provide them with a high-quality product that always meets their expectations.  She has big plans for the future, but what she most wants right now is to be able to have a bigger bakery with more supplies, where she can increase production.

This is her second loan from MFP and she is thankful to all the people that made it possible.  She promises to pay punctually and she is happy to belong to the community bank, as they are supportive and responsible people.

With the money from this loan, 800 soles, she will buy ingredients and supplies such as flour, milk, eggs, oils, and other things that she needs to prepare her desserts.  She will also replace some of her cookware and buy new baking molds and oven-safe baking pans.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies such as flour, milk, eggs, oils, and other products that she needs to prepare her desserts.  She will also replace some cookware and buy baking molds and oven-safe baking pans.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 52 years old, married, and blessed with three children.  He has been earning a living from rental housing business with a monthly income of KES 80,000. 

He has applied for his second loan of KES. 100,000 from KADET LTD, with which he plans to purchase more building materials such as wheelbarrow, cement and water tank for construction of the houses.  With the anticipated profit, he plans to renovate the old buildings. His future hopes are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials such as a wheelbarrow, cement and a water tank for construction of the houses.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 25 años, aprendió que para poder sobrevivir en este mundo tiene que esforzarse mucho y trabajar arduamente para mejorar su condición de vida. Es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive solo en su casa propia que está construyendo poco a poco gracias a su trabajo. 

Él se dedica al transporte de carga y de pasajeros dentro y fuera de la ciudad, posee un motocarro propio que pudo obtener como resultado del ahorro por los trabajos eventuales que realizaba y aunque no es nuevo le ha permitido salir de ciertos apuros económicos. A diario conduce por las calles de la ciudad en busca de los pasajeros a quienes transporta de un lugar a otro con la tranquilidad, serenidad y seguridad que requiere esta función. Realiza este trabajo desde hace un año y en este corto tiempo ha sabido enfrentar todo tipo de situaciones. Le agrada mucho su actividad, pues tiene la ventaja de movilizarse al lugar que desee y organizar su propio horario. Le esta yendo muy bien, ya que ha aprendido a determinar las horas y los lugares en los que siempre encuentra pasajeros disponibles, lo que le permite tener siempre clientes que transportar y eso se refleja en sus ganancias diarias. Le gustaría continuar trabajando y comprar otro vehículo para brindarle la oportunidad de trabajo a otra persona que requiera de mejorar sus ingresos.

Este es su primer crédito con la institución MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes financian su crédito y le dan el apoyo necesario para continuar con sus objetivos. Está comprometido con los integrantes del grupo que conforma, además está convencido que será un socio puntual y responsable en el pago de sus cuotas.

Con el monto solicitado, 800 soles, comprará repuestos y piezas que necesita para refaccionar su motocarro, ya que con el mal estado de las pistas y el paso del tiempo se deterioraron.
texts.en:
Carlos is 25 years old and he has learned that to survive in this world he needs to struggle and work hard to improve his living conditions.  He is single and does not have children.  He lives alone in his own house that he built little by little thanks to his work.

He transports cargo and people to and from the city.  He has his own moto-taxi that he was able to buy as a result of saving money from odd jobs.  Every day he drives in the city streets in search of passengers that he can transport from one place to another safely and peacefully. He has been doing this work for a year and in this short time he has encountered all types of situations.  He likes his work as he has the advantage of moving from one place to another and he can keep his own schedule.  It is going well and he has learned to set his hours and locations where he will always find available passengers that will permit him to transport them, and this is reflected in his daily income.  He would like to continue working and buy another vehicle so he can have the opportunity to work with another person and increase his income.

This is his first loan with MFP and he is thankful to the people that are financing the loan.  They are giving him the support he needs to continue with his goals.  He is committed to the group and he will be punctual and responsible in paying off his loan.

With this loan, 800 soles, he will buy replacement parts that he needs to repair his moto-taxi, because the poor conditions of the roads has caused it to deteriorate over time.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts that he needs to repair his moto-taxi.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Soliboy

texts.en:
Soliboy is from Tajikistan. It’s a country where one can disconnect from the noise and appreciate the beauty of nature, since its scenery is very beautiful. Soliboy loves his country very much. He is 46 years old, married and has 3 children.

To make a living, he sells food items in the shop. He has been engaged in his business for 10 years and earns money from these activities. He is requesting a loan of 2000 USD which will be used to buy more food items for sale at his store. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To buy food items to increase the assortment of inventory at his store.

loans.name: Chenda's Group

texts.en:
Chenda, age 42, is a married mother of six children, five of whom are still dependent on her as they are still in school. She manages her household through a duck-raising business, primarily selling duck eggs. She has been engaged in this business for five years. 

Chenda has been with VisionFund (Kiva partner) for five cycles. The past loans, which she has completely repaid, have enabled her to earn a decent income to support the family's food expenses and her children's education. 

Now, Chenda has formed a group of two female members to apply for a new loan. She and her fellow member are requesting 1,400,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR respectively. 

As the group leader, Chenda will use her portion of the loan to buy duck feed for her duck-raising business. She hopes to raise her ducks well so they will lay more eggs in order to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy duck feed for her duck-raising business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is from Samburu. She is 34 years old and is a married mother. She lives in a rental house and has two children. She has a business selling seasonal fruits and vegetables. She makes deliveries to homes, house by house, because she has an established customer base.

Nancy has been paying for the educational expenses of her children with a lot of effort, by selling tomatoes, lettuce, onions and fruit. She comments that her work requires a lot of sacrifice because it's not easy to go out into the streets to sell. Her goal is to have her children become well-educated so that they will not have to suffer the hardships that she has experienced.

Nancy has approached Yehu Microfinance to ask for a loan that will help her to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables to sell. She is grateful to Yehu Microfinance and to Kiva for this great assistance that they are providing, as this loan will be a big help to her.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Phanna's Group

texts.en:
Age 38, Phanna is a married mother of four children. She runs a small stall where she sells pork, beef, fish and ice. She has been in this business for 10 years. This is her fourth loan with Kiva partner VisionFund. She has used the past loans to provide a decent amount of food and proper shelter for her children. She also has managed to pay back the entire loan. 

Now, Phanna leads a group of two to apply for a new loan. Both of them are requesting a new loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. As the group leader, Phanna will use her porition of the loan to buy more pork, beef, fish and ice for resale. She hopes to make more income from her current business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more pork, beef, fish and ice for resale.

loans.name: Vann's Group

texts.en:
Vann is a 49-year-old mother of six children who are students at the local public school. She is a rural villager from the Thmor Koul district in the province of Battambang. 

To support the daily food expenses of her household, Vann has been working on three hectares of land where she farms rice. She has been farming for 10 years and also supplements her income by raising two pigs and one cow. Her main challenge is the drought, which makes her crops fruitless. 

Vann's group consists of two female members, both second-time borrowers with Kiva partner VisionFund. The past loans that Vann has paid back have enabled her to better support her family, especially her children's education. 

Now, Vann leads her group to take out a new loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. She will use her portion of the loan to pay to plow, harrow and sow her paddy rice. She hopes to double her income so she can afford to keep all of her children in school until they reach a higher level of education.

loans.use: To pay to plow, harrow and sow her paddy rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase home appliances, textile raw materials and fabrics for sale.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is 41 and married, and she lives in her own house in Samburu. She lives with her husband and six children, five of whom attend school. 

She raises hens. She tells us that she has been doing this work for some time, so she has a well-formed client base. She is a woman who is hardworking and enterprising, a fighter. She has always worked, and she is not afraid to take on a challenge. She says that thanks to her husband's help and her work, she is getting ahead with a lot of effort and sacrifice.

Saumu is seeking a loan to invest in the purchase of hens to raise in her coop so that she can increase her income and attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase hens.

loans.name: Enongninmon Antoine

texts.fr: Enongninmon Antoine est âgé de 48 ans et vit au Bénin. Enongninmon Antoine a très peu fréquenté l’école. Enongninmon Antoine est marié à une marchande du nom de Justine. Le couple a six enfants à leur charge, tous scolarisés. Parmi les enfants, il y a un qui n’est pas leur propre enfant. Enongninmon Antoine vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme, les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Enongninmon Antoine mène comme activité depuis une trentaine d’année, la soudure. Parallèlement à cette activité, Enongninmon Antoine vend des tôles dans son atelier. Enongninmon Antoine s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Enongninmon Antoine sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Enongninmon Antoine is 48 years of age, and lives in Benin. He did not attend school for very long, and is married to a retailer called Justine. The couple has six children under their care, all of whom are at school. One of these children is not their own child. 

Enongninmon Antoine lives with his wife and children and, together with his wife, covers the various household expenses. To provide for his family, he has worked for 30 years as a welder. In addition to this business, he also sells sheet metal in his workshop. 

Enongninmon Antoine gets his supplies in a city in Benin. In order to satisfy his customers and increase his turnover and income, he has requested his fourth loan from Alidé. This loan will definitely allow him to increase his business levels, as well as to make more profits.

loans.use: To buy sheet metal.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa earns her living selling consumer products from her shop, which is located in the area where she lives. She also stocks clothes in her store. 

This is her first loan with this institution. Mejumaa will use the loan to buy beans and maize flour as well as clothes for sale. She asks for this loan so she can continue to improve her business. 

Mejumaa will use the profits to continue to buy supplies and in this way increase her income. Her dream is to have a wholesale business and in this way offer her clients better service. 

Mejumaa is a very hardworking person and is happy and grateful for the opportunity she is being offered. She is a mother of three children and works hard to ensure that she provides for them.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize flour as well as clothes for sale.

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Phal is a permanent resident of the Kandal Stoeung district of Kandal province, Cambodia. His family consists of four members, including his wife and his two children. 

He is a rice farmer on more than one hectare of farmland, from which he is able to earn about 8 US dollars per day. The main challenge for his family is the dropping price of his crop, which affects his income for supporting the household's daily expenses. 

Phal has never been with VisionFund before. He is taking this first loan of 260 US dollars in order to pay plowing and harvesting fees. He expects to receive more yield and sell it during the mark up period for rice, so he can improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay plowing and harvesting fees.

loans.name: Mwanauru

texts.en:
Mwanauru is an entrepreneurial mother of a family and she is eager to get ahead. In her home, four years ago, she began her little store because of the necessity of helping her husband financially. His work as a farmer was going through difficult times, and he was not earning enough to cover their expenses.

In addition to the store, she sells petrol, mostly to motorcycle taxi operators. Her business is open every day and she takes care of it with the help of her children. In her store she offers groceries, grains, sugar, flour and more.

With the loan, she wants to be able to buy merchandise such as maize and wheat flour, beans, and petrol in order to improve sales and as a result, she hopes to be able to pay her loan on time and expand her store to a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as maize and wheat flour, beans and petrol to sell.

loans.name: Niyazi

texts.en:
Niyazi is 47-year-old man, an Internally Displaced Person who lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and one son. He is farmer and has been raising seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 10 years. During these years Niyazi gained enough skills and experience  to run the business. He chose this crop business because it  is profitable and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. 

People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy; many national dishes made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table in the Azerbaijan family and also used to make fresh punch. Niyazi usually sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 110 AZN.

As this products are in high demand, Niyazi wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for 1000 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Yan is a 58-year-old married mother of nine children, originally from the Kror Kor district of Pursat province. She earns a living from buying fishes to make fish-paste (paste of fermented fish) for sale. Her husband is not only assisting her in selling the fish-paste but also catches fishes for sale. They have been involved in this business for 10 years. 

Yan has joined with Kiva partner VisionFund for two cycles and has paid back the entire loans with success. From the past loans, she has managed to buy a small boat for supporting her husband's business. Now she is applying for the third loan of 2,000,000 KHR to purchase more fishes to make more fish-paste. She hopes to make it timely and sell at a high price so as to better support her living condition.

loans.use: To purchase more fishes to make more fish-paste.

loans.name: Ivanna

texts.ru:
Иванна замужем. У них с мужем есть четырехлетний сын Любомир.  Иванна работает в магазине «Астория»  товароведом. Она имеет стабильную зарплату каждый месяц.

Иванна и ее молодая семья получила старый дом от  бабушки. Они уже сделали там основную часть работы: поменяли окна, провели новую электропроводку и газ. Иванна очень любит свою семью и заботится о ней. Она добрая и внимательная. Иванна хочет чтобы ее муж и дети жили в хороших условиях.

Иванна просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 5000 гривен, чтобы доделать ремонт в доме - поменять обои, покрасить стены, пр.
texts.en:
Ivanna is married and has a four-year-old son. She works as a stock clerk in "Astoria", a local shop. This provides her with a stable monthly income. 
Recently, Ivanna and her family received an old house from her grandmother. They've already made numerous repairs to the house, such as replacing the windows, putting through new wiring and gas. 
Ivanna loves and cares for her family very much. She wants them to live in a good and healthy environment and, therefore, is asking for a loan of 5,000 grivnas in order to finish repairing their new home. These repairs will include changing the wallpapers, painting the walls, and so forth.

loans.use: to repair her house: change the wallpapers, paint the walls, etc.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is 42 years old and lives in a small village of the Telavi district. She is married and has two sons (15 and 19 years old) and a father-in-law in her family.  

Her husband is a car dealer and gets a monthly income. Maia’s father-in-law is provided with a retirement pension. 

Maia is involved in dairy farming. In particular, she owns three milking cows and two calves. She produces yogurt and sells it locally. Her sons help Maia to run their family business.

Maia has applied for this loan to increase the number of cows. With the requested loan she plans to purchase two milking cows. This will allow Maia to receive more milk for her dairy and increase the sales. She will be able to expand her dairy business and make it more profitable. This will give Maia an opportunity to improve her family's living conditions and insure a better future for them.

loans.use: to purchase two milking cows.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is 29 years old, hardworking and dedicated to his own business. He is an Internally Displaced Person and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and two children. He is a farmer and has been raising seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 10 years. He chose this business because it  is profitable and his fresh crop is in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy; many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table in an Azerbaijan family and also used to make fresh punch.

Ramil sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 80 AZN. His wife actively helps him to raise the crops.

As these products are in high demand, Ramil wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for 2000 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. Also he would like to buy 10 sheep.

loans.use: to buy buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers, and 10 sheep

loans.name: Gulsanam

texts.en:
Gulsanam is 57 years old and a married woman with four children. She is an Internally Displaced Person and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Gulsenem has been breeding cattle and milk cows for 20 years. She was a housewife and her husband is on a pension. 

Gulsenem usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then resells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 130 AZN and this business is only one source of financial income in her family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Gulsenem also keeps milk cows for personal use and for selling milk to neighbors.  

She wants to expand her business and improve living conditions of her family. She applied for a 1500 AZN loan to purchase two cattle, one milk cow and fodder.

loans.use: to buy two cattle, one milk cow and fodder

loans.name: Sultonmurod

texts.en:
Sultonmurod is 32 years old. He is a hard-working man with a great desire to be successful in his business and his life. His partner is a housewife. They have two children, who they love very much.

Sultonmurod sells eggs in the local market. The market where Sultonmurod works is situated in the centre of his region. He began working this way over two years ago because he needed to earn money. He is the only bread winner in the family. This is his first loan with Imon International. He is asking for a loan to buy goods such as eggs to develop his business. He promises to make his repayments on time. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy goods such as eggs to develop his business

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is applying for a new Kiva loan, and it is the fifth which she has received from Yehu Microfinance. With this new investment she will purchase wheat flour, sugar, rice and maize flour, which are the main requests her customers have made of her during this season when her sales usually increase. 

With Tabu's other Kiva loans, she was able to increase her number of customers and the products she offers so as to make her best sales. She has the following message for her financiers: “I am very grateful to Kiva and Yehu Microfinance. I hope to continue prospering with your financial support.”

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar, rice and maize flour.

loans.name: Inna

texts.ru:
Инна – торговый предприниматель из Мелитополя. Она торгует на одном из крупных местных рынков, продавая детскую и подростковую одежду. У нее есть свое торговое место, опыт работы составляет уже около 15 лет. 

Инна планирует вложить кредит в размере 4 000 гривен в закупку товара к школьному сезону. С середины августа многие родители школьников и студенты начинают готовиться к предстоящему учебному году и стараются приобрести все необходимые товары и вещи на местных украинских рынках. Инна знает об этой тенденции и хотела бы разнообразить свой ассортимент, чтобы ей было, что предложить потенциальным покупателям в этом сезоне.
texts.en:
Inna is an entrepreneur from Melitopol, Ukraine. She sells children's and teen's clothing on one of the large local markets. She's run this business for 15 years and owns her own sales point. Inna plans to invest 4,000 grivnas into buying new goods for the school season. 

From the middle of August, many parents begin preparing their children for school and start buying all the goods and school-related paraphernalia on local markets. Inna is aware of this tendency and wants to diversify her inventory in order to meet the expected demand.

loans.use: to purchase goods for sale prior to the new school season.

loans.name: Mansur

texts.en:
Mansur is married and has three children for whom he has always wanted to provide a good quality of life. His wife is a nurse and tries to help her husband in every way. Mansur’s parents live with him. As he has large family, so he must work hard. It’s for this reason that he 10 years ago began his own business selling telephone mobiles. Also he repairs computers and telephone mobiles. 

Thanks to his good service, he has managed to gain many customers. He is asking for a loan to buy goods such as telephone mobiles for widening the  assortment of his goods.

In this way he will increase his income, which will allow him to offer his children and wife a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for getting ahead.

loans.use: To buy goods such as telephone mobiles for widening his assortment.

loans.name: Faida

texts.en:
Faida, 30, is married to Karega; they have five children; two are attending secondary school and three elementary school.

Faida started out as a charcoal merchant over two years ago. She started out with some money she’d saved up working as a poultry farmer for several years. They currently have a large clientele in the community because of the good service they offer in their store.

She’s asking for the loan to buy charcoal to stock the store and provide a wider variety for her customers.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to stock the store

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 49 years old and lives in the town of Nebbi in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has five children with four of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Alfred has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells  clothes. 

To help expand his business, Alfred has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes like dresses and shoes for resale, and will help Alfred to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children and cover other family needs. Alfred hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business by adding in more other types of clothes like children's clothes. 

Alfred is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Alfred who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes like dresses and shoes for resale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, age 42, is married and has seven children. She has been running a vegetable stall for over ten years. It is located in a strategic place, which, with great effort, she has stocked with a variety of fruits and vegetables.

She is a person who has always liked working in order to help her husband with the household expenses. It is a business activity that she has always liked doing. Her mother is the one who taught her how to earn a living honourably. 

The loan she is requesting from Yehu is to stock her stall with more fruits and vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, potatoes and cabbages. Her objective for doing this is to get greater income that will allow her family to improve their standard of living.  It is also to send her children to school so that they improve every day.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, potatoes and cabbages.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick used his previous loan to buy more spare parts to sell in his bicycle shop.  Today he is requesting a new loan to buy more rims, peddles and bicycle spokes for his bicycle repair business.  This will allow him to have a stock of inventory, get discounts for quick payment and offer better services to his customers who have become accustomed to his shop.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts to sell in his bicycle shop.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude used her first Kiva loan to purchase goats for her butcher shop. She is now applying for a Kiva loan to establish a motorcycle transport business and purchase a motorcycle.

Her message to Kiva lenders is the following: “I am very grateful for the opportunity you gave me to invest in my business; it’s something one wants you to be aware of and that you continue supporting us so that we can get far.I know that’s what I will accomplish.”

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma began her sale of fruits and vegetables out of the need to be useful in her life and independent, with the goal of giving her children better living conditions and teaching them responsibility. Her business is located in their compound, and has been running for the last ten years. Her husband helped her with the capital; he is a farmer. Most of the vegetable supplies are made by her husband.  She is getting good returns.  

Fatuma will use the loan that she is applying for to pay the school fees for her form one son. Her dream is to see her children become professionals. Fatuma hopes to increase her income through this requested loan.

loans.use: to pay the school fees for her form one son.

loans.name: Anvarjon

texts.en:
Anvarjon is 31 years old. He is married and has a son to whom he has always wanted to provide a good quality of life. It’s for this reason that he, ten years ago, began own business as a musician and singer. He is one of the best musicians of his town. Every one who listen his music enjoys from it.  He has managed to gain many customers.  He also earns additional income from animal husbandry. Since he’s had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improving; now his son is able to get a good education and his financial challenges are being solved little by little. He is asking for a loan to buy musical instruments to improve his business.

In this way his business will have the opportunity to provide a better service and to increase his income, which allowed him to offer his son and wife a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy musical instruments.

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural area of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia, Savy is a 27-year-old married mother of one daughter who is still under school age. She and her husband earn a living as rice farmers. They also earn additional income by working as paid workers, which they have done for several years. Their current business earns them almost 20,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. They manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Savy’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. Savy is in her second cycle with VisionFund. The first loan has helped her relieve the financial burden of everyday expenses for her family and keep some money as savings for building a house. Now she is leading her group to request a second loan. As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to plow the rice field. She hopes this loan will help her earn more income to build on her savings. Her goal is to fulfill her dream of having a decent house to live in.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Nat's Group

texts.en: Living under a wooden house, Nat is a 40-year-old mother of four dependent children (two daughters and two sons). Two of them are still in school, while the remaining two are helping the family's business. Primarily, her source of income is from her 3.5-hectares of rice cultivation. To add more income, she also raises pigs at home and her husband catches fish for sale. She has been engaged in this business for 25 years and earns about 14,000 KHR per day. Nat's group consists of five members. All of them are first-time borrowers and requesting the same amount: 1,000,000 KHR each. Leading this group, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland, and pig feed. She hopes to multiply her income from her current business to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and pig feed.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es: El Sr. Cirilo tiene se dedica a la Agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa y yuca y maíz en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Abapo,  este préstamo es el su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  el Sr. Cirilo va a utilizar  este préstamo para la siembra de maíz y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir, el Sr. Cirilo enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios Para mejorara la calidad de vida del cliente y de su familia ya que el corre con todos los gastos del hogar, es una persona  responsable y trabajador se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Cirilo earns his living growing a variety of vegetables such as potatoes, yucca, and maize on his farm in the community of Abapo.  This is his first loan with this institution. He is going to use it to prepare the ground for his maize crop by buying the necessary supplies. He also needs it to be able to subsist. 

The biggest challenge that Cirilo faces is bad weather which on many occasions ruins his crops. He will use any profit he makes to improve his life and that of his family. He is the only breadwinner. Cirilo is a responsible, hardworking person who is grateful to the institution for the help it brigs him.

loans.use: To buy supplies to prepare the ground for his maize crop

loans.name: Kon's Group

texts.en:
Kon, age 32, is a mother of four school-age children who are attending the primary school in the local area. She makes a living for her children's sake from the rice farm that she grows as the main source of income. To add up more income, she also raises chickens at home while her husband produces palm sugar and catches fishes for sale. Having been this business for several years, she is able to earn about 11,000 KHR per day. 

Kon's group consists of three female members; this is the third loan cycle for Kon, the second loan cycle for one of her fellow group members, and the first loan for the remaining member. The past two loans have helped Kon to sustain her chicken-raising business and to buy a boat for supporting her husband's fishing business. 

Now, leading this group for the new loan, Kon will use her portion to buy a casting net for the fish-catching business of her husband and to fix the boat. She hopes that her husband can catch more fishes for sale so as to increase their income to maintain a good standard of living for her family and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy a casting net and fix the boat.

loans.name: Chreng's Group

texts.en:
A young mother of two children, who are the students, Chreng is twenty years old, residing in the Kandieng district of Pursat province. To tackle her family's financial burden in raising her children, she generates her income from one and half hectares of rice-growing farmland. The main challenge for her business is the low yields caused by the shortage of water supply for her paddy field and the insects. Her current business earns her about 15,000 KHR per day and of this she saves about 1,000 KHR per day.  

Chreng has just joined VisionFund (Kiva partner) this cycle, the same as her co-member.  Her group is composed of two female members and she is the group leader.  She is applying for 200,000 KHR while her fellow group member is requesting 600,000 KHR.  For her, the loan will be used to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She expects to get a good yield and make more money in order to sustain her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kwale in the coastal region of Kenya. She is married and has three children. Two of which attend school.

For the past five years, Bintihamisi has been working hard to manage her kiosk, which sells flour, juice, sugar, rice and other goods. She has an extension outside her kiosk where she sells vegetables.

To help expand her business, Bintihamisi has requested a loan of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings from Yehu. The loan will be used to buy maize flour and vegetables, this will help Bintihamisi generate greater profits.

Bintihamisi hopes that in the future she will be able to set up a very good and well stocked retail shop.

loans.use: to buy maize flour and vegetables.

loans.name: Soven's Group

texts.en:
Aged 35 years old, Soven is married and also a mother of three children who are the students in a local school. She manages one and half hectares of farmland with her husband for rice cropping in order to earn more income for her children's sake. Together with her husband, she can earn 10,000 KHR per day. For her, the main challenge is the unpredictable weather (floods/droughts), which lowers her yields. 

There are three female members in Soven's group including her and it is the first loan cycle for all of them.  They are applying for 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and a portion of it to buy pigs for raising as the extra income. She hopes to earn more income from her current businesses to improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland and pigs for raising.

loans.name: Zubaydullo

texts.en: Zubaydullo is 22 years old and married. He sells industrial goods such as umbrellas, needles, cosmetics, chaplets, etc. to earn a living. He has been in the business for one year. His wife helps him with the business. He dreams of expanding his business and becoming prosperous in the future. He needs a loan of 2,000 USD to buy industrial goods in order to further develop his business. He will look for your help.

loans.use: To buy industrial goods for resale

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Pheap, 30, is from a rural village located in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province. She is married with three children: one daughter and two sons, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. 

Pheap is a rice farmer on a 2-hectare piece of farmland and supplements her family’s income by selling grocery items such as sugar, salt and eggs, etc., while her husband is a motor repairer in the local area and sometimes works for others for a fee to help generate extra income for the family. Having been in this business for several years, together they can earn about 24,000KHR (Cambodian riels) per day and can manage to save about 10,000KHR each day after daily expenses.

Pheap has been a member of Kiva’s partner VisionFund for two loan cycles and completely paid back the past loans, which have helped improve her family's living conditions. The other group member is a new member with VisionFund. Now leading her group of two to request a loan, Pheap will use her portion to buy fertilizers for the farmland. She hopes to increase her income from the current business so as to set aside some money to build a grocery stall for her grocery business and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for the farmland.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch is 57 years old and lives in a rural area of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. She is a widowed mother of four children. Touch has struggled to feed her family by farming rice. Having been in this business for 20 years, she is able to earn about KHR24,000 (Cambodian riels) per day to meet the family’s needs and manages to save about KHR6,000 each day for the future. 

This is the first loan for Touch’s group with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She is leading her group of three to request a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials for building a latrine such as cement, bricks and a toilet bowl, etc., and use a portion of it to pay for labor costs. She hopes this loan will enable her family to have a clean latrine to get healthy and also improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy materials for building a latrine.

loans.name: Koeurn's Group

texts.en:
Koeurn, aged 28, lives in a rural area of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Cambodia. He is married with one daughter, who is still dependent on him. He has earned a living through farming rice and working as a paid construction worker for several years, while his wife has been a garment worker for one year. With the current businesses, together they are able to earn approximately US$4 per day to feed the family’s needs.

Koeurn’s group consists of three people who have been members of VisionFund for one loan cycle. The first loan, which he successfully paid back, has helped him better support the family. Now, Koeurn and the other two members are requesting a loan with VisionFund of KHR160,000 each. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy a latrine bowl, tile draining and sewage items, etc., to construct a proper latrine. He hopes this loan will help his family have a healthy latrine for an improved life.

loans.use: To buy materials for a latrine.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and both her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She sells second-hand clothes at the market .She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in business for less than  one year. 

Fatuma works six days a week .She has requested a loan of 100,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of second-hand clothes. She generates additional income through selling sweet potatoes.  Her major business challenges are transportation, seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations are  to  own a fully stocked shop selling used clothes  and also  buy a plot of land. She lives in a  rented house and the  family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.  Her major expenses include  rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bale of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Akmaljon

texts.en:
Akmaljon is 35 years old. He and his wife are happy and have three children. He is very hardworking and kind-natured. He has a lot of friends and all of them love him very much.

Akmaljon has been farming for 16 years, producing rice. His produce is sold at the local market in the city. With the previous loan he obtained, Akmaljon was able to invest in his crops. He has additional income from animal husbandry. 

In order to provide his business with the needed attention, Akmaljon is currently requesting another loan in the amount of 14,000 somoni so that he can buy rice and cattle to improve his business. He hopes to generate more income and take advantage of the high prices. He and his family await your support.

loans.use: To buy rice and cattle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 10 dozen pairs of underwear, 6 dozen pieces of clothing, and 5 dozen pieces of clothing of different styles.

loans.name: Adankpeji Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of seven members, all female. The minimum age in this group is 21 years whereas the maximum age is 45 years. Six members are married with children whereas one is single. They sell plastic products, ceremic bowls, children's wear and underwear. The plastic product are shown in the photograph. The women all live in the same neighborhood, so they know each other very well. This is their 1st loan cycle with ID-Ghana but they have been together as a group for two years.  

Doris is 31 years old; she sells plastic bowls and underwear. She is married to a fisherman and they have three children. She also supports the sale of fish her husband catches. Her profit for a month is 90 Ghana cedis and she uses part for family expenses and other part for reinvestment. She needs this loan to improve business.

Together they need a total amount of 1900 Ghana cedis to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy more plastic bowls and underwear to sell to customers.

loans.name: Elchu

texts.en:
Elchu is 60 years old and lives in Bolnisi district. His family consists of four members: his wife, his son, his daughter-in-law and himself. The family is involved in animal husbandry. In particular they have 8 milking cows, 6 calves and 160 sheep. Elchu’s wife milks the cows and produces cheese. The cheese is sold at the local open market. Elchu sells calves and sheep as well. He has 30 years of experience in this business.

Elchu requested a loan to have lung surgery. With this loan he will be able to solve his health problems and develop his farming better. His physical health will help Elchu to expand his cattle-breeding business and make it more profitable. All members of the family will be able to improve their living conditions. Elchu awaits your support.

loans.use: to have lung surgery

loans.name: Mansurjon

texts.en:
Mansurjon is an enterprenurial person who is married and has four children.  He has been busy with animal husbandry more than 12 years. Little by little with the passing of the years, he has perfected his knowledge. Thanks to the animals' good condition, he has managed to win a large quantity of customers for his business. He sells his animals in the local market and has many customers. 

Mansurjon is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. In this way he will be able to offer his customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing his household with good earnings. He awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle to develop his business

loans.name: Greta

texts.en:
Greta is 33 years old and is married with five children ranging in age from four to 13 who attend school. She is a member of the Egyptian vulnerable ethnic minority community of central Albania. Greta has been working since she was ten years old when she started with her mother selling used items like so many others in her community. “The profit has been okay,” Greta says, “yet, not enough to cover for all expenses of our family of seven.” 

Greta is requesting a loan from Kiva through VisionFund Albania to purchase raw textile fabric and material to sell. Raw fabric is very much in demand in Albania because it is cheaper for people to purchase fabric and then have dressmakers sew custom clothing. Greta has dreams for her children to continue their education and even attend university. Her dreams would not be fulfilled if she did not start putting some money aside now. For this matter, she is seeking potential lenders’ understanding.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and material to sell

loans.name: Muattar

texts.en:
Muattar is 36 years old, married, and has three children. Muattar and her husband try to provide their children with high quality living conditions. Her husband helps with her animal husbandry business, which she has been doing for 16 years.  

Muattar is requesting a loan for 14,000 somoni, which she will use to buy cattle for developing her business. Each month she will make her payment on time.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for developing her business.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: La Señora Marisol  tiene  22 años y está casada con el Señor Carlos  por más de 4 años, tanto Marisol como Carlos se dedican a la producción de leche y su posterior venta a una empresa que elabora toda clase de productos lácteos. La señora Marisol  vive en la zona de Maica Chica en Cochabamba,  es una zona bastante alejada de la ciudad y descubrimos muchas necesidades que tienen los lecheros de esa zona. La señora Marisol necesita el crédito para poder construir un comedero para alimentar mejor a su ganado lechero. Marisol nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es continuar con la producción de leche como lo hace hasta ahora, ver a sus hijos tener un futuro favorable y que algún día tenga suficiente ganado para dejarles una herencia que les ayude en la vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Marisol is 22 years old and has been married to Sr. Carlos for more than four years. They both work on a dairy farm producing milk which is then sold to a business that makes many types of dairy produce. Marisol lives in the Maica Chicago area of Cochabamba. It's a long way from the town, and the milk producers in the area have many needs. Marisol is seeking a loan to buy a feeding trough so her cows can feed more easily. 

Her dreams are to continue working as a dairy farmer as she has done up to now, to see that her children have a good future, and to one day have enough cows for her children to inherit.

loans.use: To make a feeding trough for cows

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 34 years old and is married with five children, three of whom are currently in school. He lives in the town of Nebbi in the Arua region of Uganda. For the past three years, James has been working hard to manage his small business where he sells clothes and other items such as plates and flasks. 

James is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more clothing, flasks, and plates to sell. His loan will help him generate greater profit and pay for his children's school fees. James hopes that in the future he will be able to increase the market for his products through having a greater variety of products. 

James is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like James who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy flasks, clothing, and plates

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 38 years old and is married with four children, two of whom are currently in school. He lives in the town of Paidah in the Arua region of Uganda. For the past nine years, Moses has been working hard to manage his small business where he sells clothes. 

Moses is requesting a 3,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more clothes to sell. His loan will help Moses generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Moses hopes that in the future he will be able to start another side business. 

Moses is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Moses who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Mwatela

texts.en:
Mwatela is married and is from the village of Samburu. He operates a food stall where he sells foods such as chapati (flat bread), french fries, and sausages. He has been operating this business for 15 years. The food stall is located in a strategic zone of the market, which helps him to have good clientele.  

Mwatela is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy meat, eggs, condiments, and wheat flour. He appreciates the opportunity for the loan and the good services that the institution provides him for the growth of his small business.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his business such as meat, eggs, condiments, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Evelin

texts.es:
Evelin tiene 27 años, su pareja es Rodrigo, desde hace 8 años. Viven en la casa de sus suegros donde tiene acondicionado un pequeño espacio donde habita junto a sus dos hijos de 7 y 4 años, quienes son su principal motivo de trabajo, ya que desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida y convertirlos en personas de provecho para la sociedad.

Su actividad laboral es la venta de ropa, siendo sus clientes sus amigos, vecinos, familiares y otras personas conocidas. La venta es al crédito y realiza el cobro de manera diaria, semanal o quincenal, dependiendo del acuerdo al que haya llegado con sus clientes. Trabaja sola, desde hace 3 años y en turnos rotativos, aunque generalmente lo hace por las tardes. Paralelamente trabaja como obrera en un aserradero de la ciudad. Le agrada mucho su actividad porque le permite conocer nuevas personas y generar sus propios ingresos en sus ratos libres. Ha visto que las ganancias son muy buenas y es por eso que desea consolidar su negocio y con el paso del tiempo tener una pequeña tienda de ropa en algún local o en su vivienda.

Este es el préstamo número 4 con MFP y está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante. Se compromete a pagar sus cuotas mensuales de manera puntual y continuar trabajando con mucha responsabilidad junto a los miembros de su banco comunal. 

Con el monto solicitado, 3000 soles, comprará un lote de prendas conformada por polos, pantalones, blusas, camisas y shorts para ponerlos a la venta entre sus clientes.
texts.en:
Evelin is 27 years old, and Rodrigo has been her life partner for eight years.  They live in her parents-in law’s house, where they have set up a small space.  They live there with their two children, ages seven and four.  The children are her main motivation for working.  She wishes to give them a better quality of life and have them become productive citizens.

Her work activity is selling clothes.  Her customers are her friends, neighbors, acquaintances, and other people she knows.  She sells on credit, and she collects daily, weekly, or biweekly according to the agreement she has come to with her customers.  She has worked alone on rotating shifts for three years.  She generally works in the afternoons.

At the same time, she works at a sawmill in the city.  This work pleases her a lot because it allows her to meet new people and generate her own income in her free time.  She has seen that her earnings are very good, and that is why she wishes to strengthen her business, and, in time, have a small clothing store in some location or in her house.

This is her fourth loan with MFP.  She is very grateful for the loan opportunity she is being given and for the financial support that she needs in order to get ahead.  She pledges to make her monthly payments punctually and to continue working responsibly together with the members of her communal bank.

She will use the requested 3,0000 soles to buy a bundle of clothes containing polo type shirts, pants, blouses, shirts, and shorts.  She will sell them to her customers.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of clothes containing polo type shirts, pants, blouses, shirts, and shorts.

loans.name: Jesusita

texts.es: La Sra. Jesusita casada de 36 años de edad, tiene viviendo por más de 9 años en casa de interés social, ella se dedica a realizar labores domesticas desde hace 9 meses. Su esposo se dedica a los trabajos de construcción; ellos desean ampliar su vivienda, por lo cual solicitan un crédito para iniciar barda ya que la inseguridad se ha incrementado estos últimos años, quieren tener su barda para sentirse más seguros.
texts.en: 36-year old Sra. Jesusita is married and lives in social housing. She has worked as a servant for the last nine months. Her husband works in construction. They wish to extend their home so they are seeking a loan to to start building a wall as safety has become an issue in recent years. They want a wall so they can feel more secure.

loans.use: To build a wall around the house

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is from the Samburu, Kenya. She is a married mother of a three-year-old child. Beatrice works as a merchant and is a young, hardworking and entrepreneurial person who works in order to provide her child with everything he needs. Her small store has all the day-to-day necessities for her neighbors and other people who stop in. 

Beatrice is requesting a loan to purchase dairy products, vegetables, produce, bread, and milk to stock her business and offer her customers greater variety. Her goal is to have a larger store and to continue working and helping her family.

loans.use: to purchase dairy products, vegetables, produce, bread, and milk.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu, age 48, is a widow who lives in Samburu. For the past six months, she has been selling fish that she buys from suppliers. In addition, Tabu also sells dry fish which contributes to her other source of income. She has everything that she needs in order to do this work. Tabu's job has helped her to help her family with household costs and to get them ahead. She is a very hardworking person who has always taken pains to succeed.
