Tabu is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish. Her loan will help her greatly to boost her business. Tabu thanks the Yehu Microfinance for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish

loans.name: Raif

texts.en:
Raif is a Romani man from one of the two most vulnerable ethnic minority communities of central Albania. He is 56 and married. Raif has only one child, a 19-year-old who never attended school. 

Raif has been in the industry of selling used clothes for almost 15 years now and is somewhat happy. In addition to this, he has been purchasing used electrical appliances, repairing them himself and selling them later. Nobody else in his community or within the same entrepreneurial area provides repairing services. He has the talents of repairing electrical appliances and has been generating an income through this activity that he wouldn’t otherwise, he said. 

Raif is applying for a loan from Kiva now through VisionFund Albania in order to purchase more electrical appliances and used clothes that will enable him to increase his profit. With the generated income, he plans on improving the family living conditions.

Raif wants to thank all lenders for their generosity and kindness.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes and electrical appliances for sale.

loans.name: Muche

texts.en:
Muche buys and sells products brought from Samburu. She is married and has five children. They help in the business, and they go to school.

She is a very hardworking person. She has had a retail shop for more than one year. Through her hard work, she has been able to give her children everything they need to have a life without the deprivations or limitations that she had to experience.

She is requesting the loan to buy drinks, sodas, food and other supplies. This way she will be able to continue growing her business, and soon she will be a great small-scale businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy drinks, sodas, food and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice crop.

loans.name: Marlyse Hortense

texts.fr: Hortense est une jeune femme de 37 ans fiancée, mère d'enfants. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la capitale  depuis 15 ans ou elle commercialise les vivres frais (tomates, poivrons, et piment...) en fonction des saisons. Cette activité lui permet d'aider son conjoint à resoudre certaines petits besoins quotidiens. son activté fonctionne normalement, mais ne rapporte pas beaucoup parce qu'elle achète sa marchantise en détail pour la revendre. grace à ce crédit, Hortense pourra s'acheter ses marchandises en gros( des cajots de tomates, des filets d'oignons. ceci augmentera ses ventes et donc sa marge bénéficiaire. Elle économisera une partie de ce benefices pour aider son fiancé avec la scolarité de leurs enfants et le reste sera réinvesti dans son activté pour l'agrandir.
texts.en:
Hortense is a young woman, 37 years old, engaged to be married, and a mother with children. For fifteen years, she has been a merchant at a market in the capital where she sells fresh seasonal staple foods (tomatoes, bell peppers, chili peppers…). This business allows her to help her spouse to resolve certain day-to-day needs. 

Hortense's business is operating as usual but doesn't bring in much because she purchases her goods retail and sells them. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to purchase her goods wholesale (crates of tomatoes, bags of onions). This will increase her sales and thus her profit margins. She will save part of the profits to help her fiancé with their children's education, and the rest will be reinvested in her business to expand it.

loans.use: to purchase crates of tomatoes and bags of chili peppers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice growing business.

loans.name: Honorine

texts.fr: Honorine est  de 37 ans mariée, mère de 2 enfants de 11 et 15 ans, deux vont à l'école. Elle a aussi à sa charge une autre personne. Elle est commerçante et  exerce une activité de commerce en détail où il vend des vivres frais et secs en fonction des saisons  (ignames, couscous, tomate, légumes) dans un marché de la place depuis 3 ans. Elle aimerait agrandir son activité en allant acheter Elle même ses produits dans les brousses(  Filets d'ignames, sacs de couscous, cajots de tomates et légumes), ça lui évitera les ruptures de stocks qu'elle a tout le temps. ce crédit lui permettra non seulement de satisfaire sa clientèle déjà grandissante, mais aussi d'augmenter ses bénéfices. Bénéfices qui lui permettront d'aider en partie son époux à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, économiser pour leurs scolarités et avec le temps, réinvestir le reste dans son activité pour l'agrandir.
texts.en:
Honorine is 37 years old, married, and the mother of two children, aged 11 and 15, who go to school. She also has another person to support. She is a merchant and has a retail business where she has been selling fresh seasonal staple food (yams, couscous, tomatoes, vegetables) at a local market for three years. She would like to expand her business by buying on her own some goods from 'the bush' (bags of yams, sacks of couscous, crates of tomatoes, and vegetables). This will prevent inventory shortages that she has all the time. 

This loan will enable her not only to satisfy her already-growing customer base but also to increase her profits, which will allow her in part to help out her spouse in supporting the family, save money for their children's education, and reinvest the rest into her business to expand it over time.

loans.use: to purchase bags of yams, sacks of of couscous, and crates of tomatoes and vegetables

loans.name: Wend Goudoum Group

texts.fr:
Mme ZARATA représente le groupe WENDGOUDOUM. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. 04 vont à l’école et elle a 04 personnes en charge.

Mme fait la restauration (vente d’haricot) depuis 09ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les grande boutiques de Bissighin et au marché de Bassinko. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter 1bidon d’huile de 20l et 10plats (tines) d’haricot.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut renforcer son activité. Mme ambitionne améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et agrandir son commerce.
texts.en:
Ms. ZARATA represents the group WENDGOUDOUM. She is the married mother of four children. The oldest is 13 years old, and the youngest is 5. Four of the children go to school. She has four persons to support.

Ms. ZARATA has been in the restaurant business (selling beans) for nine years. She gets her supplies from the large shops in Bissighin and at the market in Bassinko. Her customers include men and women.

She wants to purchase a 20-liter container of oil and 10 platters of beans. 

With the profits, she wants to bolster her business. Her ambition is to improve her family's living conditions and to expand her commerce.

loans.use: to purchase a 20-liter container of oil and 10 platters of beans for her restaurant

loans.name: Songtita Group

texts.fr:
Mme MAMOUNATA  est la représentante du groupe SONGTITA.  Elle se porte bien ainsi que tout le groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de  04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 11ans  et le moins âgé a 01an 04mois.02 vont  à l’école. Elle a 04 personnes à sa charge.

Mme vend du savon  et aussi des pagnes maintenant depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au  marché  de secteur 10  en ville. Ses clients sont  les gens de son quartier.

 Mme veut  s’acheter  03 cartons de savon et 15 pièces de pagnes.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut aider son mari dans les charges familiales. Elle est contente car son commerce marche bien. Mme ambitionne ouvrir sa   propre boutique pour son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. MAMOUNATA represents the group SONGTITA. She is doing fine, as is her group. She is a married mother of four children. The oldest is 11 years old, and the youngest is a year and four months. Two of the children go to school. She has four persons to support.

Ms. MAMOUNATA has been selling soap and also 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) for ten years. She gets her supplies from the Sector 10 market in town. Her customers are people in her district.

She wants to purchase 3 boxes of soap and 15 lengths of 'pagne' cloth. 

With the profits, she wants to help out her husband in covering family expenses. She is happy because her business is going well. Her ambition is to open her own shop for her business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 boxes of  of soap and 15 lengths of 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Adjiwa Group

texts.fr: Aidé par 04 personnes dans l’exercice de son activité, Mr Adésséou est cultivateur de profession. Il exerce son activité en REGION CENTRALE  depuis 2005. Jeune homme de 28ans, célibataire et pas d’enfants en charge, Mr Adésséou responsable du groupement ADJIWA dont il fait partie il y a un moment sollicite l’aide de WAGES par un premier prêt pour s’approvisionner en outils de travail. Il voudrait à l’avenir épargner, se prendre en charge en cas de maladie et acheter un tracteur pour le labour. Les autres membres sont des femmes et des hommes qui sont dans le domaine de l’agriculture.
texts.en:
Helped by four persons in operating his business, Mr. Adésséou is a farmer by trade. He has been operating in REGION CENTRALE since 2005. A young man, 28 years old, unmarried, and without children to support, Mr. Adésséou is the official of the group ADJIWA, to which he has belonged for quite a while. He is requesting help from WAGES with an initial loan for acquiring work tools. 

For the future, he would like to save money, cover his costs in case of illness, and buy a tractor for plowing. The other members of the group are women and men who are in the same domain of farming.

loans.use: to purchase work tools for his farm

loans.name: Dieu Est Bon Group

texts.fr:
Mme ZOENABO représente le groupe DIEU EST BON. Mariée, elle est mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 29ans et le moins âgé a 10ans. 02vont à l’école et elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Mme vend de combustible et du savon depuis 07ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché deToecin. Ses clients sont les habitants de son secteur.

Elle veut s’acheter 100 boules de savon et 01 charretier de combustible.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut épargner et renforcer son activité. Mme ambitionne améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. ZOENABO is the representative of the group DIEU EST BON (God is good). She is a married mother of five children ages 10 to 29, two of whom go to school. She supports five people.

Mrs. Zoenabo has been selling fuel and soap for seven years. She buys her stock at the market of Toecin. Her customer base consists of locals. 

She plans to buy 100 balls of soap and a cartload of fuel. 

She will use her profits to bolster her savings and strengthen her activity. She wants to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 100 balls of soap and a cartload of fuel.

loans.name: Uchi

texts.en:
Uchi, 45, is from Samburu. She’s a merchant; she has had a store for six years. She is a very hardworking, enterprising person who always strives to the maximum degree to be able to help her family members and to give them everything they need to have a life with no deprivations or unmet needs.

She’s asking for the loan to buy supplies to stock her store with beverages, canned goods, baked goods and other items to continue having it well-stocked.

She is grateful for the support that Yehu Microfinance Trust and Kiva give her.

loans.use: to buy supplies to stock her store with beverages, canned goods and baked goods.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is married and has two children aged between seven years and four months. He is requesting another Kiva loan after successful repayment of the previous loan. He wants to use this loan for paying labor costs. He has been a rice farmer for seven years. The profits from the business will be used to expand the area he has been using to more hectares for his rice production. 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs in rice production.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience has been a merchant for more than 10 years. She has a well-stocked store in her house, located in Samburu.

Patience is a very hardworking and dedicated woman. She is married to Ronald and they have one child, thanks to the hard work and effort that they have put in each day to get ahead.

She started out very modestly with a small store that she used to have in her mother's house. Now, thanks to God, she has her own business. She thanks the Yehu Microfinance for the trust they have placed in her and the support that they are providing.

She is requesting a loan to stock her business with sugar, tea, soft drinks, bakery products and other items, because in this way she will have a well-stocked business.

loans.use: to stock her business with sugar, tea, soft drinks, bakery products and other items.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José tiene 20 años, es un joven emprendedor, honesto y muy trabajador. Es soltero y aún no tiene hijos porque espera consolidarse económicamente para formar su propia familia. Actualmente vive en casa de sus padres, junto a su abuela y sus dos hermanos, es a ellos a quienes dedica todo su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante para que se sientan orgullosos de él.

José trabaja en la venta de ropa, principalmente polos para varones, aunque en ocasiones vende blusas, siempre y cuando sus clientes se lo soliciten. Recibe su mercadería mensualmente, que es enviada desde la capital donde tiene un familiar que le ayuda en la elección de las prendas. Su sistema de ventas es crediticio y el cobro lo hace de manera diaria, semanal o mensual previo acuerdo con su cliente. Vende directamente entre sus familiares, amigos, vecinos y compañeros de trabajo. Realiza esta actividad desde hace 2 años en sus ratos libres o por lo general los fines de semana, ya que durante el día trabaja como diseñador gráfico. Por lo pronto, le gusta mucho ambas actividades, aunque asegura que al principio le fue difícil trabajar en la venta de ropa, ya que tenía que enfrentar los comentarios negativos y machistas de las personas que le decían que ese es un trabajo femenino. Sin embargo, ahora realiza su labor de manera óptima y sus ingresos se han incrementado. Espera algún día establecer una tienda de ropa y por otra parte, establecer con el paso del tiempo, un centro de diseño gráfico en el que pueda desarrollar su profesión.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, está muy comprometido a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas y está muy contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 800) comprará un lote de mercadería conformada por prendas de vestir masculinas como polos y pantalones.
texts.en:
José, age 20, is an enterprising, honest, and very hard-working young man.  He is single, and he does not yet have children because he hopes to become stronger financially in order to start his own family.  He currently lives in his parents’ house with his grandmother and his two siblings.  It is for them that he devotes all of his efforts and his desire to get ahead.  He does this so that they will be proud of him.

José works selling clothes, primarily men’s polo type shirts.  Sometimes he sells blouses, and he always does so when the customers request them.  He gets his merchandise monthly, and it is send to him from the capital.  He has a relative there who helps him with the selection of the clothes.  He sells on credit, and he collects daily, weekly, or monthly according to the previous agreement with his customer.  He sells directly to his relatives, friends, neighbors, and work colleagues.  He has been doing this for two years in his free time or generally on the week-ends. 

During the day he works as a graphic designer.  He likes both business activities a lot, even though it was certainly difficult to work selling clothes in the beginning.  He had to face negative and chauvinistic comments from people who told him that this was women’s work.  Nevertheless, he now works in a good way, and his income has increased.  He hopes to one day establish a clothing store, and, in time, a graphic design center where he is able to practice his profession.

This is his first loan with MFP.  He is grateful to those who make this loan possible so that he can continue with his objective.  He is very committed to making his payments punctually.  He is very happy to belong to his communal bank because all of the members are very good, kind, and supportive.

He will use the requested 800 soles to buy a bundle of merchandise consisting of men’s clothes like polo shirts and pants.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of merchandise consisting of men’s clothes like polo shirts and pants.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo continues running her goat-selling business. Thanks to her business, she is able to generate income to contribute financially, along with her husband, toward improving the economic conditions in her home and providing a good quality of life for her family.
Because her customer base is growing and is always demanding more products, Mwanakombo is seeking a loan in order to buy six goats and pay for their transport.

She hopes her business will continue to grow and she will be able to earn a good income for her home so her family will continue to enjoy a good quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase six goats and pay for their transport.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati used her previous loan to expand her existing business. Now, she is requesting a new loan to buy iron sheets and roofing nails. This would allow her to have a permanent house. 

Bahati hopes that through Kiva many people will continue to get support so they can get ahead with their projects and improve their living conditions and those of their nuclear family: a message she wanted to give her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets and roofing nails.
